cards.text: If the attached realm is razed through combat, the victorious champion is stricken with the plague. That player must draw a card for each champion in his pool, comparing the card's last digit against each champion's base level. Any whose level is higher than the digit are discarded.

cards.name: Red Jack
cards.text: This player's Ravenloft champions all gain a +2 werecreature as an ally, whether attacking or defending.

cards.name: Red Tide
cards.text: The Red Tide is a +6 undead (vampire) ally to all champions defending the attached realm. It can be discarded from the formation to kill a realm champion of base level 6 or less being used anywhere in combat.

cards.name: Treasure Vault
cards.text: An artifact from any world can be attached to this holding, and any champion defending the attached realm can use the artifact.

cards.name: Kestrel's Keep
cards.text: This player's champions and allies each gain 1 level when defending any realm in this player's formation. This holding stays attached and in play even if the attached realm is razed.

cards.name: Keep of the Dead
cards.text: If something forces the attached realm to be discarded, this holding is discarded instead, and the realm remains in play.

cards.name: Airship
cards.text: Destroys any two allies chosen by this card's player; choice does not have to be immediate. (Harmful)

cards.name: Cataclysm!
cards.text: Destroys one realm of the player's choice; that realm is discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Good Fortune
cards.text: The player of this event draws five cards immediately. (Helpful)

cards.name: Surprise Raid
cards.text: This player's champion and allies are doubled in levels for one round of battle. (Helpful)

cards.name: Labor of Legend
cards.text: One razed realm is rebuilt by a champion from the player's pool; the champion is discarded. (Helpful)

cards.name: Siege!
cards.text: Razes the first realm of every player, regardless of special powers; if a player's first realm is already razed, he ignores this event. (Harmful)

cards.name: Mutiny!
cards.text: No battles can be fought until the player's next turn. A battle in progress stops immediately with no victor; allies are discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Transformation!
cards.text: All players must discard their hands immediately and draw five new cards. (Harmful)

cards.name: Slave Revolt!
cards.text: All opposing players must discard one champion from their pool (chosen by this player). (Harmful)

cards.name: Bruce's Revenge
cards.text: This player can swap two of an opponent's realms with each other in their formation; any attached holdings are discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Fast Talking!
cards.text: Everyone is convinced all artifacts and magical items in play no longer work. All players discard all magical items and artifacts. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Barbarian's Revenge!
cards.text: All players who have four or more unrazed realms in play must discard a realm from their formation or two realms from their hand. This event is immune to limited wish. (Harmful)

cards.name: Treasure
cards.text: All monster are bribed to desert; discard all monsters in battle or pools. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Caravan
cards.text: Play only between two player's turns. The player of this event can take a turn immediately. Afterward, play continues where it left off. (Helpful)

cards.name: Ice Storm
cards.text: Destroys all champions and allies of base level 4 or less in play anywhere. (Harmful)

cards.name: Solid Fog
cards.text: Unearthly fog prevents all attacks against all players until this player's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Tarrasque
cards.text: Play on a realm. The victim may discard his pool to banish the tarrasque. If he discards nothing, however, the realm is razed and he sends the tarrasque to another player's realm, continuing the cycle. (Discard the tarrasque if no realms remain.) (Harmful)

cards.name: Black Bess
cards.text: Each player must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of the card number. Discard all champions in play whose base level is greater than this number. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dead Magic Zone
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no spells may be cast, and all artifacts and magical items are ignored. (Harmful)

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: This player can deflect a harmful event affecting only him onto any other player. (Helpful)

cards.name: Temporal Stasis
cards.text: In a multiplayer game, this event can be played to prevent one player's turn. In a two player game, this event can prevent an extra turn gained from another card such as the Caravan. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dragons Rebellious
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all dragons can cast wizard spells, stealing this power from wizards, who now cannot cast spells. (Harmful)

cards.name: Hurricane!
cards.text: This player draws three cards. All other players must discard one card. (Harmful)

cards.name: Call to Arms
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, his heroes may all use psionic power cards and blood abilities. (Helpful)

cards.name: Phantasmal Wolf
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, only allies may be used to attack or defend. Any magical items or artifacts may be attached to the allies, but all cards must be discarded when the event is over. (Harmful)

cards.name: Land Ho!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all players may play a realm currently in play, causing the original realm to be discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Provocation
cards.text: Any one player (including the event player) is forced to reshuffle his discards into his draw pile. (Harmful)

cards.name: Balance of Power
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, only his allies retain their special abilities. All other allies have only their level bonus. (Harmful)

cards.name: Assault of Magic
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all spells cast by his champions are double in level. (Helpful)

cards.name: Psionic Contrition
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no psionic power cards can be used, and champions' psionic powers don't work. (Harmful)

cards.name: Monstrous Intervention
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, only monsters can attack. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Land Rebels
cards.text: The event player can rearrange all realms in each player's formation, including his own. All holdings remain attached. (Harmful)

cards.name: Elven Rebirth
cards.text: All elves in all discard piles are brought back to life! They are added back to their draw pile, which is reshuffled. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Death of a Hero
cards.text: One hero (chosen by this player) is killed and discarded. In homage, all other players (including the event player) must discard a card. (Harmful)

cards.name: Ambush
cards.text: If on the losing side of a battle, this event allows this player to lay down enough cards to defeat the opposing champion. That champion is automatically defeated and is discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Brave Heart
cards.text: Buoyed by dreams of freedom, this player's champions are immune to offensive spells and magical items until the end of this player's next turn. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Torments of Sisyphus
cards.text: Played during combat, the champions involved must discard all attached cards. Combat begins again between the same champions. (Harmful)

cards.name: Secret War
cards.text: This player's champions are turned face down and are revealed only during combat. Once turned over, they remain face up, as are any new champions added to the pool. (Helpful)

cards.name: Covert Aid
cards.text: Place any number of allies face down beneath a champion in battle. These secret allies remain face down in battle until the champion's opponent decides not to play any more cards. The allies are then revealed and a winner is determined. (Helpful)

cards.name: Wrath of the Immortals
cards.text: Played on a champion, its base level is reduced to 1, and it loses any special powers it has. This champion must be used first to attack or defend, and the event lasts until negated or the champion is discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Titans Walk the Earth
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, one avatar may be freely played into each player's pool, ignoring the requirements for bringing out avatars. (Helpful)

cards.name: Bess's Revenge
cards.text: Each player must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of its card number. Discard all champions in play whose base level is lower than this number. (Harmful)

cards.name: Foreign Wars
cards.text: All heroes in pools are placed in Limbo until the end of their owner's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Gales at Sea
cards.text: All swimmers in combat are swept away to the Abyss. All other swimmers are sent to Limbo until the end of their owner's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Escape from the Abyss
cards.text: This event can be played during phase 3 to allow a champion in the Abyss to make an attack against a chosen champion. The losing champion is placed in the Abyss, and the winner returns to his pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Banner of the Two-Eyed God
cards.text: The attached champion's allies each gain 2 levels and are immune to offensive spells. (Def)

cards.name: Staff of Striking
cards.text: The bonus becomes +8 if attached to a cleric. (Off)

cards.name: Staff of Conjuring
cards.text: The attached champion can retrieve an ally from the discard pile during each battle it is in. If defeated, the staff is broken and sent to the Abyss. (Def)

cards.name: War Banner
cards.text: Each champion and ally of this player gains 1 level. (Def)

cards.name: Falcon Figurine
cards.text: Confers the ability to teleport; the attached champion and its allies can attack any realm, regardless of position or powers. (Def)

cards.name: Ghost Crystal
cards.text: During phase 3 the attached champion can retrieve one undead ally from the discard pile to the player's hand. (Def)

cards.name: Net of Entrapment
cards.text: This champion's opponent cannot play allies. Any already in play are discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Orb of Power
cards.text: Offensive spells, offensive magical items, and harmful events have no effect against the attached champion. (Def)

cards.name: Rings of All Seeing
cards.text: At the beginning of his turn, this player can look at one player's hand and discard a card. (Off)

cards.name: Shield of Destruction
cards.text: Absorbs the effects of one offensive spell of this player's choice played against the attached champion in combat. (Def)

cards.name: Shield of Annihilation
cards.text: Instantly annihilates one opposing enemy ally of this player's choice played against the attached campion in combat. (Off)

cards.name: Shield of Devastation
cards.text: Negates the power of one offensive magical item of this player's choice used against the attached champion in combat. (Off)

cards.name: Shield of Wickedness
cards.text: One enemy ally chosen by the shield's owner is forced to switch sides and fight for the attached champion for one round of battle. (Off)

cards.name: The Necklace
cards.text: The attached champion can cast wizard spells and is immune to offensive psionic power cards. (Def)

cards.name: Dragonslayer
cards.text: Cancels the powers of any dragon champion or ally opposing the attached champion in battle. (Off)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Swimming
cards.text: The attached champion and its allies become swimmers that can attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position. (Def)

cards.name: Horn of Blasting
cards.text: The holding of any realm the attached champion attacks is immediately discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Wand of Wonder
cards.text: Draw and discard a card each time the wand is used in combat, noting the last digit of the card's number. The wand's level bonus is equal to that digit. (Def)

cards.name: Drow Slippers
cards.text: The attached champion is considered a drow and all allies played with him are also considered drow. (Def)

cards.name: Midnight's Mask of Disguise
cards.text: The attached champion can be put into play with this magical item, even if that champion is already in play somewhere. The champion's powers are unchanged. (Def)

cards.name: Girdle of Storm Giant Strength
cards.text: Attached champion is considered a giant. (Def)

cards.name: Hammer of the Gods
cards.text: Usable only by clerics, the attached champion is immune to offensive cleric spells. (Def)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Golem Strength
cards.text: If the attached champion is victorious in an attack, all holdings in that player's formation are discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Winged Boots
cards.text: The attached champion becomes a flyer. If he is defeated in battle by a nonflying champion, he can retreat from combat to his pool instead of being discarded. (Def)

cards.name: Badge of the Wolf Nomads
cards.text: All cards used by this player that contain the word "wolf" are doubled in level. (Def)

cards.name: Dark Haven
cards.text: The attached champion is protected from all offensive spells, magical items, psionics, unarmed combat cards, and blood abilities. But his base level is halved (rounded down). (Def)

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: The spellcaster with this item can retain up to two spells after winning a round of combat to use in another battle. Only phase 4 spells can be saved. (Def)

cards.name: Pan's Pipes
cards.text: Usable only by monsters, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill monsters, flyers, or swimmers. (Def)

cards.name: The Bagpipes of Drawmij
cards.text: Usable only by wizards, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill wizards. (Def)

cards.name: Ailarond Horn
cards.text: Usable only by heroes, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill heroes. (Def)

cards.name: Lyre of Arvanaith
cards.text: Usable only by elves (including drow), the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill elves or drow. (Def)

cards.name: The Harp of Kings
cards.text: Usable only by regents, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill regents. (Def)

cards.name: The Leviathan Horn
cards.text: Usable only by giants, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill giants. (Def)

cards.name: Chimes of Chelerie
cards.text: Usable only by clerics, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill clerics. (Def)

cards.name: Xeno-Xylophone
cards.text: Usable only by psionicists, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill psionicists. (Def)

cards.name: Dragon Drums
cards.text: Usable only by dragons, the attached champion is immune to cards that instantly kill dragons. (Def)

cards.name: Scarab of Protection
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to the special powers of realms and undead champions. (Def)

cards.name: Arrow of Slaying
cards.text: This item can be used during combat to discard a champion in the pool of a player other than the opponent's. The arrow is then placed in the Abyss. (Off)

cards.name: Crossbow of Accuracy
cards.text: Once per turn, the attached champion may add 4 levels to any combat he is not involved in. (Def)

cards.name: Dagger of Venom
cards.text: Win or lose, the opposing champion is discarded at the end of a round of combat with the attached champion. Undead champions are immune to this power. (Off)

cards.name: Javelin of Lightning
cards.text: The javelin can create a +7 offensive wizard spell (in addition to its normal +2) for one round of combat. If so used, the item is then discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Mace of Disruption
cards.text: +8 vs undead. Undead champions and allies killed by the mace are placed in the Abyss instead of the discard pile. (Off)

cards.name: Scimitar of Speed
cards.text: If defending a realm, the item's level rises to 6, and the attached champion must be defeated twice in one battle before he is discarded. (Def)

cards.name: Trident of Fish Command
cards.text: The attached champion becomes a swimmer, and swimming allies cannot be played against him. (Def)

cards.name: Holy Avenger
cards.text: This sword is +10 vs. any champion with a base level of 8 or higher. (Off)

cards.name: Armies of Bloodstone
cards.text: The ally can "save" a champion - the player can withdraw his champion from combat and continue with a new one (allies and spells are discarded). The "rescued" champion cannot attack or defend until this player's next turn.

cards.name: The Iron Legion
cards.text: This ally instills fear in all opposing heroes, reducing their base level to 0 during that round of combat.

cards.name: Myrmidons
cards.text: When the Myrmidons are discarded, their player shuffles all discards back into his draw pile.

cards.name: Hornhead Saurial
cards.text: The attached champion and his allies are immune to offensive magical items of +3 or less.

cards.name: Mind Flayer
cards.text: When played, the mind flayer can immediately shift one opposing ally to its own side for that round of battle. The ally loses 1 level.

cards.name: Intellect Devourer
cards.text: Immediately destroys an opposing champion of base level 5 or less.

cards.name: Elf Galleon
cards.text: Flyer. Swimmer. All allies played after the elf galleon in this battle are also flyers and swimmers.

cards.name: Tyrol
cards.text: Tyrol can be played at any time to negate an offensive unarmed combat card. He gains 2 levels if played with a regent.

cards.name: Hell Hound
cards.text: The hell hound and all cards in this player's force are immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: Skeletal Lord
cards.text: Undead. This ally strikes fear in all opposing champions (except clerics), reducing their base level to 0.

cards.name: Skeletal Minion
cards.text: Undead. This ally and any other undead allies played with it cannot be forced to switch sides.

cards.name: Treants of the Grandwood
cards.text: The treants and all cards in this player's force are immune to all offensive wizard spells except fireball.

cards.name: Mogadisho's Horde Marches On
cards.text: If this card is on the losing side of a battle, all holdings of every player are discarded.

cards.name: Assassins
cards.text: If this card is on the losing side of the battle, it destroys one champion anywhere in play, chosen by this player.

cards.name: Halfling Mercenaries
cards.text: This ally strips any existing artifact and magical items from an opponent but has no effect on those played after them.

cards.name: Gladiators
cards.text: If played with a Dark Sun champion, the gladiators remain with that champion until he is defeated or discarded.

cards.name: Rowan
cards.text: Elf. Rowan can send one opposing ally or magical item to the Abyss.

cards.name: Ashathra
cards.text: This ally can be discarded at any time to discard one ally in play anywhere.

cards.name: Stug
cards.text: Elf. If on the losing side of a battle, Stug can rob a victorious player of his spoils of victory by allowing a player not involved in the battle to draw spoils instead.

cards.name: Galek
cards.text: This ally can draw a card from the opposing player's draw pile, playing it on this player's side if applicable or discarding it otherwise.

cards.name: Silt Stalkers
cards.text: Elves. If on the losing side of a battle, all magical items in play are shuffled back into their respective draw piles.

cards.name: Night Runners
cards.text: Elves. If on the winning side of a battle, this player can choose one magical item, artifact, or rule card in play anywhere to be discarded.

cards.name: Athasian Sloth
cards.text: When played in battle, the opposing player must immediately discard two cards from his hand.

cards.name: Wijon
cards.text: Dwarf. Wijon can double the level of one ally played after him (choice need not be immediate).

cards.name: Elven Archer
cards.text: The elven archer's skill is such that it can instantly kill one enemy ally of its choice.

cards.name: Marauder
cards.text: This ally can be discarded at any time to negate a secondary event (one that is played immediately after another event), such as Calm following Cataclysm.

cards.name: Shaqat Beetles
cards.text: If defeated in battle, this ally attaches itself to the victorious champion, reducing his base level by 1 for each beetle attached. No limit per deck.

cards.name: Flesh Golem
cards.text: The flesh golem rips away magical items from the opposing champion, who must discard all attached magical items. The ally continues to rip away any more played.

cards.name: Loup-Garou
cards.text: Werebeast. The opposing champion is automatically defeated unless he has or can play a magical item.

cards.name: Brine Dragon
cards.text: Swimmer. One enemy ally already played is swallowed by the brine dragon (this player's choice), instantly defeated.

cards.name: Flaming Fist
cards.text: After a round of combat is resolved when using this ally, the losing player must immediately discard one magical item or artifact from his pool or hand, or raze one of his realms.

cards.name: Ninjas
cards.text: When used in combat, this player can draw one card at random from his opponent's hand, playing it against the opponent if possible, discarding it otherwise.

cards.name: Pseudodragon
cards.text: If played with a wizard, the pseudodragon becomes a familiar, remaining with the champion until he is defeated. No event, magical item, spell, or ally's ability can cause it to switch sides or be discarded.

cards.name: Roc
cards.text: Flyer. Flying allies cannot be played against the roc and any already in play must be discarded.

cards.name: Marilith, Tanar'ri
cards.text: The opposing player cannot play any events for the rest of this round of battle, including Calm.

cards.name: Thought Eater
cards.text: When this ally is played, the opposing champion can no longer cast spells, and his allies' special powers are negated.

cards.name: Ogre Mage
cards.text: Giant. This ally can cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Mermaid
cards.text: Swimmer. This ally's level is doubled when defending a realm showing a coastline.

cards.name: The Dreaded Ghost
cards.text: Undead. This ally drains the adjusted level of an opposing champion (except cleric) by 9; any that drop below 0 are instantly defeated.

cards.name: Clay Golem
cards.text: The clay golem rips away allies from the opposing champion, who must discard any already played. The ally continues to rip away any more played.

cards.name: Ki-Rin
cards.text: The opposing champion is automatically defeated unless he has or can play an ally.

cards.name: Troll
cards.text: All attacks targeting a specific ally in a player's force must first target the troll. This ally regenerates, however, and it cannot be discarded by any means unless its champion is defeated.

cards.name: Selkie
cards.text: Swimmer. The selkie can charm the opposing champion into discarding one card in its force (chosen by that player).

cards.name: Rust Monster
cards.text: Underdark. This ally devours all magical items of +3 or less. The items are discarded instantly, and any more such played are also devoured.

cards.name: Displacer Beast
cards.text: This ally can use its displacement power once during a battle, sending both champions back to their respective pools. Only the displacer beast remains. Combat can continue with each player selecting new champions.

cards.name: Drizzt Do'Urden
cards.text: Elf (drow). If defending a realm, Drizzt must be defeated twice in one battle before he is discarded.

cards.name: The Harpers
cards.text: The Harpers can cast either wizard or cleric spells, but at the beginning of each battle this champion is in, their player must choose which type will be cast.

cards.name: Helm
cards.text: Helm can cast wizard and cleric spells. He can be discarded from his pool to cancel one event, whether helpful or harmful.

cards.name: Thorvid
cards.text: Thorvid gains 3 levels when fighting monsters, undead, or flyers.

cards.name: Hettman Tsurin
cards.text: At the end of this player's turn, if Hettman hasn't attacked, this player can randomly draw one card from another player's hand and discard it.

cards.name: Tyrinon
cards.text: Flyer. Tyrinon's allies all become flyers. They are strengthened by his presence, and each gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Rikus
cards.text: Rikus can attack twice per turn, provided he wins his first round of combat.

cards.name: Captain Kazhal
cards.text: The Captain destroys one magical item held by the opposing champion at any time during the battle.

cards.name: Neeva
cards.text: Flyer. If defending a Dark Sun realm, Neeva's base level is doubled.

cards.name: Pereghost
cards.text: Flyer. Allies played with this champion each gain 2 levels. The pereghost can use unarmed combat cards usable by dragons.

cards.name: Dracolich
cards.text: Dragon; undead; flyer. The dracolich can cast wizard spells and use unarmed combat cards usable by dragons.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: If in a player's pool, the stone giant may destroy one enemy ally of level 4 or less during each round of combat.

cards.name: Lich Conclave
cards.text: Undead. The Conclave can cast wizard spells, and all allies played with it become undead.

cards.name: Winged Horror
cards.text: Dragon; undead; flyer. Any magical item weapons attached to the Horror are doubled in level. This monster can use unarmed combat cards usable by dragons.

cards.name: Mature Gold Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Goldie can cast wizard spells and use unarmed combat cards usable only by dragons. She gains 4 levels if her younger self is in play anyshere.

cards.name: Borys the Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Borys can cast wizard and cleric spells and use psionic power cards. He is immune to psionic attack.

cards.name: Athasian Cistern Fiend
cards.text: This hideous monster devours points' worth of allies up to its base level, and it is immune to offensive psionic power cards.

cards.name: Korgunard the Avangion
cards.text: Flyer. Korgunard can cast wizard spells and is immune to psionic attack. He can be discarded from his pool to rebuild a razed realm.

cards.name: Elminster the Mage
cards.text: The renowned wizard is immune to offensive spells and offensive psionic power cards.

cards.name: Vangerdahast
cards.text: When Vangie is played in defense of a realm, his player may immediately look at the attacker's hand.

cards.name: Ambassador Carrague
cards.text: The Ambassador can only defend, never attack. When he needs a card, draw a card and play it, if appropriate, discarding it if not. Once three cards have been discarded, no more can be drawn for that battle.

cards.name: Mika the Wolf Nomad
cards.text: Mika gains 3 levels when the opponent uses allies against him. He can also use hero unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Mordenkainen
cards.text: Any magical item attached to Mordenkainen cannot be removed by any means.

cards.name: Drawmij
cards.text: Swimmer. In battle, Drawmij can borrow any magical item in play, returning it when the round ends. He can also imitate the power of any wizard in play.

cards.name: Sadira
cards.text: Sadira can use psionic power cards. Psionicists must ask her permission to use psionic power cards.

cards.name: Rogue Defiler of Tyr
cards.text: Each time the Defiler casts a spell during combat, her player discards one card from his hand and draws a replacement card from his draw pile.

cards.name: Kalid-na
cards.text: The ancient sorcerer-king can use psionic power cards and is immune to psionic attack. While he is in play, the realm Ancient Kalidnay may not be played.

cards.name: Amarill
cards.text: If Amarill is defeated in combat, his player can retrieve one champion from his discard pile and return it to his hand.

cards.name: Clerics of Malar
cards.text: This champion gains 2 levels when attacking realms outside the Forgotten Realms. They can use unarmed combat cards usable by heroes.

cards.name: Adon
cards.text: Adon is immune to offensive spells, offensive magical items, and artifacts. If Midnight is in play, Adon gains 5 levels.

cards.name: Sysania
cards.text: Flyer. Sysania confers the ability to fly on all allies played with her. She can use unarmed combat cards usable by dragons.

cards.name: Nenioc
cards.text: Nenioc may be sacrificed to bring out an avatar, but she is shuffled back into her player's draw pile rather than discarded.

cards.name: Arch-Druid
cards.text: All other clerics must ask the Arch-Druid for permission to cast spells. While the Arch-druid is in play, no avatars may be played.

cards.name: Shayira
cards.text: This champion negates the special powers (but not the level) of all cards played against her.

cards.name: Elemental Cleric
cards.text: Immune to offensive wizard spells, the elemental cleric can also cast any wizard spells containing the words earth, air, fire, or water.

cards.name: Klik-Ka'Cha
cards.text: When Klik enters combat as a defender, he can destroy one magical item in play anywhere. He can use hero unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Photed
cards.text: Orc; adventurer. When Photed is in a pool with one or more other adventurers, each adventurer gains 1 to his base level.

cards.name: Sharla
cards.text: Elf; adventurer. When Sharla is in a pool with three or more other adventurers, each adventurer becomes immune to offensive wizard spells.

cards.name: Migrane
cards.text: Elf; adventurer. When Migrane is in a pool with three or more adventurers, each adventurer becomes immune to offensive cleric spells.

cards.name: Vitralis
cards.text: Adventurer. When Vitralis is in a pool with two or more other adventurers, each adventurer gains a +3 ally whether attacking or defending.

cards.name: Larn
cards.text: Elf; adventurer. When Larn is in a pool with two or more other adventurers, all phase 4 spells cast by an adventurer are doubled in level.

cards.name: Livekor
cards.text: Dragon; flyer; adventurer. Livekor can cast cleric spells. When he is in a pool with five or more other adventurers, all monsters in that pool can become heroes at the start of this player's turn.

cards.name: Shayla
cards.text: Adventurer. When Shayla is in a pool with four or more adventurers, all adventurers in that pool are immune to offensive magical items.

cards.name: Ssilcroth
cards.text: Adventurer. When Ssilcroth is in a pool with four or more other adventurers, allies cannot be used to defend against an attack by this player's adventurers.

cards.name: Rumples
cards.text: Gnome; adventurer. When Rumples is in a pool with five or more other adventurers, this player may deflect harmful events targeting him at any other player.

cards.name: Diamond
cards.text: Diamond can come to the aid of her sisters, Emerald and Topaz, and can act as an ally. Win or lose, she is discarded.

cards.name: Emerald
cards.text: Emerald can come to the aid of her sisters, Diamond and Topaz, and act as an ally. Win or lose, she returns to her pool minus any attached cards.

cards.name: Topaz
cards.text: Topaz can come to the aid of her sisters, Diamond and Emerald, and act as an ally. Win or lose, she returns to her pool with all of her attached cards.

cards.name: Ruby
cards.text: Ruby can put one hero unarmed combat card beneath her in the pool. She can use the card during her own combat, or she can play the card for her sisters, Jacinth and Amethyst, when they are in combat.

cards.name: Jacinth
cards.text: Jacinth can put two hero unarmed combat cards beneath her in the pool. She can use the cards during her own combat, or she can play them for her sisters, Ruby and Amethyst, when they are in combat.

cards.name: Amethyst
cards.text: Amethyst can use any unarmed combat cards and can put two such cards beneath her in the pool. She can use the cards during her own combat, or she can play them for her sisters, Ruby and Jacinth, when they are in combat.

cards.name: Pearl
cards.text: Pearl can bless all allies played with her or her sisters, Amber and Aquamarina, giving each ally a +2 bonus.

cards.name: Amber
cards.text: Amber can magically enhance all magical items held by her or her sisters, Pearl and Aquamarina, giving each item a +2 bonus.

cards.name: Aquamarina
cards.text: Swimmer. An artifact attached to Aquamarina also functions for her sisters, Pearl and Amber

cards.name: Cyclops
cards.text: Giant. The cyclops gains 2 levels for each magical item attached to him.

cards.name: Ettin
cards.text: Giant. Being of two minds, the ettin may have two AD&D artifacts attached to him.

cards.name: Formorian Giant
cards.text: The formorian is so repulsive that no allies can be played in combat against him.

cards.name: Fire Giant
cards.text: This giant gains an additional 4 levels when fighting swimming champions.

cards.name: Yumac the Cold
cards.text: Giant. A master of elemental magical, all spells cast during phase 3 that affect champions "of X level or less" have that level increased by 2.

cards.name: Pellgrade the Inexorable
cards.text: Giant; flyer; swimmer. During battle, Pellgrade can cast a +7 lightning bolt offensive spell that destroys one of his opponent's magical items or artifact.

cards.name: Neranal
cards.text: Giant; swimmer. Neranal has a pet shark as a +4 swimming ally that devours (discards) the first swimming ally played against this champion.

cards.name: Gloaranor
cards.text: Giant. Gloaranor can attack any realm showing trees, regardless of position or special powers.

cards.name: Moralin
cards.text: Giant. When Moralin attacks, any allies the defender wishes to use during that round of combat must be shown to this player. Only those allies may be played.

cards.name: Borin Moradinson
cards.text: Dwarf. Claiming to be an offspring of the god Moradin, Borin can never be discarded through combat if the avatar is in play. If defeated, he merely returns to his pool with his attachments.

cards.name: Mallin Dimmerswill
cards.text: Dwarf. This champion gains 3 levels against all Underdark monsters and can use hero unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Arden Glimrock
cards.text: Dwarf. No drow can stand against this mighty leader; drow allies are instantly killed, and drow champions return to their pools, defeated.

cards.name: Drider
cards.text: Underdark. This nasty monster can use offensive blood abilities and is immune to offensive hero unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Eye Tyrant
cards.text: Underdark. This beholder can cast wizard spells and is immune to offensive magical items.

cards.name: Roper
cards.text: Underdark. Only offensive spells and magical items that have the word "fire" in their title have any effect on this monster. It is immune to psionic attack.

cards.name: Malleyahl
cards.text: Elf (drow). Malleyahl gains 3 levels when defending an Underdark realm and can use offensive psionic power cards.

cards.name: Malaruat
cards.text: Elf (drow). Malaruat can corrupt a monster in the pool of a player not involved in the current combat to act in his stead. That player must provide the champion, but this player may only use the cards in his own hand.

cards.name: Maleficent
cards.text: Elf (drow). Maleficent can cast wizard spells and use blood abilities. She commands such power that one avatar not involved in combat must aid her in any way its special powers can.

cards.name: Isika
cards.text: Allies are sympathetic to Isika; those played with her gain 2 levels and those played against her lose 2 levels.

cards.name: Merika
cards.text: Elf. Merika can use blood abilities.

cards.name: Funerea
cards.text: Giant. Allies flock to Funerea's side, abandoning their champion to join her.

cards.name: Salurana
cards.text: Elf (drow). Salurana psionically polymorphs all allies played with her, changing them to elves or drow, as desired. (Def/4)

cards.name: Jella
cards.text: Jella can Raise Object, lifting a magical item away from a champion in an opponent's pool and discarding it during phase 3. (Off)

cards.name: Myalasia
cards.text: Dwarf. During combat, Myalasia can Locate Object, randomly drawing one card from the opposing player and discard it. (Off)

cards.name: Kit'Kit'Kin
cards.text: Kit'Kit'Kin has a Fortress of Iron Will in effect at all times unless she drops to level 0; while the fortress is in effect, she is immune to psionic attack. (Def)

cards.name: Beala
cards.text: Dwarf (mul). This dwarf's focus is undead, and her hatred is so intense that she doubles her base level whenever in battle with them.

cards.name: Minerva
cards.text: Flyer. Minerva has Danger Sense. If she is about to lose a battle, she can retreat back to her pool, though the battle is still lost. (Def)

cards.name: Islerik
cards.text: Islerik is immune to offensive magical items. When defending, he can reflect the special power of the attacking champion, causing it to affect the attacker.

cards.name: Merik
cards.text: Elf. Merik can cast cleric spells. He can pass through the earth at will, allowing him and his allies to earthwalk.

cards.name: Pyre
cards.text: Giant. Pyre can cast wizard spells. He gains 7 levels when in combat with nonspellcasting champions.

cards.name: Ansalong
cards.text: Elf (drow). Ansalong negates the special powers of all offensive cards attached to an opposing champion.

cards.name: Jarek Halvs
cards.text: During combat, Jarek can psionically Reverse Gravity, causing all opposing flyers to become nonflyers and nonflyers to become flyers. (Off)

cards.name: Moraster
cards.text: Dwarf. If this player chooses not to attack on his turn, Moraster can use his Create Object power to search though the draw pile for any magical item and place it on the top of his deck. (Def)

cards.name: Kai'Rik'Tik
cards.text: This thri-kreen can psionically Summon Planar Creature to use a monster champion from any pool as an ally. If Kai'Rik'Tik is defeated, the monster is discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Talcon
cards.text: Dwarf (mul). If defeated in combat, Talcon can psionically Fate Link to bring another champion from any pool to the discard pile with him. (Off)

cards.name: Minervan
cards.text: Flyer. Minervan's Flesh Armor power adds 4 to his base level when attacking or defending. (Def)

cards.name: Apocalypse
cards.text: Awnshegh; flyer. Apocalypse can cast wizard spells and use blood abilities. It automatically defeats a realm champion.

cards.name: The Harpy
cards.text: Awnshegh; flyer. The Harpy can cast wizard spells. No flying allies can be played against this champion.

cards.name: The Magian
cards.text: Awnshegh; undead. The Magian can cast wizard and cleric spells. He and his allies are immune to the special powers of opposing realms and holdings.

cards.name: Serpent
cards.text: Awnshegh. The Serpent can cast cleric spells. In battle, it can turn into a giant constrictor snake (monster, base level 12), but can no longer cast cleric spells.

cards.name: Chernevik
cards.text: Chernevik can cast cleric spells. He can employ his Iron Will blood ability to resist being removed from his pool for any reason.

cards.name: Cidre Bint Corina
cards.text: Elf. When attacking a realm showing trees, Cidre's allies cannot be forced to switch sides or discarded for any reason.

cards.name: Adan El-Mesir
cards.text: Adan is charismatic and used to the burdens of command. Any allies played with him gain 2 levels and are immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: Rahil the Falcon
cards.text: Rahil can cast wizard spells. He can employ his Blood History ability to look at the top five cards on any opponent's draw pile.

cards.name: Arlando El-Adaba
cards.text: Arlando is a master diplomat. He can be discarded to end a battle between any two players. Champions return to their pools without declaring a winner. No further attacks this turn are allowed. This player gets to draw a card.

cards.name: The Ancient Dead
cards.text: Undead. This monster's touch causes mummy rot, permanently subtracting its base level from the base level of any champion who defeats it.

cards.name: Madman Enraged
cards.text: Undead. During combat, this ghoul goes into a berserk rage and destroys one of the opposing player's holdings (this player's choice).

cards.name: Ting Ling
cards.text: Flyer. Ting Ling can use blood abilities. He confers the power to fly on his allies, allowing them to attack with him.

cards.name: The Death Ship
cards.text: Undead; swimmer. This inanimate object is the home of evil spirits. Only swimming allies may be played against this champion.

cards.name: The Lesser Mummy
cards.text: Undead. This apparition drains 3 levels from the attacking champion, adding them to itself. Lycanthropes fear it, and no werecreature will attack it.

cards.name: Bride of Malice
cards.text: Undead (vampire). This wizard is immune to psionic attack and offensive unarmed combat cards. She can use blood abilities and unarmed combat cards usable by dragons.

cards.name: The Vulture of the Core
cards.text: Flyer. When defending a Ravenloft realm, the vulture can opt to draw five cards from his draw pile. He can use only those cards for the battle, and all are discarded at the end of the round.

cards.name: Fleeing Adventurers
cards.text: If defeated by a psionicist or regent, this champion can flee back to its pool rather than being discarded.

cards.name: The Bog Monster
cards.text: Four allies must be played against this champion before any of their powers or levels take effect. Once four are played, the result is totaled and applied.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text: This player's champions and allies put forward in battle become flyers for this turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Shapechange
cards.text: The caster can choose to become any other type of champion (cleric, hero, regent, etc.) until the end of this player's turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text: Destroys immediately all opposing allies of level 4 or less. (Off/4)

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Immediately destroys one opposing ally of level 4 or less, or one magical item, of the caster's choice. (Off/4)

cards.name: Magic Missile
cards.text: The level bonus increases to +5 if cast by a level 7 or 8 champion or to +9 if cast by a champion of level 9 or higher. (Off/4)

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text: Only flyers can attack across the wall. (Off/4)

cards.name: Wall of Force
cards.text: Only earthwalkers can attack across the wall. (Def/4)

cards.name: Cone of Cold
cards.text: Destroys one artifact, chosen by the caster. If cast during phase 3, the caster does not receive a level bonus. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Crushing Fist
cards.text: The crushing fist adds 4 levels or destroys one magical item, chosen by the caster. (Off/4)

cards.name: Dispel Magic
cards.text: Can be cast at any time to cancel the effects of a just-cast spell or to cancel an existing spell. (Def)

cards.name: Wall of Fog
cards.text: No attacks are allowed against any player until this player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Fear
cards.text: Attach to any enemy champion in a pool; that champion cannot attack or defend until the fear is dispelled. (Off/3)

cards.name: Blink
cards.text: A champion who is about to lose a round of battle escapes to the player's pool, but the round is still lost. (Def/4)

cards.name: Charm Monster
cards.text: An opposing monster returns to its pool; the caster wins this round of battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Black Tentacles
cards.text: All champions of level 4 or less die, regardless of whether they are in battle or in pools. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Death Fog
cards.text: Kills all champions of level 5 or less in one player's pool and prevents survivors from attacking until after that player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Death Spell
cards.text: Kills any one champion or ally of the caster's choosing of level 7 or less. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Power Word, Stun
cards.text: Can be cast at any time to negate the special power of an attacking champion before his power can activate. (Off)

cards.name: Spell Turning
cards.text: Can be cast at any time to turn a just-cast offensive spell back upon its caster as if the original target had cast it. (Def)

cards.name: Power Word, Silence
cards.text: The opposing champion cannot cast spells for this round of combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Death Link
cards.text: If the casting champion is defeated, the opposing champion is also discarded. (Def/4)

cards.name: Limited Wish
cards.text: This spell can be cast at any time to negate the effect of any event card. (Def)

cards.name: Time Stop
cards.text: Take any one wizard spell from your draw pile and play it immediately. Then, reshuffle the draw pile. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Wish
cards.text: Discard any one card in play (except a realm) regardless of its immunities. This spell can be cast at any time, but the casting champion cannot be used again until its owner's next turn. (Off)

cards.name: Reverse Gravity
cards.text: All flyers become non-flyers and vice-versa until the beginning of this player's next turn. Swimmers and earthwalkers are unaffected by this spell. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Mirror Image
cards.text: This spell doubles the caster's current level. (Def/4)

cards.name: Elminster's Evasion
cards.text: A wizard who casts this spell can sacrifice another wizard from his pool to escape defeat, but the opponent still gains spoils (if applicable). (Def/4)

cards.name: Prismatic Sphere
cards.text: This spell may only be cast by a defending champion and lasts until the beginning of this player's next turn. The attached champion is immune to harmful events and the special powers of all cards. (Def/4)

cards.name: Re-target
cards.text: Allows this caster to redirect a just-cast offensive or defensive spell at any card in play. This spell may be cast at any time. (Def)

cards.name: ESP
cards.text: When this player's opponent plays a card into the battle, it is played face down. This player then guesses the card type (ally, wizard spell, etc). If correct, that card is discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Leomund's Trap
cards.text: Hide under any realm in your formation; expose when the realm is attacked. Any champion of base level 4 or less is immediately discarded before the battle even begins. (Off/3)

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text: Play just after an opponent has announced an attack on any realm. Choose another realm in the same formation for the champion to attack instead, which he and his allies may, regardless of position or restrictions. (Off)

cards.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
cards.text: Reduces the target's base level by half (round down) until the end of that player's next turn. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Stinking Cloud
cards.text: All opposing allies of level 3 or less are discarded. Opposing allies of level 4 or higher lose their special powers. (Off/4)

cards.name: Sepia Snake Sigil
cards.text: Hide under any realm in your formation; expose when the realm is attacked. An attacker is sent to Limbo until the end of that player's next turn. Discard spell after use. (Def/3)

cards.name: Armor
cards.text: Until the end of this champion's next combat, increase the caster's base level by 1 if cast by a champion level 5 or less; by 3 if level 6-9; or by 5 if level 10+. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Sticks to Snakes
cards.text: Increases to +6 if cast by a level 7 or 8 champion, and increases to +8 if cast by a level 9 or higher champion. (Off/4)

cards.name: Sanctuary
cards.text: The cleric who casts Sanctuary loses the round of battle but is not discarded; it returns to the pool instead. (Def/4)

cards.name: Wind Walk
cards.text: The champion and his allies are considered flyers for this round of battle. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Dispel
cards.text: Can be cast at any time to cancel the effects of an existing or just-cast spell, blood ability, or psionic power card. (Def)

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Any one defeated champion can be selected from this player's discard pile and placed back in his hand. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Creeping Doom
cards.text: Immediately razes one realm with no holding. (Off/3)

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: All cards currently in battle are discarded, and combat ends with no victor. Every player must raze one of his own realms or discard a holding in play. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Shadow Engines
cards.text: Discard any holding of an opponent. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Faith-Magic Zone
cards.text: Only cleric spells can be cast until the end of this player's next turn. (Def/3/45)

cards.name: Ward of Sleep
cards.text: This spell can be cast to place one champion from any player's discard pile to the Abyss. (Off/3/4/5)

cards.name: Ward of Peace
cards.text: This spell serves as a protector for a player's pool. Any spell directed at the player's pool must first be directed at the ward, who is considered a level 8 hero in a pool all his own.

cards.name: Ward of Erebus
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all clerics discarded by any means are sent to Limbo instead of the discard pile. They return to players' pools at the end of their next turns. (Def/3)

cards.name: Ward of Laocoon
cards.text: The special powers of all dragons and swimmers are negated until the end of this player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Ward of Laius
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all players "elevate" one of their pool champions to King. Their King is the first to attack or defend and is immune to harmful events. If defeated in combat, the highest level champion remaining in the pool is also discarded. (Off/3/5)

cards.name: Ward of Freedom
cards.text: This spell can be cast to recall any champion from Limbo back to the player's pool or from the Abyss to the discard pile. (Def/3)

cards.name: Ward of Ironguarding
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, this player's draw pile is immune to the special power of other cards that try to look at or discard cards from the draw pile. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Ward of Ruin
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, any realm that is razed in combat is also discarded. (Off/3)

cards.name: Ward of the Erinyes
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no rule cards can be played. The owner of any rule card currently in play must discard either a realm, holding, or champion. (Off/3)

cards.name: Animal Friendship
cards.text: This spell adds a permanent ally to the caster equal to half his base level (round up). (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Command
cards.text: An opposing player must attack with the targeted champion (if possible) during his next turn. If he does not, the champion is discarded and the player must discard two cards from his hand or pool. (Off/3)

cards.name: Shillelagh
cards.text: Shillelagh creates a magical weapon equal to half the caster's base level (round down) that lasts until the end of this player's next turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Aid
cards.text: Cast by a champion in the pool into a combat, this spell adds 4 to the base level of the affected champion. (Def/4)

cards.name: Enthrall
cards.text: Prevents all champions in one player's pool from attacking or defending until after that player's next turn. This player can make no attacks this turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Fire Trap
cards.text: Hide under any realm in your formation; expose when the realm is attacked. Any champion of base level 5 or less is immediately discarded before the battle. Discard spell after use. (Off/3)

cards.name: Heat Metal
cards.text: Opposing champion is stripped of all magical items and artifacts. Items are sent to Limbo until the end of the player's next turn and then return to their original champion (if possible) or are discarded. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Locate Object
cards.text: Allows this player to search his draw pile for any magical item or artifact and place it on the top of his draw pile. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Negative Plane Protection
cards.text: Lasts until dispelled or until the champion is involved in combat with an undead champion. The protected champion is immune to the special powers of all undead champions. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Switch Personality
cards.text: May be used during a round of battle to exchange this champion for one in your pool. The pool champion may have already attacked or defended this battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Superior Invisibility
cards.text: An invisible champion can bypass a defending wizard or cleric of base level 4 or less and raze the realm. The defending champion returns to his pool. (Def/4)

cards.name: Mindlink
cards.text: Allows the champion to cast cleric and wizard spells, use blood abilities, and use unarmed combat cards for this round of battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Precognition
cards.text: The opposing player must reveal the next two cards he plans to play in this combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Phobia Amplification
cards.text: The base level of this champion is subtracted from the base level of the target. If the opponent is reduced below level 0, he remains in combat at a negative total. (Off/4)

cards.name: Body Weaponry
cards.text: Discards any unarmed combat cards in play and prevents further unarmed combat cards from being used this round. (Off/4)

cards.name: Lend Health
cards.text: This power is played by a champion in the pool to lend its base level to another champion in combat, If the aided champion loses, this champion is discarded as well. (Def/4)

cards.name: Metamorphosis
cards.text: This champion can choose to become a different type of champion type (hero, wizard, etc) for this round of battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Mindwipe
cards.text: An opposing champion cannot cast any spells or use psionic power cards for the rest of this round of battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Jab
cards.text: Usable only by heroes. Draw one card at random from the opposing player, playing it if possible but discarding it otherwise. (Off/4)

cards.name: Boot to the Head
cards.text: Usable only by heroes. An opposing wizard, cleric, thief, or regent draws and discards a card, noting its last digit. If the digit is a 0 or a 1, the opponent is defeated. (Off/4)

cards.name: Reversal
cards.text: Usable by all champions. This maneuver turns a just-played offensive unarmed combat card back upon its user. (Def/4)

cards.name: Choke Hold
cards.text: Usable only by heroes. An opposing spellcaster cannot cast spells for this round of combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Counter
cards.text: Usable by all champions. This unarmed combat card negates a just-played unarmed combat card. (Def/4)

cards.name: Rake!
cards.text: Usable only by undead champions. The opposing champion must discard one card from the current round of combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Tail Slap
cards.text: Usable only by dragons. All nonflying opponents lose two levels. If reduced to level 0 or less, they are discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Blind Side!
cards.text: Usable only by elf (drow) champions. This can be played at any time to discard the highest ally, spell, or psionic power card played during this round of combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Heroic Effort
cards.text: Usable only by heroes. The attached hero can discard any single card attached to an opposing champion. Win or lose, the hero is discarded at the end of the battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Elemental Control
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to all offensive spells containing the words "fire, flame, air, wind, water, or earth." (Def/4)

cards.name: Fear
cards.text: All opposing allies whose plus is less than the last digit of the attached champion's card number are immediately discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Healing
cards.text: This ability can be used after a combat to return up to two just-discarded allies from the discard pile to your hand. (Def/5)

cards.name: Resistance
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to offensive magical items until the end of this round of battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Bloodform
cards.text: Attached champion becomes a monster and is now considered an awnshegh. Lasts until the attached champion is discarded. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Charm Aura
cards.text: All opposing allies of +5 or less are forced to switch sides. Allies played after this blood ability are unaffected. (Off/4)

cards.name: Major Resistance
cards.text: Attached champion is immune to offensive magical items and offensive spells until the end of this player's next turn. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Wither Touch
cards.text: Any champion defeated by the attached champion is sent to the Abyss rather than the discard pile. (Off/4)

cards.name: Persuasion
cards.text: Attached champion draws and discards a card, noting the last digit of the card number. This is the number of opposing allies (chosen by the opponent) which are persuaded not to fight. Allies are sent to the discard pile. (Off/4)

cards.name: Ren's Crystal Ball
cards.text: During phase 0 of each turn, the owner of Rens's Crystal Ball can inspect the top three cards of any deck and discard one card.

cards.name: Codex of the Infinite Planes
cards.text: All of this player's champions are immune to offensive magical items and offensive spells.

cards.name: Eye and Hand of Vecna
cards.text: The attached champions gains 5 levels when attacking, but only 2 levels when defending.

cards.name: Cup of Al'Akbar
cards.text: If this player discards three cards from his hand during phase 5, he can return any one card from the discard pile to his hand.

cards.name: The Ring of Winter
cards.text: While this card is in play, all opponents draw one fewer card then normal on their turns (minimum of one card).

cards.name: Wand of Orcus
cards.text: This wand can be attached to any undead monster champion. When the wand is used in battle against an opposing champion of level 8 or less, the opponent is instantly slain (discarded).

cards.name: Axe of the Dwarvish Lords
cards.text: The Axe can be attached to any champion. In addition to the listed bonus, the Axe also gives the attached champion a +8 ally.

cards.name: Guenhwyvar
cards.text: If the attached champion is defeated, Guenhwyvar may be attached to any other Forgotten Realms champion in the player's pool.

cards.name: Obsidian Man of Urik
cards.text: If the attached champion is discarded, the artifact returns to the player's pool as a monster. Instead of attaching this artifact to a champion, the player can play the Obsidian Man as a monster.

cards.name: The Throne of the Gods
cards.text: The Throne of the Gods can be used by a champion of any world. It is not subject to the Rule of the Cosmos, but any champion with the Throne attached must immediately battle any other champion who also claims the Throne. The winner receives a spoils of victory.

cards.name: Nature's Throne
cards.text: Usable by any champion from any world. Nature's Throne strips any special movement requirement (swimmers, flyers, etc) from any realm that this player's champions attack.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Can be used by an undead champion from any world. All of this player's undead are immune to offensive psionic power cards, unarmed combat cards, and blood abilities.

cards.name: The Medusa Throne
cards.text: Usable by a champion from any world. An opponent's special powers that activate upon defeat ("avenging" champions and allies) are negated and "avenging" champions and allies are sent to the Abyss when defeated.

cards.name: Throne of Ice
cards.text: Can be attached to a champion from any world. The Throne of Ice allows a champion to attack a rule card as if it were a realm. Any player can defend the rule card like a normal realm, but if the attack is successful, the rule card is "razed" and removed from play.

cards.name: Throne of the Seas
cards.text: Can be attached to a swimming champion from any world. All swimming champions of this player are immune to harmful events and offensive magical items. Swimming champions and allies gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Throne of the Pharaohs
cards.text: Usable by a champion from any world. When brought into play, all events in play are negated and no more can be played as long as the Throne of the Pharaohs remains in play.

cards.name: The Emerald Throne
cards.text: Usable only by an elf champion from any world. All elves of this player can use unarmed combat, psionic power, and blood ability cards.

cards.name: Throne of the Drow
cards.text: Usable only by elf (drow) champions from any world. Instead of attacking a realm during a turn, the attached can attack a champion in another player's pool. If successful, this player draws a card (but not as spoils) and the defender is discarded.

cards.name: Elemental Avatar of Earth
cards.text: Avatar. Two Dark Sun champions must be discarded to bring this avatar into play. All champions of this player are granted the earthwalking ability.

cards.name: Elemental Avatar of Air
cards.text: Avatar. Two flying champions from any world must be discarded to bring this avatar into play. All flying champion of this player are immune to cards that directly target flyers.

cards.name: Elemental Avatar of Water
cards.text: Avatar. A Dark Sun cleric of level 12 or higher must be discarded to bring this avatar into play. Once per turn, this player can look at the top card of each player's draw pile and discard any champions or allies that are swimmers.

cards.name: Elemental Avatar of Fire
cards.text: Avatar. A monster (dragon) champion must be discarded to being this avatar into play. All Dark Sun champions of this player gain a +5 fire elemental as an ally that cannot be forced to switch sides or be discarded through cardplay.

cards.name: Garl Glittergold
cards.text: Avatar. Gnome. A hero of level 8 or higher must be discarded to bring Garl into play. All champions of this player are considered gnomes. All champions and all "true" gnomes are immune to offensive wizard spells.

cards.name: Urdlen
cards.text: Avatar. An earthwalking monster of level 7 or more must be discarded to bring Urdlen into play. Urdlen devours all earthwalking allies that oppose any of this player's champions.

cards.name: Yondalla the Provider
cards.text: Avatar. Halfling. A monster of level 12 or higher must be discarded to bring Yondalla into play. Yondalla can only defend, never attack. If defeated in combat (or discarded for any reason) she forces both the opposing champion and one other champion of her choice to be discarded.

cards.name: Brandobaris
cards.text: Avatar. Halfing. A hero with an attached magical item must be discarded to bring Brandobaris into play. Once per turn, this player can select one champion in another player's pool to take magical items and artifacts from. The magical items and artifacts are then redistributed to other champions in that player's pool.

cards.name: Corellon Larethian
cards.text: Avatar. Elf. An elf champion of level 16 or higher must be discarded to bring Corellon into play. Corellon is immune to offensive wizard spells and rule cards have no effect against elf champions of this player.

cards.name: Bahgtru
cards.text: Avatar. Orc. A hero level 13 or higher must be discarded to bring Bahgtru into play. All allies of this player gain a +4 bonus and are immune to offensive spells, blood abilities, and magical items.

cards.name: Great Mother
cards.text: Avatar. Beholder. Another player's wizard must be defeated in combat to bring the Great Mother into play (at the time of the victory). Once per turn, the Great Mother can surround one pool in an antimagic shell that prevents all spellcasting.

cards.name: Annam
cards.text: Avatar. Giant. A giant of level 14 or higher must be discarded to bring Annam into play. At the start of this player's turn, Annam can discard one card at random from another player who has a hand of eight cards or more.

cards.name: Remnis
cards.text: Avatar. One or more flyers totaling 16 levels or more must be discarded to bring Remnis into play. At the end of each turn, Remnis can fly into this player's discard pile and retrieve one non-champion card, returning it to this player's hand.

cards.name: Cegilune
cards.text: Avatar. Three magical items with a least a +3 bonus each (or three elf champions) must be discard to bring Cegilune into play. When attacking, she causes all magical items held by the opposing player to be discarded.

cards.name: Kanchelsis
cards.text: Avatar. Undead, flyer, elf. An undead champion with a magical item or artifact must be discarded to bring Kanchelsis into play. Each time Kanchelsis wins a round of combat, he can force one attached card anywhere in play to be discarded (excluding realms and champions).

cards.name: Ferrix
cards.text: Avatar. Weretiger. A monster champion of level 12 or higher must be discarded to bring Ferrix into play. In combat, Ferrix forces her opponent to discard one artifact or holding from their hand, pool, or formation, or else lose the round of combat.

cards.name: Titania
cards.text: Avatar. Three champions must be discarded to bring Titania into play. This player can choose one type of champion at the start of each of his turns that is immune harmful events and offensive psionic power cards.

cards.name: Verenestra
cards.text: Avatar. A wizard immune to offensive spells must be discarded to bring this avatar into play. Once per turn, Verenestra can negate a defensive spell. If discarded from play for any reason, all cards with the words "immune" or "immunity" on them are likewise discarded.

cards.name: Midnight, Goddess of Magic
cards.text: Avatar. Two level 9+ wizards must be discarded to bring Midnight into play. While in play, all champions that use wizard spells must ask her permission to cast them. She destroys all magical items held by the opposing champion.

cards.name: Iuz, Avatar of Evil
cards.text: Avatar. Undead. 10+ levels of undead champions must be discarded to bring Iuz into play. Iuz can cast wizard spells. Once per turn, this player may raze one of his realms to force an opponent to discard a razed realm or raze one unrazed realm.

cards.name: Lolth, the Spider Avatar
cards.text: Avatar. Elf (drow). Two drow champions must be discarded to bring Lolth into play. Can use wizard and cleric spells and psionic power cards. If Lolth is defeated, shuffle her back into the draw deck along with the drow used to summon her.

cards.name: Nobody Wins!
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. At the start of this player's turn, he may guess a type of card (realm, holding, wizard, cleric spell, etc.) and flip over the top card of one player's draw pile. If he guessed correctly, the card is placed in the Abyss, otherwise it is discarded.

cards.name: Rule Lawyer's Delight
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. This rule card allows every player to have a rule card in play (this player may have one in addition to this one). Only the player who plays a rule card is affected by its powers. The Ultimate Rule Card removes all rules from play.

cards.name: Time of Troubles
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. No champion of base level 7 or greater (before magical items and other attached modifiers) may be involved in combat. All Forgotten Realms champions and allies gain 1 level.

cards.name: The Power of Faith
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All champions except clerics battle undead champions at half their base level, and allies of less than +4 cannot be played against undead champions by non-clerics.

cards.name: Forbidden Knowledge
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Only Ravenloft champions can cast offensive wizard spells. Only Dark Sun champions can use offensive psionic power cards. Only AD&D champions can use offensive unarmed combat cards. Only Birthright champions can use offensive blood abilities.

cards.name: Circle of Life
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. The game cannot end by a player running out of cards. Any time a player depletes his draw pile, he simply reshuffles his discards to form a new draw pile. Cards in the Abyss remain in the Abyss.

cards.name: Fair Fight!
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All instant-kill cards lose their special powers, retaining only their icon bonus. This includes all champions, allies, and events that cause a particular type of champion to be discarded.

cards.name: The Event Wheel
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Events that have a stated duration remain in effect. After two events have been played, a third event forces the first event played to be discarded. Events continue to cycle through, with a third event always replacing the event that has been active the longest.

cards.name: The Backwaters
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. At the end of this player's turn, razed realms in the C, D, or E positions are discarded. Razed realms in the A or B position remain in the formation.

cards.name: Master the Magic
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Allies and psionic power cards cannot be played. Any such cards already in play are discarded when this rule card is played.

cards.name: The Master Strategist
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Spells and blood abilities cannot be played. Any such cards already in play are discarded when this rule card is played.

cards.name: Flash Flood
cards.text: All players' pools fill with water, negating the special powers of all magical items and artifacts attached to nonswimmers. Items function normally in combat. This event lasts until negated. (Harmful)

cards.name: Netherese Symbol of Power
cards.text: Place face down beneath a realm until it is attacked. This realm's defenders get to use their special powers before that of the attacker. Discard after use. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Rengarth Oracle
cards.text: Look at the top six cards of your draw pile and arrange the cards in any order. When finished, send this card to the Abyss. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Sea of Dust
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by swimmers. If razed in combat, this player can raze any other realm in play. If razed or discarded outside of combat, this player can cause one swimming champion anywhere in play to be discarded.

cards.name: Caves of Mystery
cards.text: Can be attached to any realm. Attacking champions of base level 9 or higher draw and discard a card, noting the last digit. If that number is 3 or less, they have underestimated the danger and are discarded. This player draws spoils.

cards.name: The Living Earth
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, realm champions can attack opposing realms (regardless of position or restrictions) and use magical items and artifacts. If defeated in combat, the realm of the realm champion is discarded. Magical items and artifacts are discarded at the end of the event. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Painted Hills
cards.text: This realm's champion can be of any type, chosen each time it is attacked. Unarmed combat cards cannot be used when attacking this realm.

cards.name: Ethereal Champion
cards.text: Can cast wizard and cleric spells. Immune to all offensive cards and opposing champions' special powers. All cards in this player's pool can be turned face down while the Ethereal Champion is in play.

cards.name: Agis's Cairn
cards.text: Defenders of the attached realm can choose to negate defensive spells and defensive magical items for the duration of the battle.

cards.name: Throne of the Mountain God
cards.text: Limbo becomes the Abyss and the Abyss becomes Limbo for as long as this card is in play. Nonevent cards normally sent to Limbo are removed from play; nonevent cards normally sent to the Abyss return at the end of that player's next turn.

cards.name: Between a Rock and a Hard Place
cards.text: Play during the first round of a realm's defense as a defender. If this realm is razed or discarded in this battle, all razed realms in play are also discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Barbaric Allies
cards.text: These allies can be played in combat regardless of cards that prohibit allies from being played. If played during a successful defense of a realm, one of the attacker's realms is razed (chosen by the attacker).

cards.name: The Sylvan Pool
cards.text: Can be attached to any realm. Each time a realm or holding is removed from play, this player draws one card.

cards.name: Poor Man's Fort
cards.text: This holding can be attached to an existing realm for the +3 ally or it can be played directly into the pool as a realm during phase 2. While in the pool, it cannot be attacked through combat, nor does it count as a realm for victory conditions. While in play, champions of this player do not require a realm in their formation to remain in play.

cards.name: The Crystal Dome
cards.text: Cosmic rays cause crystals in the ground to grow, which in turn surround this player's pool. His champions all age, doubling their base levels until the end of this player's next turn. (Helpful)

cards.name: Towers of Menzoberranzan
cards.text: If attached to Menzo, the realm cannot be razed or discarded except through combat. If attached to another realm, that realm is immune to attacks via the Underdark or by earthwalkers.

cards.name: Mystic Passage
cards.text: Play if about to lose a round of combat. You escape into the corridor of your mind, returning to your pool defeated but not discarded. (Def/4)

cards.name: Blingdenstone Symbol of Power
cards.text: Place face down beneath a realm. If a Forgotten Realms champion defends the attached realm, its base level is doubled and it is immune to offensive cards. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Dragon's Eye Symbol of Power
cards.text: Place face down beneath a realm. If a realm in this player's formation is targeted by a spell that could raze or destroy it, discard the Dragon's Eye charm instead. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: The Winner's Cape
cards.text: This mighty artifact is the Grand Prize in the 1996 World Championship at the GenCon Game Fair. All of this player's champions are immune to offensive spells (including Wish) and the attached is also immune to harmful events. This artifact can be used by any champion.

cards.name: Wand of Orcus
cards.text: This Wand can be attached to any undead monster champion. When the Wand is used in battle against an opposing champion of level 8 or less, the opponent is instantly slain (discarded). Limit one per deck.

cards.name: Axe of the Dwarvish Lords
cards.text: The Axe can be attached to any champion. In addition to the listed bonus, the Axe also gives the attached champion a +8 ally in combat.

cards.name: Iron Flask of Tuerny the Merciless
cards.text: The Flask gives the attached champion a +6 tanar'ri ally that can earthwalk and cast wizard spells. If the artifact is discarded, the attached champion is also discarded.

cards.name: Jacinth of Inestimable Beauty
cards.text: In combat, one enemy ally (chosen by this player) is forced to switch sides. The level of all friendly allies are doubled.

cards.name: Machine of Lum the Mad
cards.text: The attached champion can cast any spell, but only in defense; it can never attack. The champion uses the last digit of his card number as his level.

cards.name: Queen Ehlissa's Marvelous Nightingale
cards.text: When the attached champion enters combat, the player can choose to prevent the opposing champion from playing allies or spells.

cards.name: Sword of Kas
cards.text: The base level of an opposing champion is halved (round up). This artifact does not function when used against a champion with the Eye and Hand of Vecna.

cards.name: Talisman of Al'Akbar
cards.text: This artifact can be attached to a champion with the Cup of Al'Akbar. The attached champion can dispel one spell while involved in a round of battle. Monsters cannot use this Talisman.

cards.name: Teeth of Dalhvar-Nar
cards.text: The attached champion is a flyer and is immune to offensive spells. If the champion wins a round of battle, an opposing holding is immediately discarded.

cards.name: All-Knowing Eye of Yasmin Sira
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to offensive spells and once per battle can cast a +5 spell (Def/4). Once per turn, the player can examine one opponent's hand.

cards.name: Coin of Jisan the Bountiful
cards.text: The champion can negate either the power or level (but not both) of each magical item and artifact used against him in combat.

cards.name: Seal of Lost Arak
cards.text: Once per turn, the player can flip the top card of any other player's draw deck. He can use it only if it is a spell or ally that is legal for that step. The card is reshuffled into the player's draw deck.

cards.name: Crystal of the Ebon Flame
cards.text: Attached champion becomes undead. The opposing champion's base level is considered to be a zero, unless it is a cleric or undead. Opposing undead allies switch sides.

cards.name: Obsidian Man of Urik
cards.text: If the attached champion is discarded, the artifact returns to the player's pool as a monster. Instead of attaching this artifact to a champion, the player can play the Obsidian Man as a monster.

cards.name: Rod of Teeth
cards.text: An opposing wizard cannot cast spells. Before battle, the player can discard the attached champion and examine all other players' hands, discarding any spell cards.

cards.name: Midnight's Mask of Disguise
cards.text: A champion can be played into the player's pool with this magical item, even if the champion is already in play somewhere. The champion's powers are unchanged. (Def)

cards.name: Girdle of Storm Giant Strength
cards.text: (Off)

cards.name: Hammer of Thunderbolts
cards.text: Can only be attached to a champion who carries gauntlets of ogre power or a girdle of storm giant strength. The first ally used against the attached champion is discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
cards.text: Champion breaks down walls, allowing him to ignore all such cards. Can be played on a champion even after combat is ended by a wall spell. Combat must continue. (Off)

cards.name: Winged Boots
cards.text: The attached champion becomes a flyer. If he is defeated in battle against a non-flying champion, he can retreat from combat back to his pool. (Def)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 1
cards.text: Champion is a swimmer. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 2
cards.text: Champion is immune to events. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 3
cards.text: Champion is immune to offensive magical items. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)
