cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 4
cards.text: Flyers cannot be played against the attached champion. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 5
cards.text: At the beginning of his turn, this item's owner can examine an opponent's hand. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 6
cards.text: The attached champion becomes an earthwalker. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 for each part. (Off)

cards.name: Rod of 7 Parts, Part 7
cards.text: The champion can ignore one card played against him in combat. If combined with any other parts of the rod, the rod counts as an artifact and gains an additional +1 per part. (Off)

cards.name: Bag of Holding
cards.text: Once per turn the player may discard one card from his pool or his hand, and then draw one card from his draw pile. (Def)

cards.name: Daern's Instant Fortress
cards.text: The Fortress can be played as a magical item or as a holding. The realm or champion is immune to events and offensive spells during other player's turns. (Def)

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: The spellcaster with this item can retain up to two spells after winning a round of combat to use in another battle. Only step 4 spells can be saved. (Def)

cards.name: Plentiful Psionics
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All champions are able to read minds and predict the future. Each player's hand is divided: all Dark Sun cards are concealed, but all other cards are revealed by placing them face-up on the table. The face-up cards are still part of the hand until played.

cards.name: Sorcerer-Kings
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Each Dark Sun realm can be defended once per battle by a sorcerer-king who is a monster that can cast any spell. The sorcerer-king's level is equal to the number of Dark Sun realms and holdings the defender has in play. If the realm already has a defender (on the card), add that defender's level to the sorcerer-king's. If the sorcerer-king is defeated, the realm is razed.

cards.name: Dark Lords
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. If any Ravenloft champion or undead champion of any world is defeated in battle, that champion returns to the player's pool at the end of that player's next turn.

cards.name: The Walking Dead
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Undead champions and Ravenloft monsters can attack razed realms. Allies need not be undead. If a razed realm is defeated, it is discarded and the attacker again draws spoils of victory.

cards.name: Artifact Vault
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. The player can choose to place any Greyhawk Artifacts face-down in a pile called the Artifact Vault. In step 3 of the turn, when cards are played into the pool, the player can distribute the Greyhawk artifacts among his Greyhawk champions in the pool. At the end of his turn, the player returns all Greyhawk artifacts to the Artifact Vault. Cards in the vault are in play, but are not active and cannot be used. Greyhawk artifacts cannot be discarded by any means so long as this rule card is in play; if a champion is discarded, or if any card calls for a Greyhawk artifact to be discarded, it returns to the player's Artifact Vault.

cards.name: Artifact Champions
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Greyhawk Artifacts with numerical bonuses can be played as champions. Artifact-champions are not considered monsters, wizards, clerics, or heroes. Any ability normally given by the artifact to a champion is possessed by the artifact-champion.

cards.name: Isolated Worlds
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Dark Sun cards (champions, artifacts, realms) are immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this rule card is discarded, the owner of the card chooses which cards are discarded to enforce the Rule of the Cosmos again.

cards.name: No Funny Business
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. No events can be played. All events currently in play are immediately discarded when this rule card is played. In addition, no more than one magical item can be attached to any champion. Extras are discarded when this rule card is played (player's choice). In battle, no more than one of each type of card (ally, magical item, artifact, wizard spell, and clerical spell) can be attached to each champion.

cards.name: Forbidden Lore
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Only Ravenloft champions may cast offensive wizard spells.

cards.name: Cosmic Justice
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All realms that have no special powers can borrow the powers of one realm in play, but only when attacked. All champions that have no special powers can steal the power of the opposing champion in combat. The opponent loses his power. All allies that have no special powers are unaffected by the special powers of champions and allies.

cards.name: Roc
cards.text: Flyer. Flying allies cannot be played against the roc. The opponent must discard any already in play.

cards.name: Kinsle the Druid
cards.text: Flyer. In battle, Kinsle can cast cleric spells to aid the attached champion.

cards.name: Dragonbane
cards.text: Any dragon champion is automatically defeated, but returns unharmed to the player's pool. Dragon and draconian allies are discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: The Ship of the Sky
cards.text: Remains with the champion until dispelled. Champion and allies become flyers and swimmers. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Pegasus
cards.text: Flyer.

cards.name: Windrider
cards.text: Flyer.

cards.name: Erica of the Dark Watch
cards.text: Flyer.

cards.name: Dimock the Sprite
cards.text: Flyer. Dimock fights invisibly and cannot be discarded or switch sides during battle for any reason.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: The champion can choose to be a flyer or non-flyer at the beginning of combat. (Def)

cards.name: Ariel Anjelique
cards.text: Flyer. Ariel flies psionically and is immune to spells, allies, and events that harm other flyers.

cards.name: Dragon Slayer
cards.text: All dragons in combat or in pools are immediately discarded.

cards.name: Marilith, Tanar'ri
cards.text: The opposing player cannot play any events for the rest of this round of battle, including Calm.

cards.name: Temporal Stasis
cards.text: In a multi-player game, this card can be played to prevent one player's turn. In a two-player game, this event can prevent an extra turn gained from another card, such as the Caravan.

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: When someone plays an event that affects only you, this card can deflect the effects of that event onto another player, chosen by you.

cards.name: Help!
cards.text: Choose another player to defend your realm. You choose which champions are used. If he loses a round, his champion is discarded; he draws a card for each round he wins.

cards.name: Reverse Gravity
cards.text: All Flyers become non-flyers and vice versa until the beginning of this player's next turn. Swimmers and earthwalkers are unaffected by this card. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Shift Earth
cards.text: The player can freely rearrange his realms and holdings, but must fill from the top down. (Def/3)

cards.name: Mirror Image
cards.text: This spell doubles the caster's level. (Def/4)

cards.name: Ethereality
cards.text: The champion can immediately elude an opposing cleric or hero, ending the round of battle. Both champions go back to their pools. (Def/4)

cards.name: Prismatic Spray
cards.text: Opposing allies of level 4 or less are immediately discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Treasure Vault
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. Any artifact of any world can be attached to this holding. Any champion defending the attached realm can use the artifact.

cards.name: Tupillil
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. When this holding is first played, all champions with the name 'Gib' are discarded.

cards.name: Kestrel's Keep
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. Each of this player's champions and allies gain +1 when defending any realm. This holding stays attached and in play even if the attached realm is razed.

cards.name: Keep of the Dead
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. If something forces the attached realm to be discarded, this holding is discarded in place of the realm, and the realm stays in play.

cards.name: Spellfire Citadel
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. This player can, at the end of each turn, rearrange his holdings. Holdings must still be attached to realms legally.

cards.name: Fire Glyph
cards.text: Hide under the lead realm; expose when the realm is attacked. Only one glyph can be placed under a realm; it is discarded after one use. The attacking champion cannot play allies in this round of battle. (Def/3)

cards.name: Weakness Glyph
cards.text: Hide under the lead realm; expose when the realm is attacked. Only one glyph can be placed under a realm; it is discarded after one use. The attacking champion's base level is a 1 for this round of battle. (Def/3)

cards.name: Lightning Glyph
cards.text: Hide under the lead realm; expose when the realm is attacked. Only one glyph can be placed under a realm; it is discarded after one use. The attacking champion must discard all attached magical items. (Def/3)

cards.name: Curse Glyph
cards.text: Hide under the lead realm; expose when the realm is attacked. Only one glyph can be placed under a realm; it is discarded after one use. An attacking champion with an attached magical item is defeated. (Def/3)

cards.name: Death Glyph
cards.text: Hide under the lead realm; expose when the realm is attacked. Only one glyph can be placed under a realm; it is discarded after one use. An attacking champion without an attached artifact or magical item is defeated. (Def/3)

cards.name: Dragon Turtle
cards.text: Swimmer; can attack any realm that shows coastline on the card.

cards.name: Deathstream, Black Dragon
cards.text: Flyer, swimmer; can attack any realm that shows coastline on the card. One opponent's magical item is discarded. Deathstream can cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Zielesch, Ancient Green Dragon
cards.text: Swimmer; can attack any realm that shows coastline on the card. When Zielesch enters battle, the player can draw a card. If the card is usable, it can be played; otherwise, the card goes in to the player's hand.

cards.name: Dregoth, Undead Dragon-King
cards.text: Undead flyer. Can cast any spell. Immune to psionics and offensive spells. If Dregoth attacks, his level drops to 6.

cards.name: Korgunard the Avangion
cards.text: Flyer. Can cast wizard spells. Immune to psionic attack. Can be discarded to rebuild a razed realm.

cards.name: Drawmij
cards.text: Swimmer; can attack any realm that shows coastline on the card. In battle, he can borrow any magical item in play, returning it when the round ends. Drawmij can imitate the power of any other wizard in play.

cards.name: Klik-Ka'cha
cards.text: When he enters battle as a defender, Klik can destroy one magical item in play anywhere.

cards.name: Mykell, Amethyst Great Wyrm
cards.text: Dragon; flyer, swimmer; can attack any realm that shows coastline on the card. Can cast wizard spells. Mykell psionically destroys any one ally played against him in a round of battle.

cards.name: Hornung the Anarch
cards.text: Each spell cast by Hornung has a level equal to the card number's last digit. Hornung never need ask permission to cast a spell.

cards.name: Invisible Stalker
cards.text: The invisible stalker can also be played as a +4 ally to any champion able to cast spells. If the invisible stalker is on the losing side of a battle, it returns to the player's pool at the end of his next turn.

cards.name: Erital Kaan-Ipzirel
cards.text: This cleric of St. Cuthbert is immune to offensive spells and magical items. When in battle, she can choose to use a dimension door to return to her pool, ending the round of combat; if she does, all attached cards are discarded

cards.name: Yagno Petrovna
cards.text: When used in combat, this player can place any two cards from his opponent's discard on top of his draw pile.

cards.name: Goldmoon
cards.text: Once per turn, in any step, she may cast any cleric spell from an opponent's discard pile, and then place it on the top or bottom of his draw pile.

cards.name: Princess Amber
cards.text: Heroes cannot resist helping the princess. When entering battle, Amber can use any hero in play as an ally; after battle, win or lose, the hero returns to its owner's pool.

cards.name: Darsson Spellmaker
cards.text: When attacking or defending, Darsson can play any card as a defensive spell card, using the last digit of the card number as the spell's level.

cards.name: Council Aerie
cards.text: Dragon champions may defend this realm twice per turn. Opponent's dragons may not attack. Any holding may be attached to Council Aerie.

cards.name: Shining Lands
cards.text: The Shining Lands can be attacked only by flyers or earthwalkers. The realm and its defending champions are immune to offensive spells. Any holding can be attached to the Shining Lands.

cards.name: Bluet Spur
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers and can defend itself as a level 6 monster that can cast wizard spells. Any holding can be attached to Bluet Spur.

cards.name: Hell Furnaces
cards.text: The level of any dragon defending the Hell Furnaces is doubled. Any holding can be attached to this realm.

cards.name: Euripis
cards.text: Only champions able to cast spells can attack this realm. Any holding can be attached to Euripis.

cards.name: New Giustenal
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers, except Dregoth. If razed, this realm can be rebuilt by discarding only 1 card.

cards.name: Ancient Kalidnay
cards.text: This realm is also considered a Ravenloft realm. This realm can be voluntarily razed by the player at the end of his turn, allowing the player to take another turn immediately.

cards.name: Ur Draxa
cards.text: This player's champions are immune to psionic attacks. Champions with attached artifacts or magical items cannot attack this realm, although they can be added during battle.

cards.name: Shault
cards.text: Shault can be attacked only by monsters or flyers. The city can defend itself as any type of level 6 champion, chosen by the player when attacked.

cards.name: The Forest Ridge
cards.text: If the Forest Ridge is razed by an attacking champion, feral halflings eat the winning champion, causing the card (and any possessions) to be discarded.

cards.name: Celik
cards.text: Any champion attacking Celik, must discard all attached magical items or artifacts, and cannot add more during battle.

cards.name: Lake Island
cards.text: Can be attacked only by flyers or earthwalkers. Lake Island defends itself as a level 5 monster.

cards.name: Year of Plenty
cards.text: No events can be played, including Calm, until the end of this player's next turn.

cards.name: Thought Eater
cards.text: Prevents all special powers and spell casting ability of the opponent's champion, allies, spells, and magical items.

cards.name: Deja Vu
cards.text: Take any three cards from an opponent's discard pile and place them on top of his draw pile. (Off/3)

cards.name: Mace of Cuthbert
cards.text: The level bonus (if any) of each opponent's spell is reduced by 2. Undead cannot be used against the attached champion. The Mace is discarded when the attached champion enters battle against luz.

cards.name: Death Rock
cards.text: When a champion of this player dies in battle, a champion with this artifact can keep the dead champion as an undead +2 ally without special powers. These allies return to the pool with a winning champion.

cards.name: Psychometron of Nerad
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to psionics. When the attached champion is discarded, the Psychometron psionically destroys one other champion.

cards.name: Silencer of Bodach
cards.text: If the attached champion is defeated in battle, all of one other player's holdings are discarded. If one of this player's realms is attacked, the attached champion must be used first in defense.

cards.name: Barab's Goblet of Dissolution
cards.text: This artifact can be attached to any champion. When the champion with this item is defeated, the winning champion is sent to the Abyss, permanently removed from play.

cards.name: Onad the Weasel
cards.text: Onad can imitate the effects of any event by being discarded just after that event is played. The use of Onad in this manner is secondary to the use of the actual event.

cards.name: Lord Blacktree
cards.text: At the beginning of a battle, Lord Blacktree can imitate the powers of any single realm or holding in play. Only powers usable during a round of battle can be imitated.

cards.name: Young Strahd
cards.text: Can cast wizard spells. While in play, all Ravenloft champions except Strahd Von Zarovich are turned face down and cannot act. Must defend if Strahd Von Zarovich attacks.

cards.name: Killian
cards.text: Immune to offensive spells. This swashbuckler is the captain of a ship; he and his allies are considered swimmers and can attack any coastal realm.

cards.name: Ghostly Piper
cards.text: Undead. This spectral bagpiper can cast wizard spells. He and any attached cards are immune to the special powers of allies.

cards.name: Forbiddance
cards.text: No attack can be made against any of this player's realms until after this player's next turn. (Def/5)

cards.name: Bigby's Clenched Fist
cards.text: This spell summons a magical fist as a +4 ally. The fist can cause one enemy ally to be discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Fire Charm
cards.text: The special power of an opposing champion or ally is neutralized until the end of the current battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Thunder Staff
cards.text: When this spell is played, all the opponent's allies are discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Spectral Hand
cards.text: This spell can be cast by a champion in the pool to aid a champion in battle. After casting it, the champion in the pool can cast other spells into the same round of battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Ariel's Feather Charm
cards.text: The attached champion becomes an agile flyer. The champion is not affected by cards that normally cause harm specifically to flyers. (Def)

cards.name: Amulet of Spell Protection
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to offensive spells. If this item is in the pool when a spell is cast, the amulet can be discarded to prevent the effects of the spell. (Def)

cards.name: Amelior's Restraint
cards.text: Before battle, choose one opponent's champion; that champion's special abilities are negated until the end of your turn. (Off)

cards.name: Smoke Powder Pistol
cards.text: When this card is used in battle, flip one card from the opponent's draw pile. The last digit of that card's number is an additional bonus for the attached champion. (Off)

cards.name: Dragon Font
cards.text: Draw one less card than usual when beginning your turn. In addition, look at the bottom 5 cards in your draw pile. Place one in your hand and return the others to the bottom of the draw pile. (Def)

cards.name: Roesone
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 5 hero who can use blood abilities.

cards.name: Ilien
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 4 wizard. Any champion can cast wizard spells when defending Ilien.

cards.name: The Spiderfell
cards.text: Before a defender is chosen, the attacking champion must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of the card number. If it's higher than or equal to his base level, he has been poisoned and is discarded. Combat ends with no spoils.

cards.name: The Gorgon's Crown
cards.text: Defending monsters are doubled in base level and can use blood abilities. This realm is immune to offensive spells and harmful events.

cards.name: Avanil
cards.text: f unrazed, may be discarded from the player's formation at any time to draw five cards.

cards.name: Ghoere
cards.text: Any ally may be played in defense of Ghoere as a hero. If successfully defended, the ally remains, acting as a hero champion for future attacks against the realm.

cards.name: Tuarhievel
cards.text: Double the base level of any defending elves (champions and allies). Any champion defending Tuarhievel can cast wizard spells and use blood abilities.

cards.name: Mur-Kilad
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers or swimmers. Defending earthwalkers gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Baruk-Azhik
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers. Baruk-Azhik prevents this player's realms from being attacked via the Underdark realms.

cards.name: Impregnable Heart of Haelyn
cards.text: Defending champions can cast cleric spells and use blood abilities. Defending clerics are immune to offensive blood abilities.

cards.name: Tower of the Sword Mage
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by awnsheghlien. Defending champions can cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Imperial City of Anuire
cards.text: Draw a card whenever an opposing player plays an event card.

cards.name: The Heartland Outfitters
cards.text: This player's Birthright champions can fly, swim, or earthwalk as needed.

cards.name: Proudglaive
cards.text: The base level of a hero defending the attached realm is doubled or the base level of a defending champion is tripled if he doesn't use allies.

cards.name: Kal-Saitharak
cards.text: The base level of a defending monster is doubled. Monsters in this player's pool are immune to psionic power cards.

cards.name: Magical Source
cards.text: Phase 4 spells cast by champions of this player gain a +4 level bonus.

cards.name: The Maze of Maalvar the Minotaur
cards.text: Only flyers or earthwalkers can attack the attached realm.

cards.name: Espionage!
cards.text: Examine another player's draw pile and place four cards of your choice on the top. (Harmful)

cards.name: Chaos!
cards.text: All players (starting with the event player) take turns playing event cards until all event cards in all hands have been played. Events which state they can only be played at certain times (Caravan, Weasel Attack, etc) are played with no effect. (Harmful)

cards.name: Investiture Ceremony
cards.text: Play on one champion to allow him to use blood abilities. Lasts until negated or champion is discarded. (Helpful)

cards.name: Forge Ley Line
cards.text: Negates for this player any champion's immunity to offensive spells until the end of this player's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Biding Your Time
cards.text: Player can skip his turn and use it later in the game between any two players' turns. This event remains in play until used or canceled. (Helpful)

cards.name: In Search of Adventure
cards.text: Send one of your champions to Limbo until the beginning of your next turn. When he returns, draw a card from the draw pile and add the last digit of the card number to the champion's base level as a permanent increase. (Helpful)

cards.name: Revolution!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no realm champions may be used to defend. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Kraken Attacks!
cards.text: Razes two realms in one player's formation that have coastlines. The kraken can be satisfied (negated) by discarding champions totaling 8 levels or more from hand or pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Crown of Regency
cards.text: When the attached champion is used in defense, the crown copies the powers of any holding in play for the defending realm. (Def)

cards.name: Armor of the High King
cards.text: During phase 3, the attached champion can retrieve one blood ability card from his discard pile to his hand. (Def)

cards.name: Dragon's Teeth
cards.text: Draw and discard a card each time the Teeth are used in battle, noting the last digit of the card's number. For that round, the attached champion gains an undead ally equal to that digit. (Def)

cards.name: Bracers of Brachiation
cards.text: Allows the attached champion and his allies to attack any realm showing trees, regardless of position or special powers. (Def)

cards.name: Ring of Human Influence
cards.text: Heroes cannot defend against the attached champion. (Off)

cards.name: Ring of Spell Storing
cards.text: Up to three spells playable in phase 4 may be stored in this item, remaining until used or dispelled. These spells may be cast during any battle, including combat where this champion is not involved. New spells may be attached during phase 3 only. (Def)

cards.name: Rod of Lordly Might
cards.text: Can only be attached to heroes. This champion and attached allies are considered flyers. Allies of level 5 and lower cannot be used against this hero. (Off)

cards.name: Amulet of Plane Walking
cards.text: The attached champion and its allies may attack any realm, regardless of position or special powers, ignoring the effect of an attached holding. (Def)

cards.name: Cloak of Displacement
cards.text: The attached champion can attack twice if he wins on his first round, but doesn't raze a realm. He uses new allies. (Def)

cards.name: Alertness
cards.text: Blood ability. This champion can use his special power first when defending. Alertness lasts until the end of this player's next turn and can be dispelled. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Animal Affinity
cards.text: Blood ability. Creates a +4 ally which remains with the user until he is defeated. This ally cannot be forced to switch sides for any reason. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Battlewise
cards.text: Blood ability. Double the affected champion's current total level until the end of this player's next turn. Can be dispelled. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Courage
cards.text: Blood ability. Allies of this champion cannot be discarded during battle or made to switch sides. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Divine Wrath
cards.text: Blood ability. All opposing allies are instantly discarded. No new allies can be played against this champion. Lasts until the end of this player's next turn. (Off/4)

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text: Blood ability. The attached champion is not discarded when defeated in battle; instead it goes to Limbo until the end of this player's next turn, when it returns to its pool. (Def/4)

cards.name: Touch of Decay
cards.text: Blood ability. Examine an opponent's hand and pool. Discard one magical item or artifact from either one. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Unreadable Thoughts
cards.text: Blood ability. This champion is immune to the effects of offensive psionic power cards and the special powers of psionicists. Play anytime to negate the effects of any just played psionic power card. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Death Touch
cards.text: Blood ability. Opposing champion must draw a card from his draw pile and note the last digit of the card number. If it is equal to or greater than his base level, he is instantly discarded. Can be dispelled. (Off/4)

cards.name: Detect Life
cards.text: Blood ability. An opponent must display his hand for this round of combat. (Def/4)

cards.name: Invulnerability
cards.text: Blood ability. This champion ignores the special powers of offensive magical items of less than +4 enchantment or cancels one offensive blood ability card. (Def/4)

cards.name: Tighmaevril Sword
cards.text: The attached champion can use blood abilities and instantly defeats regent.

cards.name: Wintering
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to either the special power of a champion or the special powers of his allies. The choice must be made at the start of the player's turn and remains the same until his next turn.

cards.name: Emperor's Crown of Anuire
cards.text: No Birthright champions can attack this player's realms or cast offensive spells against those realms.

cards.name: Kingstopper
cards.text: Protects the attached champion and all monsters in this player's pool from harmful events.

cards.name: Bless Land
cards.text: All realm champions are doubled in level and are immune to the special powers of allies until the end of this player's turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Blight
cards.text: All realms, artifacts, and holdings that grant extra cards are negated while this spell is in play, which lasts until dispelled. (Off/3)

cards.name: Investiture
cards.text: Cast at any time. Discard a regent champion from your pool to transfer the power to use blood abilities to another champion. (Def)

cards.name: Control Weather
cards.text: No flyers or swimmers can be involved in combat until the end of this player's next turn without this player's permission. (Off/3/4/5)

cards.name: Transmute Metal to Wood
cards.text: Destroy one magical item or artifact in any player's pool. (Off/3)

cards.name: Part Water
cards.text: This player's champions and allies can attack any realm showing a coastline until the end of this turn. (Def/3)

cards.name: Speak with Monsters
cards.text: Instantly ends a battle with a monster. Both champions return to their pools. No spoils of victory are drawn. (Off/4)

cards.name: Summon Insects
cards.text: Creates a +7 ally for the caster that devours (discards) one opposing ally. (Off/4)

cards.name: Legion of Dead
cards.text: Creates an undead monster equal to the adjusted level of the casting champion. The spell acts as a champion and may attack or defend, lasting until the end of this player's next turn. Attachments may be added normally, though are discarded when the spell ends. (Off/3)

cards.name: Raze
cards.text: This spell razes an opponent's realm that has no attached holding, chosen by this player. The caster is immediately discarded. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Blood Drain
cards.text: The affected champion can no longer use blood abilities. Lasts until dispelled. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Otto's Irresistible Dance
cards.text: Cast on any enemy champion in a pool; he cannot attack or defend until the Dance is dispelled. (Off/3)

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: Cast at any time to allow this player to bring a champion currently in play elsewhere into this player's pool. The champion's powers are unchanged. (Def)

cards.name: Drawmij's Instant Summons
cards.text: Take any ally, magical item, or artifact from your draw pile and play it immediately. Reshuffle the draw pile. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: The Gorgon
cards.text: Awnshegh. Can use blood abilities and wizard spells. This creature is so horrible that no allies can be played against him. Immune to harmful events.

cards.name: The Spider
cards.text: Awnshegh. Can use blood abilities. Immune to offensive cleric spells. The Spider can attack a razed realm. If victorious, the realm is discarded.

cards.name: Banshegh
cards.text: Awnshegh. Between 6 PM and 6 AM the Banshegh is a level 10 monster that can use blood abilities. Between 6 AM and 6 PM the Banshegh is a level 5 wizard capable of also casting cleric spells. In either form the Banshegh is immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: The Lamia
cards.text: Awnshegh. Immune to psionics. Can use blood abilities. Wizards and clerics are at half their base level (rounded down) against the Lamia.

cards.name: The Siren
cards.text: Swimmer. Awnshegh. Can use blood abilities. Can be sent to Limbo to force another player to attack this player's formation. The Siren is returned at the end of this player's next turn.

cards.name: The White Witch
cards.text: Awnshegh. Immune to offensive spells and harmful events except those that have the word "fire," "flame," or "flaming" in the title.

cards.name: The Hag
cards.text: Awnshegh. Can cast wizard spells. Immune to psionics. If defeated in combat the Hag can "curse" an opposing player, forcing him to discard a holding in play.

cards.name: Cerilian Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Can cast cleric spells. When attacking, the Cerilian Dragon may use its breath weapon to destroy any holding in the defender's formation.

cards.name: The Shadow World
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. If defeated in combat, all halfling champions and allies can dimension door away, returning to their player's hand instead of being discarded.

cards.name: Divine Right
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All heroes in play may use blood ability cards.

cards.name: Orogs
cards.text: Orogs are +4 when attacking and/or +6 if attached to an awnshegh.

cards.name: Green Slime
cards.text: The Green Slime destroys the first magical item or ally played after it enters battle.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text: Flyer. The Nightmare becomes +8 vs. clerics or wizards.

cards.name: Unicorn
cards.text: The attached champion can cast wizard or cleric spells.

cards.name: Wraith
cards.text: Flyer. Undead. Reduces an opposing champion's base level by 2. If the reduced base level is 0 or less, the champion is discarded.

cards.name: Stirge Swarm
cards.text: Flyer. Draw and discard a card from any opponent's draw pile when the Stirge Swarm is played, noting the last digit of the card number, which is the bonus for this ally.

cards.name: Ankheg
cards.text: Earthwalker. Destroys one opposing nonflying ally.

cards.name: Wood Nymph
cards.text: The Wood Nymph becomes +6 if defending a realm showing trees.

cards.name: Giant Squid
cards.text: Swimmer. Instantly destroys (discards) any opposing Brine Dragons, ignoring their special power.

cards.name: Lord Cronal
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and hero unarmed combat cards. Inspires confidence in all allies played with him, who each gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Grimm Graybeard
cards.text: Dwarf. Earthwalker. Can use blood abilities and can cast cleric spells. Immune to offensive magical items of less than +2 enchantment.

cards.name: Teodor Profiev
cards.text: Can use blood abilities. Gains 5 levels against monsters.

cards.name: Darien Avan
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and hero unarmed combat cards. Can attack twice; if he wins his first round and doesn't raze a realm, he can attack again, retaining one of his allies from the previous round of battle.

cards.name: Caliedhe Dosiere
cards.text: Can use blood abilities. When attacking, he can cast cleric spells; when defending, he can cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Tomkin Dross
cards.text: Halfling. Can use blood abilities. Tomkin and his allies may attack any realm in play, regardless of position or special power.

cards.name: The Elf Prince Fhileraene
cards.text: Elf. Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. When attacking, he can call upon his archers to destroy (discard) a monster in a player's pool, once per battle.

cards.name: Tie'skar Graecher the Goblin King
cards.text: Can use blood abilities. He can "borrow" one monster from any pool to act as an ally. If defeated, the monster ally is stripped of attachments and returned.

cards.name: The Noble Outlaw
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and hero unarmed combat cards. Once per turn, he can prevent a player from receiving a spoils of victory, giving it to a third player instead. (In a two-player game, no one collects spoils.)

cards.name: High Mage Aelies
cards.text: Elf. Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. Gains +2 to his base level for every unrazed Birthright realm in play.

cards.name: The Sword Mage
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. Gains 4 levels if spells are used against him.

cards.name: The Wizard
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. The Wizard can discard a realm in his player's formation to instantly win a round of battle.

cards.name: Nadia Vasily
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. Clerics facing Nadia are at half their base level (rounded down).

cards.name: Moergan
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. Once per any battle, Moergan can summon rains that force flying allies from the sky. They are discarded instantly.

cards.name: Barak the Dark
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. Gains 3 levels if using a magical item weapon; gains 2 levels if allies are used against him.

cards.name: Jana Orel
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. Immune to offensive cleric spells. If Jana is to receive a spoils, this player can look at the top two cards in his draw pile and choose the one he wants.

cards.name: The Flower of Roesone
cards.text: This foppish fighter tends to be underestimated in combat. Allies played against him lose 3 levels. Allies may have negative levels.

cards.name: Gwenyth the Bard
cards.text: Elf. Gwenyth's music is so enchanting she can prevent a champion in another pool from attacking her player's formation. The music lasts until the start of this player's next turn, at which time she can select a different champion to be affected.

cards.name: It's Good to Be the King
cards.text: Until the beginning of his next turn, this event player chooses which champions are able to attack. Even if negated, all players must still address the event player as "Sir" or "Madam." (Harmful)

cards.name: The Shadow World
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all undead are immune to offensive spells, magical items, and events that specifically target undead or monsters. (Helpful)

cards.name: Forced Conscription
cards.text: All players must donate an ally to the event player's side in battle, if they have one. All allies are discarded at the end of combat. (Harmful)

cards.name: Sphere of Annihilation
cards.text: Opposing champions defeated by the attached champion are sent to the Abyss instead of being discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Vacuous Grimoire
cards.text: If the attached champion is defeated by a champion able to cast spells, the book is attached to that champion, subtracting 5 from his base level. If the base level is now 0 or less, the champion is discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Manual of Puissant Skill at Arms
cards.text: The attached hero may make an extra attack if he win his first round and doesn't raze a realm. (Def)

cards.name: Book of Infinite Spells
cards.text: The attached champion can cast wizard and cleric spells. Phase 4 spells cast by the attached champion cannot be dispelled. (Def)

cards.name: Libram of Ineffable Damnation
cards.text: Can only be attached to a wizard, who is now immune to offensive spells. If defeated in combat, this champion is sent to the Abyss. (Def)

cards.name: The Count of M�den
cards.text: Swimmer. Can use blood abilities and psionic power cards. The Count controls the most powerful navy in Cerilia. All attached swimming allies of this champion are doubled in level.

cards.name: The Wizardess Carrie
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. Carrie can summon a djinni to aid her in battle, which acts as a +8 flying ally.

cards.name: The Pontifex of the Southern Coast
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. The Pontifex can be discarded in phase 5 to call for a crusade against another player. Until the end of this player's next turn, all clerics in pools must attack that player, if possible.

cards.name: Olaf the Sly
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and hero unarmed combat cards. In combat, Olaf can "borrow" any magical item in play. At the end of the battle the item can be discarded or returned to the player; if returned, this player draws one card.

cards.name: Targoth the Unclean
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. All noncleric champions are halved in base level (rounded down) against Targoth.

cards.name: Rhuobhe Manslayer
cards.text: Elf. Awnshegh. Can use blood abilities and cast wizard spells. When attacking, Rhuobhe can imitate the special power of any champion in any pool. Gains 4 levels against nonmonster champions.

cards.name: Kaeriaen Whiteheart
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and cast cleric spells. Gains 5 levels vs. awnswegh.

cards.name: Adara Addlepate
cards.text: Can use blood abilities and can cast wizard spells. Adara can instantly defeat any champion with the "# of 25" (chase cards), but must then be discarded herself.

cards.name: The Blood of Azrai
cards.text: Adds 5 levels to any monster and makes it an awnshegh, who can now use blood abilities. The event lasts until negated or the champion is discarded. (Helpful)

cards.name: Taxation
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Instead of drawing three cards at the beginning of a turn, each player draws one card and a card for each unrazed Birthright realm in his formation. A minimum of one card is drawn; nothing can reduce the draw below one.

cards.name: Diplomacy
cards.text: Playable only when first being attacked, the event player requests that the attacker attack someone else's realm instead. If he chooses to ignore the event, he must discard two cards from his hand to continue his initial attack. (Harmful)

cards.name: Blood Challenge!
cards.text: Play at any time to make an attack directly against a champion in any pool. Combat lasts for one round, and the loser is discarded. The winner receives a spoils of victory, even though no realm was razed. (Harmful)

cards.name: Festival
cards.text: No combat can occur until the start of this player's next turn. Each player draws a card when this event is played. (Harmful)

cards.name: Child's Play
cards.text: Subtract the age of the youngest player from the age of the oldest player in the game. That number is counted as a bonus to your side in this round of combat. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Fates
cards.text: Each player draws and discards a card, noting its last digit. If it's even, lose that many cards from your hand, pool, or formation. If it's odd, draw that many cards. (Harmful)

cards.name: War Declared!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all players must attack on their turn if they have champions in their pools. All champions and allies can fly, swim, or earthwalk as needed. (Harmful)

cards.name: Mebhaigl Surge
cards.text: All players may return their defensive spells from their discard piles to their hand. (Helpful)

cards.name: Aonia Sunblaze
cards.text: Can use hero unarmed combat cards. Immune to unarmed combat cards useable only by undead and the 'Negative Planar Energies' rule card. May not use undead allies and is discarded if in a pool with undead champions.

cards.name: Dark Cleric
cards.text: Can use Undead Unarmed Combat cards. Every turn that this champion doesn't attack, his player may return one undead/werebeast champion from his discard pile to his draw pile which is then reshuffled. Gains 5 levels if played from 6PM to 6AM.

cards.name: Beastmaster
cards.text: When in combat, the Beastmaster may summon an ally chosen at random from an opponent's hand. This ally can not be forced to switch sides or discarded.

cards.name: Murtha the Gypsy
cards.text: Immune to all thief skills. While in a pool, negates the effects of Necba the Wrathmaker, Poor Oriental Lord, and Wealthy Oriental Vassal for all players.

cards.name: Gib Cram
cards.text: This player's champions and attached cards are immune to the special powers and abilities of realms and realm champions.

cards.name: Gib Thiaf
cards.text: May use any support card. May use Dragonlance artifacts. When in combat, her attachments activate first, regardless if attacking or defending.

cards.name: Pirate
cards.text: Swimmer. Can use thief skills. During phase 3 the pirate may send all magic items and artifacts attached to any one champion in play to Limbo. The attachments are returned to the champion the next time he enters battle.

cards.name: Footlong, Avatar of the Mimic
cards.text: Avatar. A Spoon, Knife (Sword) and Fork; must be discarded to bring this avatar into play. While this avatar is in play all players must attack on their turns or discard their lowest level champion in play.

cards.name: The Brewmaster
cards.text: Dwarf. In phase 0, this champion may either recover one magic item with the words 'oil' or 'potion' in the title from the discard pile, or take one such card from his deck, and play it immediately upon himself.

cards.name: Tyr, Avatar of Justice
cards.text: Avatar. Two heroes must be discarded to bring Tyr into play. This player and all of his cards are immune to all offensive thief skills. All champions in play can only be sent to the abyss through combat. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Cai, Amateur Dragonslayer
cards.text: Cai's bravado amuses dragons of base level 6 or higher. Before combat, the opponent rolls 1d10. On a roll of 3 or less, the dragon returns to his pool laughing hysterically. The battle can continue with new champions.

cards.name: The Chronomancer
cards.text: Players must ask the Chronomancer permission to get extra turns. Once you take a free turn or deny a free turn, at the beginning of your next phase 3, choose an opponent. The player immediately gains control of the Chronomancer as if it was their champion.

cards.name: Marius
cards.text: Undead. Elf. Vampire. Any opposing champion defeated by Marius becomes undead vampire champion, with no special powers, under the control of this player. May kill one opposing ally during a combat where she is involved.

cards.name: Shadow Drake
cards.text: Dragon, flyer, earthwalker. Immune to harmful events. This champion and his allies may attack any Underdark realm regardless of position or restrictions. Shadowdrake gains 5 levels when facing an Underdark champion.

cards.name: Hextor
cards.text: Avatar. Two Greyhawk monsters must be discarded to bring Hextor into play. While in the pool Hextor doubles the level of all monsters of this player and makes them immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: Tummbutt, the Faerie Dragon
cards.text: Tummbutt can be sent to Limbo at any time, allowing this player to rearrange all attachments in any one players pool. All attachments still must be legally attached. Tummbutt returns to the pool at the end of his player's next turn.

cards.name: Doppelganger
cards.text: At the start of each turn and/or before combat, this champion can become any type of champion (regent, hero, theif, etc.). Immune to offensive cards usable by his current champion type.

cards.name: The Warmonger
cards.text: Can use hero unarmed combat cards. Every time this champion has an ally card played with him in battle, this player may draw a card. This champion gains 2 levels for each ally currently in play.

cards.name: Avatar of Osprem
cards.text: Avatar. Discard 12 levels of swimming champions to bring the Avatar of Osprem into play. All champions and allies of this player become swimmers, and receive +4 to their base levels when attacking. When attacking coastal realms, one oposing ally may be discarded per battle. This player's champions are not affected by card powers that target swimmers.

cards.name: Lurker Above
cards.text: Can only defend. Attackers mistake the Lurker Above for the ceiling and are surprised. The opponent rolls 1d10. If the die roll is greater than attacker's base level, the attacker is discarded. The Lurker Above is immune to cards that specifically harm monsters.

cards.name: Piranhas
cards.text: Hide this ally under a realm indicating water and reveal when an attack occurs. The opponenet rolls 1d6. If the number is even the attacking champion and piranhas are discarded. The piranhas cannot be discarded through combat by any means, and remains with the realm until its power is successful.

cards.name: Henchman
cards.text: Once played, this ally remains with the attached champion. Any number of magic items and artifacts may be attached to the ally regardless of any restrictions (Rule of Cosmos, world, race, etc.). If discarded, all cards with the same name as card on the Henchman are discarded also.

cards.name: Servants of Faith
cards.text: Can cast priest spells. May be attached to a cleric during phase 3. While attached to a cleric, that champion's base level is doubled. This ally cannot be forced to change sides during combat, and returns with the cleric in a victorious combat.

cards.name: Chain Master
cards.text: When played, immediately discards all allies of level 5 or higher. While the chain master is in play, no further allies may be played.

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Castable at anytime. Search your draw pile for any rule card. Put that card into play then discard the casting champion and this spell to the abyss.

cards.name: Chant
cards.text: Castable only by Clerics. The champion is immune to offensive magical item and spells. If the caster win a round of battle, the spell may be used by each champion for the duration of the combat. The spell is then reshuffled into the draw pile. If the cleric loses the round, the spell is sent ot the abyss. (Def/4)

cards.name: Watahh!
cards.text: Playable at any time during combat, this player can choose to discard any 2 cards of the opposing player's force (excluding the champion), or to deflect the special power of any just played card back at the opposing player's force before it activates. (Off)

cards.name: Know What You Are Hiding!!!
cards.text: While this power is in play, all players must keep all pools face up regardless of immunities. This power lasts until dispelled. (Off 3)

cards.name: Curse of the Wolves Blood
cards.text: Play on any non-Werebeast champion, who now becomes a Werewolf immune to magical items of less thatn +4 enchantment. However, the attached champion must attack every turn or be discarded regardless of special powers. (Off 3)

cards.name: Oil of Impact
cards.text: All other attached weapons that are magic items and artifacts are tripled in icon bonus. (Def)

cards.name: Oil of Fumbling
cards.text: Attach to any champion in any pool. The attached champion discards all other magic items and artifacts currently attached to him, and may not attach any more until Oil is removed. May be dispelled by any dispel spell. (Off)

cards.name: Oil of Disenchantment
cards.text: Discard from any pool to the Abyss to send any magic item to the abyss, or any artifact to the discard pile. (Off)

cards.name: Potion of Alter Self
cards.text: Discard from the attached champion at any time to make the attached champion a flyer; or swimmer; or earthwalker; or may change champion type. The potion's effect last for 1d4 turns.

cards.name: Nectar
cards.text: Discard to the abyss during your phase 3 to give your champion +1d6 levels and can only be killed in combat by an opponent's actions. If the same champion discards Ambrosia to the abyss, your champion cannot be discarded from your pool by any means and becomes an avatar. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Ambrosia
cards.text: Discard to the abyss during your phase 3 to give your champion +1d6 levels and can only be killed in combat by an opponent's actions. If the same champion discards Nectar to the abyss, your champion cannot be discarded from your pool by any means and becomes an avatar. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Potion of ESP
cards.text: When discarded from the pool, opponents must then play with their hands face up for 1d4 turns OR send the potion to the Abyss to discard one card from each opponent's hand. (Off)

cards.name: Potion of Heroism
cards.text: When discarded from battle, the champion gains 3d4 levels until the end of the current turn.

cards.name: Potion of Invulnerability
cards.text: May be discarded from attached champion at any time to make this champion immune to offensive magic items and artifacts for 1d4 turns.

cards.name: Potion of Undead Control
cards.text: May be discarded from battle to summon any undead champion from any pool as an ally. If the champion is defeated or discarded, then the undead champion goes to the owner's discard pile.

cards.name: Potion of Super-Heroism
cards.text: May be only used by Heros. When discarded from battle, this hero gains 5d6 levels and is immune to offensive unarmed combat cards until the end of the current turn.

cards.name: Potion of Glibness
cards.text: When discarded from combat, retrieve any one thief skill from the discard pile directly into combat. (Def/4)

cards.name: Potion of Healing
cards.text: When discarded from battle, any non-undead, non-werebeast ally in the discard pile or Abyss may be immediately played into battle. (Def)

cards.name: Loaf of Smiting
cards.text: Weapon. Negates the icon bonus of 1 offensive magic item used by an opponent. Roll 2d10. If either die comes up with a 0, the champion is knocked out and placed under the attacked realm. If doubles are rolled, the loaf breaks and is immediately discarded. If 00 is rolled, the champion is sent to the abyss. Knocked out champions return to their pools when the realm is razed of discarded. (off)

cards.name: Badge of Honor
cards.text: The attached champion is considered an adventurer for the purpose of card play. (def).

cards.name: Fork of Defense
cards.text: This charmed eating utensil allows a defender to block the use of any sword. Their bonuses are negated as well as any powers they have. (def)

cards.name: Bag of Devouring
cards.text: This bag may be sent to the void from the hand or pool at any time to send all other "bags" in play to the abyss, regardless of immunities. (Def)

cards.name: Metal Detector
cards.text: Can only be attached to any champion of base level 5 or less. Once per turn, this artifact can be used to move a card from the discard pile, chosen at random, to the owner's deck. The deck is then shuffled.

cards.name: Blackjammer's Cutlass
cards.text: May be attached to a champion from any world. This champion is now considered worldless, but gets the world bonus in any combat over a realm. While in combat, this champion is immune to artifacts attached to a champion from a world different from its own.

cards.name: Nuclear Free Zone
cards.text: All spell, psionic power and event cards that can discard realms are sent to the Abyss from all hands, discards, and draw piles, regardless of an immunity or special power. Each player may then draw a card for each card sent to the Abyss. This event may only be negated, it cannont be calmed by individual players. (Harmful)

cards.name: Shapeshifters Invade!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all players can ignore the Rule of Cosmos in regard to champions. All duplicate champions in play when this event expires fight their "duplicate" to see which champion stays in play. (Helpful)

cards.name: Planar Refugee
cards.text: Target champion has his world designation changed to the event player's choice. Lasts until negated or discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Spanish Inquisition
cards.text: All champions able to cast cleric spells are sent to limbo until the end of their owner's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Black Jack
cards.text: Play during a round of battle. Each player plays 21, discarding a card from the top of the draw pile and tallying the last digit for each card 'dealt'. They may 'hit' as many times as desired. The player closest to 21 (with out going over) wins the battle, all cards are discarded regardless of game play. If both player's tie the battle is over with no victor, all cards are still discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: False Sense of Security
cards.text: Roll 1d4. All immunities are canceled, including immunities to events, for that many turns. This event may only be negated, it cannot be calmed by individual players. (Harmful)

cards.name: Burned at the Stake
cards.text: Play on any champion that does not have an icon ability to cast (i.e., Hero, Monster, etc.) just after they cast a spell. That champion is sent to the abyss or the player may discard three cards, at random, from hand to save the champion.

cards.name: High Tide
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. All swimmers can attack any realm regardless of position or restiction. All swimmers gain +3 to their base levels.

cards.name: Welcome to the Dojo
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. This card is immune to events and the wish spell. Unarmed combat cards are reshuffled into the draw pile after use.

cards.name: Keep it on the Battlefield
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. The Weasel Attack! Event cannot be played. Cards in play but not in battle cannot affect a battle. Cards involved in battle can only affect other cards in the battle. Powers that take effect after a battle has ended can only target the cards that were involved in the battle, the attacked realm, or the players involved.

cards.name: Logistics
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. While this rule card is in play, realms which place restrictions on attacking card types or force cards to be discarded to attack now have these conditions placed on defenders instead.

cards.name: Rain of Colorless Fire
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. All events, spells, and psionic powers that cause the razing/discarding of realms outside of combat now come with a cost. To play the spell, event, or psionic power card, a card of the same type must also be discarded from hand. If the player can not discard a card of the same type, the initial card can not be played.

cards.name: Speed Kills
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. When a player draws the last card of their deck, the discard pile is NOT reshuffled to make a new draw pile. The special powers of all cards that return or reshuffles cards from the discard pile to the draw pile are negated.

cards.name: King of Nothing
cards.text: All of this player's blood abilities gain an additional bonus equal to the current numbr of cards this player's hand.

cards.name: Cloud Giants Castle
cards.text: This players Giants may attack any realm, regardless of position or restriction.

cards.name: Playing Fair
cards.text: This player can play any card from any set/series regardless of any card that an opponent has in play that prohibits said cards from being played. If this dungeon leaves play, any cards that prohibit card play are sent to the abyss.

cards.name: Raistlin's Library
cards.text: Whenever this player casts any spell roll 1d10. On a roll of 1-4, the spell may not be turned or retargeted. On a roll of 5-8, the spell may not be dispelled. On a 9-0, the spell is retargeted at a legal target that this player owns.

cards.name: The Pack
cards.text: All of this player's champions are afflicted with lycanthropy and are considered were-beasts who are immune to offensive magical items of less than +4 enchantment, while this dungeon is in play.

cards.name: Amish Nick's Farm
cards.text: One holding of each world may be attached to this realm. If this realm is razed or discarded all attached holdings are reshuffled into their player's draw pile.

cards.name: Picque Moi
cards.text: Underdark. This realm may have any holding attached and must be the first targeted in the formation by cards played outside of combat.

cards.name: The Desolation
cards.text: Attacking champions lose 4 base levels. If this realm is razed or discarded, no spoils of victory are drawn for it.

cards.name: Mountain Lookout Tower
cards.text: May only be attached to a realm showing mountains from any world. Any flyer defending the attached realm has their attachments activate first during combat, and may play one card into combat first, regardless of who is currently winning the battle.

cards.name: Darkmoon
cards.text: Each attacking champion must roll 2d10. If doubles are rolled, the attacking champion is discarded, if not the champion attacks normally. Can defend the realm as a level 5 monster champion (dragon).

cards.name: Not So Fast
cards.text: This card cannot be included in a deck that includes The Caravan or Good Fortune. May be discarded from hand or formation when an opponent attempts to draw extra cards (other than spoils), rebuild a realm, or attempts to take an extra turn. If discarded in this manner, counter that action.

cards.name: Glass Golem
cards.text: Counts as a magic item. All spells cast at this golem (and the attached champion) are reflected back at the caster. If defeated in combat, it shatters, sending the victorious champion to the discard pile. If defeated in combat as an ally, it returns to pool as a level 8 monster champion.

cards.name: Stone Golem
cards.text: Counts as a magic item. Earthwalker. Immune to offensive spells. If defeated in combat, all spells in all discard piles are sent to the Abyss. If defeated in combat as an ally, returns to pool as a level 6 monter.

cards.name: Wood Golem
cards.text: Counts as a magic item. Swimmer. Immune to blood abilities and thief skills. If defeated in combat, all artifacts in play are sent to the discard pile. If defeated in combat as an ally, returns to pool as a level 5 monster.

cards.name: Sand Golem
cards.text: Earthwalker. Counts as a magic item. Immune to magic items of less than +6 enchantment. If defeated, all magic items in play are sent to the Abyss. If defeated in combat as an ally, returns to pool as a level 6 monster.

cards.name: Coral Golem
cards.text: Counts as a magic item. Swimmer. In combat, discards any one opposing swimming ally. If defeated in combat, attachments on all non-swimming champions are discarded. If defeated as an ally, returns to pool as a level 5 monster.

cards.name: Bone Golem
cards.text: Counts as a magic item. Immune to the power of undead champions. If defeated in combat, all undead champions and allies in all discard piles go to the Abyss. If defeated as an ally, returns to pool as a level 4 undead monster.

cards.name: Corruption of the Soul
cards.text: Castable only by clerics. The corruption runs so deep that the targeted non-avatar champion loses their immunity to offensive spells and is sent to the Abyss. The casting cleric is sent to limbo for 1d6 turns. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Earth to Earth
cards.text: Castable only by a cleric. If cast immediately after a realm is razed or discarded, the realm remains in the formation, unrazed. The casting cleric is then sent to the Abyss. (Def)

cards.name: Extension II
cards.text: Can be cast only during combat to make a phase 4 spell without a duration last for that entire phase 4. All of this player's champions involved during the combat gain the level bonus and special powers of the extended spell immediately upon entering battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Burning Hands
cards.text: Fire spell. The opposing champion has his hands burned, preventing him from casting spells and using thief skills. Stays with opposing champion until champion is discarded or this spell is dispelled. (Off/4)

cards.name: Delayed Fireball
cards.text: Cast at a player's pool. When that player reaches Phase 5 of his next turn, roll 2d6. All champions of less than the rolled level are sent to the discard pile. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Tampering
cards.text: Playable only after a champion activates a magic item to use its effects during phase 3. Instead of working, the champion and the magic item are sent to the Abyss regardless of card play and immunities. (Off)

cards.name: False Arrest
cards.text: Can be used by any champion. Arrest (send to limbo) any champion who has at least one attachment for 2d6 turns. At the start that player's turn, the player may pay a fine (discard all attachments) to return to their pool. (Off)

cards.name: Assassination!
cards.text: Usable only by a thief. No champion is safe (immune) from Assassination! Discard any one champion in play and the thief using Assassination! (Off/3)

cards.name: Bribe
cards.text: Play when a champion attacks this player. The attacking player may choose to continue the attack, or place the top 3 cards of his draw pile off to the side and put them into his hand during the NEXT phase 0 and immediately move to phase 5. (Def)

cards.name: Framed!
cards.text: Play only when one of your champions is targeted by any action by an opponent. Choose another champion in any player's pool, that champion is now the target of the action, and is affected regardless of special abilities or immunities. (Def)

cards.name: Raise!
cards.text: Can only be played during another player's phase 0. This power can rebuild a razed realm, but the realm cannot be used to win the game during the turn it was played. The using champion cannot attack or defend realms until the end this player's next turn. (Def)

cards.name: Destroy Thought
cards.text: Play this card after an attack is declared one of your realms. The attacking champion returns to the pool and cannot attack or defend until this power is dispelled. (Off)

cards.name: Domination
cards.text: Play on a champion in an opposing player's pool and place that champion into your pool. The affected champion may not act while this power is in play. (Off/3)

cards.name: Finishing Move
cards.text: Useable by any champion. Play only if you have just won a round of combat. You may continue to play cards into the battle. If at any time your champion's level is at least double that of the opposing champion, you may send the opposing champion (and all attached cards) to the Abyss (regardless of special powers) and draw a card. (Off/4)

cards.name: Thwap!
cards.text: May only be played by a giant with an attached magic item or artifact. The opposing champion is squished into goo, going directly to the Abyss. (Off/4)

cards.name: Concussing Blow
cards.text: Raises this champion's adjusted level to one greater than the level of the opposing champion. If played immediately after 'Ambush' (152/4th), both cards are shuffled back into the player's draw pile after battle instead of being discarded. (Def/4)

cards.name: Humiliation
cards.text: Play on any champion in play. They are so humiliated that they hide under any realm in that player's formation. He cannot take any action. He is the first to defend this realm and is brought back into play, if victorious. If the realm is razed/discarded, outside of combat, he returns to the pool. (Off/3)

cards.name: Blood of Azhul
cards.text: The user may attack again until the realm is razed as long as each previous round of the battle was a victory for the user. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Gatekeeper's Lost Foon
cards.text: Counts as a spoon and a fork. While in play, cards cannot leave the Abyss. (Def)

cards.name: Kinetic Armor
cards.text: Not usable by thieves or wizards. Turns offensive unarmed combat cards back at the user. Can be played in combat to turn a just played unarmed combat card. (Def)

cards.name: Mace of Blood Drain
cards.text: +8 if used by any undead. May be attached at any time to a champion to absorb any blood ability as it is played. The blood ability is then put under this card and its bonus is added to the mace. (Off)

cards.name: The Apocalypse Stone
cards.text: Can only be attached to any realm. If this realm is razed or discarded outside of combat by another player, 1d4 of the opposing player's realms are instantly razed.

cards.name: Palace of the Battle Lord
cards.text: In combat, this player's heroes can only be defeated by total levels or cards that cause the battle to end without a victor.

cards.name: All Hail the King!
cards.text: In combat, this player's heroes and regents are doubled in base level and cannot be stripped of their special powers by any other card.

cards.name: The Adventure Path
cards.text: All of this player's adventurers can use thief skills and any unarmed combat card.

cards.name: The Sands of Time Freeze
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All cards (except rule cards) with a stated duration cannot be played, any already in play when this rule card is played are discarded regardless of any circumstances.

cards.name: Unified Universe
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. The world designation of all cards in play is changed to AD&D.

cards.name: The Grim Harvest
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. All players must attack on their turn or discard a card from their pool. All realms can be attacked, regardless of position, restrictions, or holdings. Champions defeated in battle go to the Abyss.

cards.name: What Madness is This ?!
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. This rule card is immune to events and the Wish spell. Phases 0-5 of each player's turn are now played in reverse order. When first played, the player's phase becomes phase 5.

cards.name: Cannon Fodder
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. Only the lowest adjusted level champion eligible for combat may be used in battle.

cards.name: Blessed are the Meek
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. While in play, all champions have their base level changed to 10 minus their printed base level.

cards.name: Sheriff's in Town
cards.text: No thief skills maybe played for 1d4 turns. (Harmful)

cards.name: Breath of Death
cards.text: The player of this event rolls 3d10. Every player must discard at least that many levels of champions from their pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Underground Railroad
cards.text: All of this player's allies are considered earthwalkers until the end of this player's next turn. (Helpful)

cards.name: Double Up
cards.text: Play immediately after a card that calls for a dice roll. All players who are rolling dice must now roll 2 times, and add the totals together (1d4 becomes 2d4, etc.). (Helpful/Harmful)

cards.name: Tag Team
cards.text: This player can now assist any player currently in combat as if it were their phase 4. If played during their own combat, the player may use any champion in any pool as an ally who is reshuffled into their owner's draw pile at the end of combat. (Harmful)

cards.name: Tactical Retreat
cards.text: This player's champion retreats, leading the opposing champion into an ambush. Battle starts over retaining only allies, magical items, and artifacts. This player can then discard any one card attached to the opposing champion. (Harmful)

cards.name: Romeis Gianthammer
cards.text: Giants in combat with Romeis are discarded. If Romeis and Tergoz Tenhammer are in play, all Greyhawk champions are immune to the special powers of opposing non-Greyhawk champions.

cards.name: Dungeon Master
cards.text: When in pool, the controlling player has their dungeon put into limbo until the Dungeon Master leaves his pool. While in play all players must ask the dungeon master permission to use the powers of their dungeons.

cards.name: Gib Occav
cards.text: Can cast wizard spells, immune to harmful events. When in combat, Gib Occav can use any one legally playable card from any discard pile. The card, when discarded, is reshuffled back into its owners draw pile.

cards.name: Ecneps the Bounty Hunter
cards.text: Can use psionic power cards. During any battle that Ecneps is winning (before the opponent can play another card), he can choose to end the battle. He then escorts the opposing champion to jail (both champions go to limbo) for 1d4 turns. Combat can continue with new champions.

cards.name: Gib Igoy
cards.text: While in play, all players must skip phase 3 of their turns. When first played, this player's phase 3 ends.

cards.name: Weredragon
cards.text: Werebeast. Between 6 PM and 6 AM, this champion becomes a level 10 flying dragon monster who is immune to all cards with no icon bonus.

cards.name: Hero
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Krijeydif
cards.text: Can use any unarmed combat card. Only blood abilities and unarmed combat cards that have an icon bonus can be played against Krijeydif.

cards.name: Regent
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Gib Suan
cards.text: Being a control freak, all players must ask Gib Suan permission to begin their turn (the turn cannot be prevented by this permission). If they don't ask, this player may send any champion in that players pool to limbo.

cards.name: Gib Remuab, the Chase Hunter
cards.text: Elf. Immune to harmful events. All chase cards and the Wealthy Oriental Vassal lose their special powers.

cards.name: Lady Marie
cards.text: Flyer. While in play, all players may have up to 3 avatars per pool, regardless of restrictions. If she leaves play, players must discard any extra avatars.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Son of Tasslehoff
cards.text: Halfling (Kender). Magic items attached to this champion may not be discarded, even by this player. Tasslehoff Burrfoot must attach items from the discard pile to his son instead of himself, even if he is in another pool.

cards.name: Thief
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Gib Sinned
cards.text: While this champion remains in play, Menzo, Caer Allison, and Ancient Kalidnay do not count as realms for the purpose of victory.

cards.name: Pawnmaster
cards.text: Once per turn, this player may place a card from hand into the Abyss to negate the special power of a champion in play until the beginning of this player's next turn.

cards.name: Dalamar
cards.text: Elf. Wizard of the Black Robes. Gains 3 levels between the 7pm and 5am. When played, this player may go through his draw pile and retrieve and play Mordenkainen and/or Elminster.

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Zakhata, the False God
cards.text: Zakhata's base level is equal to the total levels of avatars in play. Avatars have no power as long as Zakhata remains in play.

cards.name: Mistress of Destruction
cards.text: If this champion razes a realm in phase 4, she may psionically raze an additional realm anywhere in play instead of drawing spoils.

cards.name: Psionicist
cards.text: Immune to the Rule of the Cosmos. If this champion is to be sent to the discard pile or Abyss through any means other than losing combat, place into limbo instead. This champion returns at the beginning of the player's next turn.

cards.name: Realm
cards.text: Immune to the rule of the cosmos. Cannot be discarded from formation outside of phase 4.

cards.name: Blode
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by swimmers. Defenders of Blode fight with such tenacity that opposing allies less than +3 can not be played. One defending ally (even if stolen) of this player's choice remains with this realm.

cards.name: Tanith
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by earthwalkers. Tanith's defenders are immune to the special powers of heros and allies

cards.name: The Mad Scientist's Secret Lab
cards.text: Golem champions may defend this realm twice before being discarded. When this realm first comes into play, this player may either search his deck for any golem card, show it to all players and put it into hand, or shuffle all golems from his discard pile back into his deck.

cards.name: Elysium
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 12 hero, which can use cleric spells and blood abilities. If this realm is attacked, the defeated champion goes to limbo. If this realm is razed, it cannot be rebuilt, it goes to the Void and no other player can put Elysium in play again this game.

cards.name: Gehenna
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 13 monster, which can use wizard spells and thief skills. If this realm is attacked, the defeated champion is sent to the Abyss. If this realm is razed, it cannot be rebuilt, it goes to the Void and no other player can put Gehenna in play again this game.

cards.name: The Shackled City
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 7 hero. After a successful defense of this realm, one enemy ally, chosen by the defending player, remains with the realm. It is used in the next defense of this realm, and it discarded afterwards.

cards.name: Castle Strahd
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers or clerics. This realm strips any special movement requirements (swimmers, flyers, etc.) from any realm that this players Ravenloft champions or allies attack. Undead vampire bat allies help to defend this realm each round it is attacked.

cards.name: Front Lines
