cards.text: Front Lines must be placed as the lead realm, replacing the current lead realm whether razed or not. Can only be discarded during any phase 4. While this realm is in play this player may have a 2nd phase 4 if a spoils of victory is gained by razing a realm during the 1st phase 4.

cards.name: Maerimydra, City of the Spider Queen
cards.text: Underdark. Can only be attacked by earthwalkers, Forgotten Realms champions, or Underdark champions. Champions defending this realm may use cleric spells.

cards.name: The Frozen Forest
cards.text: The bitter cold emanates from this realm, stripping all champions in play of any protection granted by the special powers of realms.

cards.name: The Wetwoods
cards.text: The swamps of the Wetwoods keep their dead. Defeated champions and allies go to the Abyss. Attached magic items and artifacts remain with the realm to be used by the next defender and discarded if the realm is razed or discarded.

cards.name: The Black-Isle
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers. The look-outs of the Black-Isle can see attackers from great distances thus the defenders special powers always activate first.

cards.name: Narchek
cards.text: Narchek is immune to offensive spells. Narchek may be razed to retarget any just played psionic power card to any legal target in play.

cards.name: Civil War
cards.text: This holding may be attached to any realm in any player's formation. The attached realm loses all powers while this holding is attached. Defenders of the attached realm subtract 2 from their base level. Allies cannot be used in defense of this realm.

cards.name: Mercenary's Guild
cards.text: May be attached to any realm. If any of this player's champions wins a round of combat while attacking, that player may reveal the top card of his/her draw pile. If it is a champion or ally, it may be taken into hand, otherwise it is placed at the bottom of the deck.

cards.text: Kann jederzeit ausgespielt werden. Immun gegen fliegende Wesen.

cards.text: T�tet irgendeinen Champion oder Verb�ndeten der Stufe 5 oder niedriger. (Off/4)

cards.name: Zauber zur�ckwerfen

cards.name: Die Glocke von Percival
cards.text: Zerst�rt ein Champion mit dieser Glocke ein K�nigreich, so kann er ein beliebgies Besitztum im Spiel zerst�ren.

cards.name: Beruhigung
cards.text: Diese magische Beruhigung negiert die Auswirkung eines Ereignisses, aber nur f�r den Spieler der Karte.

cards.name: Sakornia
cards.text: Sakornias Stufe erh�ht sich auf 9, sobald ein magischer Gegenstand angegliedert wird.

cards.name: Edormira der Rote Drachen
cards.text: Fliegendes Wesen. Kein Monster kann zur Verteidigung gegen Edormira eingesetzt werden.

cards.name: Gloriana
cards.text: Gloriana kann einen Windsto� erzeugen, der alle fliegenden Wesen aus der Schlacht fegt. Es k�nnen keine fliegenden Wesen gegen sie gespielt werden.

cards.name: Neirgral der Gr�ne Drache

cards.name: Dagaronzie der Gr�ne Drache

cards.name: Fejyelsae
cards.text: Werden irgendwelche Verb�ndeten zusammen mit Fejyelsae ausgespielt, sinkt ihre Stufe auf 7.

cards.name: Drachenwut!

cards.name: Sharbaal der Rote Drache
cards.text: Fliegendes Wesen. Jedesmal, wenn Sharbaal eine Runde gewinnt, darf der Spieler eine Karte aus der Hand des besiegten Spielers ziehen und ablegen. Der Spieler mu� dabei lachen.

cards.name: Darbee

cards.name: Aurum der Goldene Drache
cards.text: Fliegendes Wesen. Aurum gewinnt 1 Stufe extra pro freundlichem Verb�ndeten (zus�tzlich zu den Boni der Verb�ndeten).

cards.name: Halcyon
cards.text: Jedesmal wenn sie eine Runde gewinnt, darf der Spieler eine Karte aus dem Ablagestapel ziehen und auf die Hand nehmen.

cards.name: Stryck
cards.text: Wenn Stryck angreift, kann sie ihren Gegner aus der Auslage des Verteidigers ausw�hlen.

cards.name: Zeb der Rote
cards.text: Keine Verb�ndeten der Stufe 3 oder niedriger k�nnen gegen den schrecklichen Zeb ausgespielt werden.

cards.name: Avatar
cards.text: Avatar zerst�rt sofort alle untoten Champions und/oder Verb�ndete.

cards.name: Smolder der Rote Drache

cards.name: Liebliche Colleen

cards.name: Ember der Rote Drache

cards.name: Mithas
cards.text: If Mithas is razed, it is automatically rebuilt at the beginning of its player's next turn. If Mithas is attacked a second time while it is razed, it is discarded.

cards.name: Silvanesti
cards.text: Any elf (champion or ally) defending Silvanesti gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Goodland
cards.text: Any kender or gnome (champion or ally) defending Goodland gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Khur
cards.text: Khur can defend itself as a level 4 hero.

cards.name: Solamnia
cards.text: If Solamnia is razed, the attacker must discard his hand (including his victory card, if not playable), shuffle his discard pile into his deck, and draw a new hand of 5 cards.

cards.name: Sancrist
cards.text: Any Dragonlance champion defending Sancrist gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Northern Ergoth
cards.text: Any cleric defending Northern Ergoth gains 3 levels.

cards.name: Southern Ergoth
cards.text: Any elf (champion or ally) attacking Southern Ergoth loses 2 levels.

cards.name: Plains of Dust
cards.text: Any champion attacking the Plains of Dust loses 2 levels.

cards.name: Spine of Taladas
cards.text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers.

cards.name: Isle of Selasia
cards.text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers.

cards.name: Thorin
cards.text: Any dwarf (champion or ally) defending Thorin gains 2 levels; any dwarf attacking loses 2 levels.

cards.name: Reorxcrown Mountains
cards.text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or dwarves and is immune to offensive wizard spells.

cards.name: Tower of Wayreth
cards.text: The attached realm cannot be attacked by wizards. At the beginning of this player's turn, this holding must shift to another realm or be discarded.

cards.name: The Lost Citadel
cards.text: Any wizard defending the attached realm gains 2 levels; any wizard attacking loses 2 levels.

cards.name: Shoikan Grove
cards.text: Only flyers or earth-walkers can attack the attached realm.

cards.name: Inn of the Last Home
cards.text: The attached realm cannot be attacked by dragons.

cards.name: Altar of Mishakal
cards.text: Any dwarf (champion or ally) who is defeated while defending or attacking the attached realm is not discarded but reshuffled into its deck.

cards.name: Skie, Blue Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. The first ally played with Skie is treated as a flyer.

cards.name: Governor Erann Flowstone
cards.text: Dwarf.

cards.name: Tika Waylan Majere
cards.text: If defending a realm that has the holding Inn of the Last Home attached to it, Tika gains 3 levels.

cards.name: Lord Gunthar, Solamnic Knight
cards.text: If used to defend a realm, Lord Gunthar gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Maquesta Kar-Thon
cards.text: Maquesta gains 4 levels when attacking a realm that has a coast.

cards.name: Ladonna, Wizard of the Black Robes
cards.text: Ladonna is level 7 if she is played from 6 PM to midnight. If the Moon Nuitari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by her gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Justarian, Wizard of the Red Robes
cards.text: Justarian is level 8 if he is played from 6 PM to dawn. If the Moon Lunitari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by him gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Dargent, Silver Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Dargent can cast wizard and cleric spells. The first ally played with him is treated as a flyer.

cards.name: Raistlin Majere, Wizard of the Black Robes
cards.text: Raistlin gains 2 levels if played from 7 PM to 2 AM; he gains 4 levels if pitted against Caramon. If the Moon Nuitari Waxes event card is in play, his spells gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Fizban the Fabulous
cards.text: Fizban can also cast cleric spells. He can only defend, never attack. All spells cast by him are at the level of the card's last digit.

cards.name: Takhisis, Queen of Darkness
cards.text: Takhisis can cast wizard spells if she is played 6 PM to dawn. She can only attack, never defend.

cards.name: Par-Salian, Wizard of the White Robes
cards.text: Par-Salian is level 10 if he is played from dawn to 6 PM. If the Moon Solinari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by him gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Pyrite, the Ancient Gold Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Pyrite can cast wizard and cleric spells. The first ally placed with him is treated as a flyer.

cards.name: Tanis Half-Elven
cards.text: Tanis gains 3 levels if defending a Dragonlance realm. He is not subject to adjustments applied to elves.

cards.name: Flint Fireforge
cards.text: Dwarf. Flint has the earth-walking ability, letting him strike at any realm.

cards.name: Caramon Majere
cards.text: Caramon can inspire allies, adding +3 to a single ally or adding +1 to all his allies. Must decide when first ally is played.

cards.name: Tasslehoff Burrfoot
cards.text: Kender. Each turn, Tasslehoff can either retrieve any magical item from this player's discard pile or rearrange the magical items held by heroes in his pool.

cards.name: Phudge, the Great Highbulp
cards.text: Dwarf. Because attacking champions always underestimate Phudge, they lose 2 levels if he defends a Dragonlance realm.

cards.name: Gully Dwarves
cards.text: Become +5 if allied with any dwarf champion.

cards.name: Night of the Eye
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Up to three Dragonlance event cards remain in effect at any given time. If a fourth Dragonlance event card is played, that player chooses which Dragonlance event it replaces.

cards.name: Krynn Minotaurs
cards.text: Become +9 if allied with Kaz the Minotaur. Can be kept in the player's pool with Kaz until used in battle; discard after use.

cards.name: Solamnic Knights
cards.text: Become +4 if used to defend a Dragonlance realm. Become +5 if allied with Lord Gunthar.

cards.name: Brine Dragon
cards.text: Swimmer. One enemy ally (this player's choice) is swallowed by the brine dragon, instantly defeated.

cards.name: Kagonesti Elves
cards.text: Wild elves.

cards.name: Dimernesti Elves
cards.text: Swimmer. Sea elves. If this player's champion is a swimmer, the elves can switch the attack to any other coastal realm. Nonswimming attacking allies are discarded.

cards.name: Sivak Draconians
cards.text: Can be a +4 ally or can assume the level and ability of a single opposing ally.

cards.name: Kapak Draconians
cards.text: Become +5 if played from dawn to 6 PM. Kapaks turn to acid if defeated, destroying any player's lead holding.

cards.name: Aurak Draconians
cards.text: When played, this player can look at the top three cards in any opponent's deck. Auraks explode if defeated, sending the opposing champion to its discard pile.

cards.name: Dragonlance
cards.text: Usable only by heroes, the Dragonlance is +7 vs. dragon champions.

cards.name: Staff of Magius
cards.text: Usable only by wizards.

cards.name: Shield of Huma
cards.text: The attached champion must be defeated twice when defending before being discarded. Dragon champions lose 3 levels if attacking this champion.

cards.name: The Nightjewel
cards.text: The attached champion can ignore the effects of up to three spells per battle if played from 6 PM to dawn or two spells if from dawn to 6 PM.

cards.name: Hammer of Kharas
cards.text: The hammer is +7 if wielded by a dwarf.

cards.name: Blamblower
cards.text: This gnomish invention explodes after one use and is discarded. It sends at least 6 levels of enemy champions and allies (opponent's choice) to the discard pile. (Off)

cards.name: Irongnome
cards.text: A champion wearing this gnomish invention ignores attacks from all magical weapons. (Def)

cards.name: Bupu's Emerald
cards.text: Usable only by dwarves, gnomes, kender, and halflings, the emerald works only against monsters. (Def)

cards.name: Inflatable Flotilla
cards.text: This gnomish invention cannot be used the turn it is first played. A champion and all allies can attack a coastal realm, each gaining 2 levels. They are treated as swimmers. No effect on landbound realms (Off)

cards.name: Brooch of Imog
cards.text: Usable only by wizards, the brooch creates a shield surrounding the champion, allowing him to ignore the effect of one spell per battle. (Def)

cards.name: Solamnic Armor
cards.text: All attacking champions and allies are lowered in level by 1 or by 3 if the armor is worn by Lord Gunthar. (Def)

cards.name: Dalamar's Ring of Healing
cards.text: At the end of every other turn, the player can bring one wizard from his discard pile and place that card on top of his draw pile. (Def)

cards.name: Wand of Telekinesis
cards.text: Each turn, this player can send one of his opponent's magical items to the discard pile. (Off)

cards.name: Flute of Wind Dancing
cards.text: Creates a strong force of wind, keeping at least 6 levels of allies (opponent's choice) out of a battle. (Off)

cards.name: Dagger of Night
cards.text: The dagger is +4 if played from 6 PM to dawn. It gains an additional +1 for each Moon Waxes event card in play. (Off)

cards.name: Time Shift: Night into Day
cards.text: If played 6 PM to dawn, it is now considered day. This spell reverses the effect of a day into night card. Remains in effect until countered or dispelled. (Def/3)

cards.name: Time Shift: Day into Night
cards.text: If played from dawn to 6 PM, it is now considered night. This spell reverses the effect of a night into day card. Remains in effect until countered or dispelled. (Def/3)

cards.name: Antimagic Barrier
cards.text: Champion can ignore all spells and magical items used by an opponent for one round of battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Unnerving Aura
cards.text: An opponent's champion loses its nerve in battle. It must return to its pool and is considered defeated. (Off/4)

cards.name: Strength
cards.text: (Off/4)

cards.name: Steel
cards.text: Adds +2 to all magical swords, axes, spears, and hammers on this player's side for all battles played in a single turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Moonlight Madness
cards.text: If played from 6 PM to dawn, this spell reduces an opponent's champions and allies by 2 levels for one battle. (Off/3)

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: When attacking, this player can switch his champion with another champion from either his pool or his discard pile. (Off/4)

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: All spells in this player's discard pile are returned to his deck and reshuffled. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Tenser's Transformation
cards.text: The wizard who casts this becomes a level 9 hero for one round. He can still cast wizard spells. (Off/3)

cards.name: Charm Monster
cards.text: From 1 to 6 levels of an opponent's allies join this player's side (caster's choice). (Off/3)

cards.name: Fire Rain
cards.text: All flyers (champions and allies) lose 2 levels. (Off/4)

cards.name: Stone Water
cards.text: Swimmers are held in place, preventing them from attacking or defending. (Off/3)

cards.name: Protection from Draconians
cards.text: Champion is +2 against draconians and is immune to their effects when defeated. (Off/4)

cards.name: Mishakal's Insistence
cards.text: All champions immune to spells and magical items are now vulnerable for this player's turn. (Def/3)

cards.name: Divine Intervention
cards.text: This player can retrieve one champion and one ally from his discard pile, which must be put into his hand. (Def/5)

cards.name: Summon Griffon
cards.text: One champion and up to two allies can fly for one round. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Reflection
cards.text: All spells cast at this champion by an opponent are directed back at that opponent or at any other champion (this player's choice). (Def/4)

cards.name: Earth-Walking
cards.text: A champion and two allies gain the ability to move through the earth, attacking any realm. (Def/3)

cards.name: Borrow
cards.text: Select an opponent's magical item to use with any champion this round. Return the item to the original player after use. (Def/3)

cards.name: Despair
cards.text: The allies of an opponent falter and do not fight this round. Any in battle return to their player's hand. (Off/4)

cards.name: Return
cards.text: This player's allies and magical items currently under the control of an opponent return to their original deck and are reshuffled. (Def/5)

cards.name: Hazy Image
cards.text: This player can withdraw his champion or one ally from a battle and return it to the top of his draw pile. He loses the round. (Def/4)

cards.name: Peace
cards.text: The attacking force has a change of heart. That force's magical items and spells are discarded. Champions and allies return to the opponent's pool or hand. (Off/4)

cards.name: Double Trouble
cards.text: Select a spell or magical item and double its effectiveness for one round. (Off/3)

cards.name: Mishakal Intervenes
cards.text: One Dragonlance champion or ally in each player's discard pile is returned to the top of its respective deck.

cards.name: Habbakuk Interferes
cards.text: The god of animal life and the seas is watching. Until the player's next turn, no coastal realm can be attacked.

cards.name: Kiri-Jolith Arrives
cards.text: The war god has taken an interest in the affairs of men. All nonspellcasting champions gain 3 levels until this player's next turn.

cards.name: Reorx, the Forge, Walks the Land
cards.text: All dwarves, gnomes, and kender (champions and allies) gain 2 levels until the end of this player's turn.

cards.name: Morgain, God of Disease, Strikes
cards.text: Only Dragonlance allies may be played until this player's next turn.

cards.name: Zeboim, the Sea Queen, Is Enraged
cards.text: Zeboim lends her might to all champions and allies attacking a coastal realm. These attackers gain 1 level until this player's next turn.

cards.name: Bronze Dragons
cards.text: A force of bronze dragons rallies to this player's side, preventing all attacks against his realms until his next turn.

cards.name: Moon Solinari Waxes
cards.text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the white robe gain 3 levels.

cards.name: Moon Lunitari Waxes
cards.text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the red robe gain 3 levels.

cards.name: Moon Nuitari Waxes
cards.text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the black robe gain 3 levels.

cards.name: Call to Arms!
cards.text: All allies of Dragonlance champions gain 3 levels until the end of this event player's next turn.

cards.name: Axe of Brotherhood
cards.text: The axe is a +6 weapon if the Sword of Friendship is in play anywhere. (Off)

cards.name: Sword of Friendship
cards.text: The sword is a +6 weapon if the Axe of Brotherhood is in play anywhere. (Off)

cards.name: Knights of the Crown
cards.text: Becomes a level 8 hero when fighting a monster; immune to offensive spells cast by monsters.

cards.name: Knights of the Sword
cards.text: Becomes a level 9 hero when fighting a wizard; immune to offensive wizard spells.

cards.name: Knights of the Rose
cards.text: Becomes a level 10 hero when fighting a monster; immune to offensive magical items.

cards.name: Shield of Huma
cards.text: Plus 2 additional levels when fighting a monster; immune to offensive spells cast by monsters. (Def)

cards.name: Crossed Blades
cards.text: Only heroes can attack or defend until the end of this event player's next turn.

cards.name: Spirit of the Que-Shu
cards.text: Defending Dragonlance champions gain 5 levels and can cast clerical spells until the end of this event player's next turn.

cards.name: The Skull of Fistandantilus
cards.text: Attached champion can cast wizard spells and doubles the level (number in icon) of spells he casts. Only a wizard or monster can be played in defense against the skull.

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror and Staff
cards.text: Plus 2 additional levels if attached to a monster. (Off)

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror and Sword
cards.text: The opponent's unmodified level (printed on the card) is halved and rounded down.

cards.name: Takhisis's Abyssal Gateway
cards.text: Forces any one champion in a pool to the abyss (champion is removed from game). (Off/3)

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror of Life Trapping
cards.text: Place this on any champion. That card is out of play until dispel magic is cast on it.

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror of Underworld Minions
cards.text: The attached champion wins a round automatically if any of the opposing force is undead.

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror of Revenge!
cards.text: When the attached champion loses a round, the mirror is broken and this card becomes a level 6 monster in the owner's pool. (Def)

cards.name: Takhisis's Mirror of the Abyssal Warlord
cards.text: Level 10 vs. any Dragonlance champion or allies.

cards.name: Takhisis's Helmet of Power
cards.text: No card has immunity to anything when this mirror is in play.

cards.name: Tower of High Sorcery
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All wizards gain 4 levels.

cards.name: Blessing of the Gods
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. The gods grant that all undead opposing clerics are instantly destroyed.

cards.name: Age of Dreams
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All monsters are immune to defensive spells and walls.

cards.name: The Golden Age
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Heroes who draw spoils of war draw two cards; the first can be treated normally, the second can only be held or discarded.

cards.name: Haste Spell
cards.text: For one round, the champion's original level (printed on the card) is doubled. (Def/4)

cards.name: Flute of Wind Dancing
cards.text: The attached champion and all allies become swimmers able to attack any realm with a visible coastline, regardless of the realm's position in the formation. (Def)

cards.name: Medallion of Faith
cards.text: The attached champion can cast cleric spells. The player draws one extra card per turn and increases maximum hand size by 1.

cards.name: Rauglothgor's Lair
cards.text: Any nondragon champions attacking this realm are at half their base level (rounded down). Undead defending this dragon's lair are immune to harmful events.

cards.name: Dragon Mountain
cards.text: Can only be attacked by flyers or earthwalkers. Infryana the Dragon's base level is doubled when defending this realm.

cards.name: Lair of the Shadowdrake
cards.text: If Menzoberranzan is in play when this realm is played, Menzo is discarded. While this realm is in play, the Underdark allies gained by the Triumvirate realms are negated.

cards.name: Dragonspine Mountains
cards.text: Dragons defending this realm are immune to offensive spells, psionics, and blood abilities. This realm can defend itself as a level 6 dragon champion.

cards.name: Griff Mountains
cards.text: Defending dragons and giants are doubled in base level and are immune to offensive magical items. Attacking champions and allies that are not flyers lose their special powers.

cards.name: Vesve Forest
cards.text: Swimmers cannot attack this realm. For each magical item and artifact attached to an attacking champion, subtract 2 levels from his total. The champion's level cannot drop below 1.

cards.name: Mount Nevermind
cards.text: Champions cannot use other cards (even events) or special powers when attacking or defending this realm. Instead, each champion draws one card and adds the last digit to the champion's level. The champion with the highest total wins the battle.

cards.name: Palanthas
cards.text: Dragons and wizards cannot attack this realm. Defending dragons and wizards are immune to offensive spells and harmful events.

cards.name: Mount Deismaar
cards.text: This player's champions are immune to offensive blood abilities. Any champion defending this realm can use wizard spells and blood abilities.

cards.name: Dragon's Horde
cards.text: Dragons attacking this player's formation can attack only the attached realm; else they cannot attack.

cards.name: Dark Depths
cards.text: A realm with this holding is immune to the special powers of Underdark realms.

cards.name: Powers of the Land
cards.text: The base level of undead champions defending any realm of this player is doubled. Undead champions defeated while defending the attached realm return to their pool instead of being discarded.

cards.name: The Mistmarsh
cards.text: Flyers cannot attack the attached realm, and defending swimmers return to their pool if defeated. This holding can defend the attached realm as a level 5 monster.

cards.name: The Mist Caves
cards.text: The attached realm cannot be attacked by flyers or swimmers. Giants defending this realm are immune to offensive magical items.

cards.name: Dragon's Crown
cards.text: If attached to the Dragon's Crown Mountains, this player's champions all become dragons. If attached to other realms, the defending champion is immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: Council of Wyrms
cards.text: Dragons meet to discuss war and peace! Players may draw a card for each dragon in their pool; these champions may not attack or defend until the beginning of the event player's next turn. (Helpful)

cards.name: Dragon Magic
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, only dragons can cast spells. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dragon's Graveyard
cards.text: Return one dragon champion and one dragon ally from the discard pile to your hand. (Helpful)

cards.name: Wyrm's Decree
cards.text: Until this player's next turn, cards cannot be drawn by another player from your draw deck, discard pile, or hand, and opposing players cannot force you to draw or discard cards. (Helpful)

cards.name: Dragon Raid!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all dragons can attack as many times as they wish (if successful) until a realm is razed. (Helpful)

cards.name: Dragon Fear
cards.text: All champions of base level 5 or less suffer from dragon fear and cannot act (attack or defend, cast spells, use psionics, etc) until the end of this player's next turn. (harmful)

cards.name: Trapped!
cards.text: Play on an opposing player's champion, who can do nothing until this event is negated. A trapped champion remains in his pool while imprisoned. (Harmful)

cards.name: Forced Revolt
cards.text: An opposing player must either discard all allies in his hand or may discard one champion from his pool. If he has no allies, he must discard a champion from his pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Favorable Winds
cards.text: Must be played immediately upon being drawn. Eack player draws one card for each flyer in his pool. (Helpful)

cards.name: Blessing of Zorquan
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, cards specifically designed to harm dragons or monsters do not function against this player's champions. (Helpful)

cards.name: Infyrana the Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Infryana can cast wizard spells and is immune to the special powers of heroes and allies. If discarded as a result of combat, she can destroy one magical item or artifact in play.

cards.name: Flame
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. Flame must be defeated twice while defending before being discarded. Allies of +3 or less cannot be played against him.

cards.name: Pelath the Bronze Dragon
cards.text: Flyer; swimmer. Swimming champions and allies cannot face this dragon in combat. At the end of this player's turn, Pelath can retrieve one magical item from the discard pile, which is then attached to him.

cards.name: Maldraedior, Great Blue Wyrm
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. Maldraedior can cast any spell. Phase 4 spells cast by him during combat are shuffled back into the draw pile instead of discarded.

cards.name: Tamarand, Great Gold Wyrm
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. While Tamarand is in play all flying monsters must ask his permission to fly. Allies of +3 or less cannot be played against him.

cards.name: Lareth, King of Justice
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. All dragons must ask Lareth's permission to cast wizard spells. Lareth never needs permission to cast spells. He is immune to cards designated as offensive.

cards.name: Flashburn
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. Flashburn has access to a nonflying +9 orc ally that cannot be forced to switch sides during battle.

cards.name: Fi Lendicol
cards.text: Dragon. Fi Lendicol can teleport with his allies to attack any realm. He can use any unarmed combat card and is immune to offensive cleric spells and offensive psionics.

cards.name: Rauglothgor
cards.text: Dragon; undead. Rauglothgor can cast wizard spells and is immune to offensive spells. His total level is doubled if defending Rauglothgor's Lair.

cards.name: Sparkle, Crystal Dragon
cards.text: If an opponent wishes to play an ally against Sparkle, she psionically inspects the player's hand and chooses which ally to play; no more allies can be played by that player. (Off)

cards.name: Shadow Dragon
cards.text: This dragon and his allies can attack any realm in a formation. Opposing champions are at half their base level (rounded down), with lost levels being added to the Shadow Dragon's total. He is immune to the special powers of Underdark champions.

cards.name: Greyhawk Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. This dragon breathes a toxic gas at the beginning of the battle, preventing an opposing champion from using spells, unarmed combat cards, and blood abilities.

cards.name: Flare
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. One Dragonlance champion in play can be used as an ally (base level only). Win or lose, the borrowed champion returns to his pool.

cards.name: Sleet
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. Sleet's numbing cold prevents nonflying allies from being played against him. If instantly defeated by a card's special powers, he returns to his pool instead of being discarded.

cards.name: Khisanth
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. If Khisanth razes an opponent's realm in combat, one other unrazed realm anywhere in play is sent to Limbo until the end of the defender's next turn. Realms return from Limbo to any place in that player's formation.

cards.name: Cyan Bloodbane
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. Cyan can use wizard spells. Magical items attached to him cannot be removed by any means. Dragonlance allies attached to this champion are doubled in level and cannot be removed or forced to switch sides.

cards.name: Verminaard the Dragonmaster
cards.text: Once per battle Verminaard can use any dragon champion in play as an ally (level only). The borrowed champion returns to its pool. He gains 4 levels if Tiamat or Takhisis is in play.

cards.name: The Celestial Emperor
cards.text: Avatar; dragon. Discard 15+ levels of dragons to bring the Emperor into play. Immune to offensive spells and the special powers of champions and allies. When this player's dragons attack, the Emperor chooses which of the opponent's champions will defend. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Tiamat, God of Evil Dragons
cards.text: Avatar; flyer. Discard two spellcasting dragons to bring Tiamat into play. She is immune to offensive psionics, unarmed combat cards, and blood abilities. If this player's dragons lose in battle, they return to their pool instead. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Bahamut, God of Good Dragons
cards.text: Avatar; flyer. Discard two spellcasting dragons to bring Bahamut into play. He is immune to the special powers of champions and allies. Champions in Bahamut's pool are doubled in base level when defending, as are all dragon allies. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Astral Spell
cards.text: Cast at any time to create an astral duplicate of the caster (level and special power) to defend this player's realms once an attacker comes forward. Cards can be attached as normal, but are discarded with the duplicate at the end of that round of battle. (Def)

cards.name: Dragon's Calm
cards.text: Castable only by dragon champions. Can be cast at any time to cancel the effects of a harmful event. (Def)

cards.name: Humanoid Familiar
cards.text: Castable only by dragon or monster champions. Cast this spell on a hero not involved in combat to bring him in as an ally. The caster gains the hero's special power and level, and the hero is discarded after the battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Venomdust
cards.text: Castable only by dragons, this spell slays one champion of base level 5 or less, or slays one opposing ally. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Firetrail
cards.text: Castable only by dragons, this spell destroys any one holding in play. (Off/3)

cards.name: Dragon's Death Door
cards.text: Castable only by dragons. Cast at any time to save a dragon champion from going to the discard pile for any reason, or to send it to the discard pile instead of the Abyss. (Def)

cards.name: Cold Curtain
cards.text: Castable only by dragons. This spell creates a wall of dragon ice that instantly ends combat. Champions return to their pools and phase 4 of the attacker's turn is over with no spoils of victory. (Def/4)

cards.name: Summon Dragon
cards.text: May also be cast by any dragon. This spell summons a dragon champion from any pool to act as an ally (level only). Win or lose, the summoned champion returns to his pool. (Def/4)

cards.name: Dragon Mark
cards.text: Castable only by dragon champions. Cast on an opposing champion to prevent him from defending against dragon champions attacking this turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Meteor Swarm
cards.text: This spell destroys one magical item or artifact of an opposing champion as well as any opposing allies of +3 or less in combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Enchanted Flight
cards.text: Cast to make a champion and its allies flyers or to make a flyer immune to any card's special powers that directly affect flyers. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Blessing of Tiamat
cards.text: May also be cast by any dragon. Cast on a dragon champion to ignore the levels or special powers of any opposing allies until the end of this player's next turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Blessing of Bahamut
cards.text: May also be cast by any dragon. Cast on a dragon champion to ignore the levels or special powers of any opposing champions until the end of this player's next turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Symbol of Pain
cards.text: This spell inflicts terrible pain on a champion, preventing casting spells or using psionic power cards. Lasts until dispelled. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Symbol of Persuasion
cards.text: Cast during battle to force two opposing allies (caster's choice) to switch sides. Allies must be present when the spell is cast. (Off/4)

cards.name: Symbol of Death
cards.text: This spell destroys up to 10 levels of opposing allies or prevents an opponent from playing magical items in this round of battle. Any already attached are unaffected. (Off/4)

cards.name: Confusion
cards.text: Cast on an attacking champion who must choose another player's realm to attack. If he cannot attack another realm, or it's a two-player game, the champion returns to his pool defeated. (Off/4)

cards.name: Find the Path
cards.text: This player's champions and allies can attack any opposing realm, regardless of position or restrictions, until the end of this turn. (Def/3)

cards.name: True Seeing
cards.text: This spell can be cast at any time to inspect an opponent's hand or the next three cards of one draw pile. (Off)

cards.name: Plague
cards.text: When this spell is cast on an opposing champion, that player must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit. If the number is higher than the champion's base level, he is discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Inertial Barrier
cards.text: Until the beginning of this player's next turn, champions of base level 6 or less cannot attack this player's realms. (Def/5)

cards.name: Combat Mind
cards.text: Until the end of this turn, the champion using this power can attack an opposing realm multiple times until he is either defeated or the realm is razed. (Def/3)

cards.name: Phase
cards.text: Before attacking, a champion can use this power to ignore any realm's special power. (Def/3)

cards.name: Death Field
cards.text: Usable only during combat, the opposing champion can no longer use spells, psionic power cards, blood abilities, or unarmed combat cards. (Off/4)

cards.name: Ultrablast
cards.text: When this card is used, the opponent must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit. If the number is 2 or less, the opposing champion is discarded. (Off/4)

cards.name: Synaptic Static
cards.text: Use this power at any time to cancel an offensive psionic power card when it is first played. (Off)

cards.name: Daydream
cards.text: A champion using this power cannot act again until the end of his player's next turn. At the beginning of this player's next turn, he may draw five cards instead of three if the daydreaming champion is still in play. (Def/5)

cards.name: Psychic Blade
cards.text: Until the end of this player's turn, all magical items used by this player's champions are doubled in level. (Def/3)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Combat
cards.text: The attached champion can use any type of unarmed combat card. (Def)

cards.name: Talisman of the Beast
cards.text: A champion wearing the talisman can fly and is considered a dragon. (Def)

cards.name: Wand of Magic Detection
cards.text: Use this wand in phase 3 of your turn to force all opponents to show you all magical items and artifacts in their hand and face down in pools. (Off)

cards.name: Well of Many Worlds
cards.text: Discard this card from the attached champion during a round of combat to send two cards attached to the opposing champion to the Abyss. (Off)

cards.name: Wand of Negation
cards.text: During combat only, this wand negates all the immunities of an opposing champion (including immunity to offensive magical items). (Off)

cards.name: Maul of the Titans
cards.text: Usable only by giants. The attached champion ignores the special powers of opposing realms, holdings, and allies. (Def)

cards.name: Cult of the Dragon
cards.text: Playable only with a dragon champion. This ally doubles the base level of the attached dragon. It is discarded if forced to switch sides.

cards.name: Undead Dragonrider
cards.text: Dragon; undead; flyer. All opposing allies that are not undead or flyers are level 0 and have no special powers.

cards.name: Dragonne
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. This ally can use unarmed combat cards usable only by dragons. Playing this ally discards an opposing ally of +2 or less already in play.

cards.name: Faerie Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. This ally can cast wizard spells. The faerie dragon cannot be forced to switch sides or be discarded in combat for any reason.

cards.name: Firedrake
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. The base level of an opposing nondragon champions is reduced to 2 for this round of battle.

cards.name: Drake
cards.text: Dragon; flyer. This ally can be discarded from a player's hand to prevent a dragon champion from going to the discard pile for any reason.

cards.name: Amulet of the Wyrm
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a dragon champion of any world. The champion can cast any spell and is immune to offensive unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Fang of the Dragon
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a dragon champion of any world. The champion can use any psionic power card or blood ability.

cards.name: Orb of the Eternal Dragon
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to dragon champions of any world. The level bonus of all cards attached to this dragon are doubled. Opposing dragons cannot enter battle against this champion.

cards.name: Mighty Servant of Leuk-o
cards.text: A champion with this artifact is immune to the special powers of champions and allies of level 5 or less.

cards.name: Swoop
cards.text: Usable only by dragons. This maneuver doubles the base level of an attacking dragon if the opposing champion cannot fly. (Def/4)

cards.name: Claw
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Victims of this maneuver can play no further allies or magical items in this battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Tail Sweep
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Victims of this maneuver can play no further spells, psionic power cards, or blood abilities in this battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Bite
cards.text: Usable only by dragons. Victims of this maneuver must discard an attached magical item or discard the first one they play if they have none attached. (Off/4)

cards.name: Breath Weapon I
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Instantly destroys all allies of +3 or less. (Off/4)

cards.name: Breath Weapon II
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Discard an opposing champion or ally of base level 4 or less. (Off/4)

cards.name: Breath Weapon III
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Discards an opposing champion of base level 5 or less or any two opposing allies. (Off/4)

cards.name: Swallow Whole
cards.text: Usable only by dragon champions. Play once a dragon's total level exceeds 24 to swallow (discard) the opposing champion and automatically win the round of battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Evade
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Play at any time to cancel the effects of an unarmed combat card. (Def)

cards.name: Age of the Dragon
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All dragon champions and dragon allies in play are immune to offensive spells, magical items, and psionic power cards.

cards.name: The Battle Must Go On!
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until the end of the game. It is immune to spells and events. A player must have six unrazed realms at the start of his turn in order to win. Further, any player who runs out of cards must shuffle his discard pile and use that as his new draw pile.

cards.name: T'chaar, Dragon of Flame
cards.text: Flyer. T'chaar thrives on destruction and may use any offensive card (spell, psionic powers, unarmed combat, blood abilities, etc). Defensive cards played against T'chaar are doubled in icon level.

cards.name: Lair Raid!
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all dragons are halved in level when in combat with nondragon champions. While this event is in play, all dragons lose their special powers. (Harmful)

cards.name: Boreas
cards.text: Dragon, flyer. Boreas can cast wizard spells. He can charm opposing champions, forcing them to give him an attached item (this player's choice). At the end of the battle, the attachment is shuffled back into the owning player's draw pile.

cards.name: Morcanth Dragontamer
cards.text: Flyer. Dragons cannot oppose Morcanth in battle. In combat, she can force any dragon champion to act as her ally, adding its level and special power to her own. If she is defeated, the dragon champion allied with her is also discarded.

cards.name: Cron the Black
cards.text: Dragon; flyer; swimmer. During combat, Cron's powerful acid breath can destroy any single attachment of an opposing champion.

cards.name: Draconic Allies
cards.text: Until the end of this player's turn, his champions may attack any realm, regardless of position or restrictions. These champions attack with surprise, preventing the opposing player from playing cards other than allies in the battle. (Harmful)

cards.name: Lernaean Hydra
cards.text: The Lernaean Hydra has a base level equal to the adjusted level of the champion opposing it when combat is first entered. When in the player's pool, it is immune to offensive spells, psionic power cards and harmful events.

cards.name: Dragon Hatchling
cards.text: Dragon champions will not fight against the Dragon Hatchling. If defeated in battle, the discard piles of all players are shuffled back into their draw piles.

cards.name: Dragon Cultist
cards.text: The Dragon Cultist can raise dragons from the dead. Every turn that this champion doesn't attack, his player may return one dragon champion from his discard pile to his hand.

cards.name: Playing to Lose
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. During phase 2 a player can opt to raze one of his own realms, in addition to playing a realm or holding. While this rule is in effect, the first player to have six razed realms in his formation for one full turn wins, instead of the normal winning conditions. Players may attack razed realms in another player's formation to discard them, if successful.

cards.name: Wyvern
cards.text: The Wyvern's poisonous sting is extremely deadly. Each ally played with it reduces the opposing champion by half that many levels (rounded down).

cards.name: Charm, the Crystal Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Charm can cast wizard spells and psionic power cards. If opposed when she attacks, her dazzling breath weapon destroys all holdings in that player's formation.

cards.name: Chimera
cards.text: Flyer. When played in combat, the Chimera uses its fiery breath to blast away one card in the opposing champion's force (excluding the champion).

cards.name: Red Dragon Figurine
cards.text: This magical item can be attached to a champion to add 5 levels or may be played as a 5 level monster (dragon) champion. (Def)

cards.name: Sapphire the Blue Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. Sapphire can use wizard spells. At the start of battle, he may breath lightning on the opposing champion, who must discard all attached items or a realm from his player's hand.

cards.name: Glimmer the Brass Dragon
cards.text: Flyer, Earthwalker. Glimmer can cast cleric spells. He has a large hoard and is constantly adding to it. Whenever is victorious in battle, his player can return a magical item or artifact from his discard pile and attach it to Glimmer.

cards.name: Treasure Hoard
cards.text: Rumors of a great treasure lure dragons from their lairs. Dragon champions in play are sent to Limbo and cannot return until their owner's discard one magical item for each champion. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dragon's Bones
cards.text: The attached champion can discard this item at any time to end a battle involving a dragon champion. The combat ends without a victor. (Off)

cards.name: Dragon Skirmish
cards.text: A power struggle among dragonkind leads to a brutal war. In one pool chosen by this player, all dragons -except for the one with the highest level- are discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Wyrmblight
cards.text: Sword; may only be attached to nondragon heroes .The attached champion is immune to the special powers of all dragons and the special powers of any cards attached to them. (Def)

cards.name: Wyrms' Conclave
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no dragon champions or allies may be involved in combat. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dragon's Breath
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Only dragon champions may attack.

cards.name: Ancient Draconic Magic
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Spells cast by dragon champions cannot be dispelled.

cards.name: Underground Lair
cards.text: Cannot be attacked by flyers or swimmers. Defending dragons can take any one card from their discard pile and play it immediately.

cards.name: Dragon's Scale
cards.text: The attached champion is immune to both offensive wizard spells and offensive unarmed combat cards - though only if played by dragon champions. (Def)

cards.name: Mausoleum of the Zombie Master
cards.text: This player's champions can never enter the Abyss. If sent there by an opposing player's action, the champion instead goes to the discard pile. If sent there by this player's action, it is removed permanently from the game.

cards.name: Dungeon of the King
cards.text: This player's champions do not need to ask permission to use spells, psionic powers, unarmed combat cards, blood abilities, or thief skills.

cards.name: Lair of Dregoth, the Undead Dragon-King
cards.text: This player may discard a Dark Sun champion from his pool or hand to psionically turn a just-cast spell back at its original caster.

cards.name: Domain of Takhisis, Queen of Darkness
cards.text: This player's monster (dragon) champions are immune to all events, spells, artifacts, and magical items that instantly discard or defeat them.

cards.name: Undermountain
cards.text: Each time this player is entitled to draw spoils of victory, he may also take the bottom three cards of his draw pile. Any monster champions there may be placed into his pool. Any other cards are placed on the top of his draw pile.

cards.name: Labyrinth of Castle Greyhawk
cards.text: This player's Greyhawk realms may only be razed or discarded through combat.

cards.name: Under Castle Strahd
cards.text: This player's Ravenloft champions all become undead, and Young Strahd's special power has no effect on this player's champions.

cards.name: Palace of the Celestial Light
cards.text: This player's clerics need never ask permission to cast spells. Avatars may not attack this player's realms, nor may defend against this player's cleric champions.

cards.name: Field of the Battle Lord
cards.text: This player's heroes do not discard unarmed combat cards at the end of combat. Instead, they are retained for future combat, adding the cards' bonuses but ignoring their special powers.

cards.name: The Belly of the Beast
cards.text: This player's monsters are immune to hero unarmed combat cards. They may also use any unarmed combat card themselves (hero, dragon, undead, etc), regardless of restrictions.

cards.name: Pit of the Mind Lord
cards.text: This player's realms and his psionicist champions are immune to all spells cast in phase 3.

cards.name: The Torture Room
cards.text: This player may reshuffle his discard pile into his draw pile any time there are three of more blood abilities in his discard pile. No champions have immunity to this player's blood abilities while this dungeon card is in play.

cards.name: Maze of the Guild
cards.text: This player's thief champions can use stealth to attack any realm, regardless of powers or restrictions. Allies must still follow movement restrictions.

cards.name: Carrock of High Magicks
cards.text: This player can keep a spellbook. Each time this player is entitled to draw spoils of victory, he may instead search through his draw pile and retrieve any spell; the spell cannot be played immediately.

cards.name: The Enchanted Land
cards.text: This player's champions and allies become elves, elves (drow), dwarves, or halflings as the player chooses. Selection must be made in phase 3 and lasts until the player's next phase 3.

cards.name: Purveyor of Events
cards.text: This player's helpful events cannot be negated or cancelled by any card.

cards.name: Spells of the Archmage
cards.text: Any wizard spells with a stated duration that are cast by this player's AD&D champions are doubled in duration.

cards.name: Spells of the Friar
cards.text: Any cleric spells with a stated duration that are cast by this player's Forgotten Realms champions are doubled in duration.

cards.name: Spells from the Grave
cards.text: Any defensive spells cast by this player's undead Greyhawk champions cannot be dispelled or turned.

cards.name: Powers from the Savage Land
cards.text: Psionic power cards used by this player's Dark Sun champions are doubled in bonus level.

cards.name: Might of the Blood Right
cards.text: This player's champions are all considered regents and can use blood abilities.

cards.name: Song of the Dragonlance
cards.text: This player's realms can only be attacked by flyers, swimmers, or earthwalkers. His champions and allies all have the ability to swim as needed.

cards.name: Bats in the Belfry
cards.text: No offensive magical items can be used by opponents when attacking this player's realms. The items remain behind in the attacker's pool. If the champion returns, they are reattached; if not, the items are discarded.

cards.name: The Azure Tower of Onad the Fallen
cards.text: This player's helpful events cannot be negated, and his harmful events cannot be copied. Events that are discarded without being used are placed in the discard pile instead of the Abyss.

cards.name: Beneath Castle Drawmij
cards.text: This player's holdings cannot be discarded except by razing the attached realm. This player can ignore the Rules of the Cosmos when playing holdings.

cards.name: Return of the Dwarven King
cards.text: This player's dwarf champions are immune to all events (helpful and harmful). This player's dwarves add 3 to their adjusted levels.

cards.name: The Guildhall
cards.text: Each time this player's thief champions are in combat, their player may take the top card from any other player's draw pile. If it can be legally played, do so. Otherwise it goes to its owner's hand. Cards used are returned to the bottom of the owner's draw pile after combat is resolved.

cards.name: The Dragon's Refuge
cards.text: If an opposing player's dragon champion is defeated in combat, this player may attach the dragon to this realm and use it as an ally (level only) the next time the realm is attacked.

cards.name: Cities of the Sun
cards.text: This player's champions may all use blood abilities.

cards.name: Border Post
cards.text: This realm can defend itself as a level 5 hero. If it is in the same formation as the Border Garrison, its level adds to that realm.

cards.name: Border Garrison
cards.text: This realm can defend itself as a level 10 wizard. Regardless of where it is in the formation, it must be attacked first.

cards.name: The Ruins of Iolonia
cards.text: These ruins are so forlorn that only undead champions and allies will attack this realm.

cards.name: Tower by the Sea
cards.text: The lighthouse is a haven, letting this player increase or reduce his swimming champions' and allies' base level by 3.

cards.name: The Forgotten Ruins
cards.text: A powerful psionic shield emanates from this realm, protecting this player's champions from unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: The Hidden Village
cards.text: The treant ally guarding this realm is immune to all cards played by or attached to an opposing champion except those that contain the word "fire" or "flame."

cards.name: Bitter Knoll
cards.text: Any realm played into the formation after the Bitter Knoll is converted into an AD&D realm. If this realm is razed or discarded, all converted realms return to their original trademarks.

cards.name: The Ogre
cards.text: Awnshegh; can use blood abilities and all unarmed combat cards. In combat this player may take the top three cards from any opponent's draw pile. Any monsters join the Ogre's side as allies; all other cards are placed at the bottom of the owner's draw pile. At the end of combat, the monster-allies go to their owner's pool.

cards.name: Fire Dragon
cards.text: Flyer. This monster's searing breath weapon destroys all cards attached to a champion when it first enters combat. Other cards can be attached subsequently.

cards.name: Zaranda Star
cards.text: Adventurer. Zaranda can store blood abilities face down beneath her in the pool, using whichever ones she wishes in combat.

cards.name: Skulker
cards.text: Swimmer. Leader of a band of undersea pirates, Skulker can plunder any opponent's discard pile during combat, using any allies, magical items, or artifacts (if legal) found there. At the end of the round, the cards are returned to their owner's draw pile, which is reshuffled.

cards.name: Jasper
cards.text: Adventurer. Cautious and wary, Jasper deflects unarmed combat cards played against him to a champion in any pool.

cards.name: The Hapless Halfling
cards.text: Adventurer. A morale booster, the halfling adds 2 levels to all fellow adventurers and halfling champions and allies played by this player.

cards.name: Feral Halfling
cards.text: Can use all unarmed combat cards and defensive psionic powers. An opposing champion defeated by the feral halfling is eaten (sent to the abyss.)

cards.name: Dearlyn Ambersong
cards.text: Adventurer. Especially distrustful of thieves, Dearlyn can choose to negate one thief skill played against her or a fellow adventurer in combat once per turn.

cards.name: Tyvorg the Frost Giant
cards.text: Can cast wizard spells. Tyvorg instantly slays the Living Wall when he is brought into play. For each giant ally played with him, Tyvorg's base level increases by 10.

cards.name: Troglodyte
cards.text: Underdark. This creature's odor is such that all cards in an opposing player's force of icon level 4 or less are discarded (including the champion, if applicable).

cards.name: Hook Horror
cards.text: Underdark. Because of this creature's acute hearing, it can "hear" the next card to be played by an opposing player (the card is shown but not played) and choose to scuttle back to its pool along with the attached champion.

cards.name: Lurker in the Earth
cards.text: Underdark; earthwalker. The Lurker can be played at any time as a harmful event to burrow over to a player's pool and devour (discard) any earthwalking champion of level 6 or less or it can be played in combat to discard one opposing ally already played.

cards.name: Skull Tumor
cards.text: Underdark. This ally may be played directly into a pool; this player's discarded champions are attached to the Tumor, which increases in level only and may be used in any future combat. Immune to events.

cards.name: Hero Slayer
cards.text: Giant. This ally negates a just played unarmed combat card or instantly slays an opposing hero of base level 4 or less.

cards.name: The White Weird
cards.text: Underdark; flyer. The White Weird can be played at any time as a harmful event to fly over to a player's formation and poison (discard) one holding or it can be played in combat to halve (round down) an opposing champion's adjusted level.

cards.name: Psion Sucker
cards.text: When this dreaded ally appears in combat, all psionicists in play are reduced by 2 levels, which are added to the Psion Sucker. The level reductions last until this player's next turn.

cards.name: Master Illithid
cards.text: Underdark. When played, this ally can shift any two cards of one type in the opposing player's force to this side. Choice need not be immediate.

cards.name: Bottomless Horror
cards.text: Underdark; earthwalker. This horrid creature can reach into any player's Abyss when in combat. The icon levels of all cards there are totaled to become the Horror's bonus. The cards used are removed from the game.

cards.name: Boiling Oil
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Greyhawk realm. Any attacking champions are destroyed in a vat of boiling oil after the battle (win or lose) and discarded.

cards.name: Siege Ladder
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Dark Sun realm. Any cards attached to attacking champions are discarded after the battle (win or lose).

cards.name: Net of Ensnaring
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Forgotten Realms realm. Any cards played by attacking champions during combat are sent to the Abyss after the battle is resolved.

cards.name: Battering Ram
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Greyhawk realm. Its bonus is equal to the number of Greyhawk realms and holdings in play.

cards.name: Ballista
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Dragonlance realm. If this realm is attacked, it can target an opposing player's pool and destroy one artifact or magical item.

cards.name: Cannon Ball
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Birthright realm. If this realm is attacked, it can fire into an opposing player's pool and kill one champion.

cards.name: Borer
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to a Ravenloft realm. It instantly destroys all opposing allies and magical items of less than level 7.

cards.name: Catapult
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to an AD&D realm. At any time during a round of combat, this player can choose to catapult the attacking champion to the Abyss. This realm is razed and the artifact discarded, but no one gains spoils.

cards.name: Siege Machine
cards.text: This artifact can only be attached to an Underdark realm. It protects all holdings in the player's formation, allowing a holding to be moved to another realm if its attached realm is razed or discarded; the holding is discarded if it cannot be attached to a new realm.

cards.name: Sword of Sharpness
cards.text: This weapon easily pierces the strongest armor, instantly defeating champions of base level 3 or less. (Off)

cards.name: The Triton Throne
cards.text: This magical item may only be attached to any realm. Its +4 bonus adds to any champion defending the realm and only swimmers may attack the attached realm. (Off)

cards.name: Flask of Curses
cards.text: The attached champion becomes a swimmer. If the champion with this item is defeated in combat, the flask is attached to the victor, becoming a -5 item that negates the attached champion's special powers. (Off)

cards.name: Crystal Dragon Figurine
cards.text: This figurine can be used to add a +3 in battle; or can add a +9, but is then discarded; or can add a mighty +18, but then both the magical item and the attached champion are discarded. (Def)

cards.name: Amulet of the Dragon King
cards.text: This magical item can only be attached to any realm. For each attacking champion defeated while defending the attached realm, 1 dragon champion can be returned from the discard pile to this player's pool or hand. (Def)

cards.name: Breath Charm
cards.text: This powerful charm makes the attached champion immune to the special powers of an opposing dragon. (Def)

cards.name: Pearl Pegasus
cards.text: This figurine of wondrous power causes its owner to become a flyer. The figure's flight is so dexterous that the owner is immune to all offensive spells, psionic powers, blood abilities, unarmed combat cards, and thief skills that affect a single target. (Def)

cards.name: Clockwork Ogre
cards.text: If the attached champion is discarded in battle, this mechanical marvel returns to the pool and is instantly attached to another champion. If there are no champions in the pool it returns to this player's hand. (Def)

cards.name: Amulet of Spell Turning
cards.text: Whenever an offensive spell is cast at the attached champion or his pool, this player cuts his draw pile and checks the last digit of the card number of the card revealed. If it is 0-7, the spell is turned back at the caster. On an 8 or 9, the spell takes effect normally. (Def)

cards.name: Psionic Disintegration
cards.text: Cannot be used in a deck containing Disintegrate (393/2nd). Destroys one realm, regardless of position. The destroyed realm must be discarded. This player can make no attacks this turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Magic Draining Field
cards.text: Can be played at any time to negate all spells in play, including a just cast spell. No more spells may be cast until the end of this player's next turn. (Def)

cards.name: Drain Will
cards.text: Discards one champion of adjusted level 9 or less in one pool. No champions in that pool may attack until after that player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Eat Dirt!
cards.text: Opposing champion returns to his pool with his attachments. The battle may continue with a new champion. (Off/4)

cards.name: Vital Blow
cards.text: The opposing champion is sent to the Abyss if defeated, regardless of any special power he may have. (Off/4)

cards.name: Supernatural Strength
cards.text: Usable only by any undead or dragon champion. The base level of this champion is doubled until the end of this round of combat. (Off/4)

cards.name: Create Minion
cards.text: Return one champion from your discard pile to your pool. The restored champion is now considered undead. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Melt Bone
cards.text: Opposing champion must immediately play an ally or return to his pool defeated (discard all attachments). The battle may continue with a different champion. (Off/4)

cards.name: Death Field
cards.text: One champion of base level 6 or higher is discarded. (Off/3)

cards.name: Con Game
cards.text: All champions and their attachments in one opponent's pool are shuffled together. This player deals out the shuffled cards between he and their owner. This player then discards the cards dealt to him. The other player may immediately place the cards he was dealt back into his hand or into his pool. (Off/3)

cards.name: Legal Loophole
cards.text: This skill may be attached to any thief to allow all of this player's thieves to ignore the effects of any rule cards in play. Lasts until the attached thief is discarded. (Def//3)

cards.name: Tumble Out of Danger
cards.text: This skill may be played at any time to redirect a spell or event that targets the champion using this skill. It can be redirected at any champion in any pool or in battle. (Def)

cards.name: Broad Jump
cards.text: When played in combat, this skill allows the attached thief to bypass a defending wizard, cleric, or psionicist and automatically raze the realm. The defending champion returns to his pool. (Off/4)

cards.name: Hijacking
cards.text: This skill may be played any time that another player is to receive cards from his draw pile as the result of an event, realm, artifact, champion, or holding's power. You may take an equal number of cards from your draw pile, and the other player must immediately discard his draws. (Off)

cards.name: Fortune Telling
cards.text: Play this skill on a champion in any opponent's pool and call odd or even. Then cut the owner's draw pile and check the card's last digit. If you are correct, the champion is sent to Limbo until his owner discards a champion with a base level equal to or higher than the champion's. If you are wrong, your opponent gets the card that you cut to and may play it immediately (if legal). (Off/3)

cards.name: Gather Information
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards in any opponent's draw pile. If you choose, you may discard the champion using this skill to place the cards on the bottom of their draw pile. (Off/3)

cards.name: Intimidation
cards.text: Tell your opponent to break off the attack. If he does, the battle ends without spoils and nothing is razed. If he presses the attack, you may take the top 5 cards from your draw pile. Place any realms or holdings on the bottom of your draw pile. Any other cards may be played into the battle, regardless of restrictions (ie, multiple artifacts may be attached, spells may be used by nonspellcasters, etc). After combat is resolved, only legal cards may remain attached. (Def/4)

cards.name: Trailing
cards.text: The attached thief can "follow" a champion that has just attacked a realm that has special movement or other restrictions. This champion may ignore those restrictions. Lasts until the attached champion is discarded. (Def/3)

cards.name: Extension I
cards.text: Castable only by AD&D champions. Can be cast to extend the duration of any spell or event that lasts until the start or end of your next turn. Draw and discard a card, noting the card number's last digit. This is the number of additional turns added to the duration. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: City Shield
cards.text: Castable only by Birthright champions. This spell prevents offensive spells from affecting any of your realms. Lasts until dispelled. (Def/3)

cards.name: Spectral Dragon
cards.text: Castable only by Dragonlance champions. This spell creates a monstrous illusory dragon that sweeps through all opposing player's pools, sending all champions of base level 4 or less to the discard pile. (Off/3)

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text: Castable only by Forgotten Realms champions. This spell increases in power; a champion gets 1 lightning ball for every 2 base levels he has, to a maximum of 4. Each lightning ball can add 3 to the caster's level or can destroy one opposing ally. (Off/4)

cards.name: Drawmij's Beneficent Polymorph
cards.text: Castable only by Greyhawk champions. This spell allows the caster to fly, swim, or earthwalk, as desired. This champion may also copy the special powers of any champion in his pool. Lasts until the start of this player's next turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Animate Gargoyle
cards.text: Castable only by Ravenloft champions. This spell creates a flying monster champion whose base level is equal to twice the caster's adjusted level. This champion flies immediately to his pool and is in all ways treated as a normal monster. This spell may only be dispelled or negated when it is first cast. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Minions of Darkness
cards.text: Castable only by drow or Underdark champions (UD). Cast when defending an Underdark realm, this spell allows this player's Triumvirate allies to be used in defense. They may not be discarded or forced to switch sides for any reason. (Def)

cards.name: Conjure Greater Fire Elemental
cards.text: Castable only by Dark Sun champions. This spell creates an ally equal in bonus to the base level of the caster. The greater fire elemental causes all magical items held by an opposing champion to be sent to the Abyss. (Off/4)

cards.name: Divine Assistance
cards.text: This spell negates the effects of all dungeon cards in play until dispelled. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: What Goes Around Comes Around
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All cards that allow a single player to draw extra cards into his hand (such as events, realms, artifacts, holdings, etc) allow all players to draw an equal number of cards instantly. This rule card can only be removed by playing another rule card. It is immune to champion powers, events, and the Wish spell.

cards.name: Winner's Trophy
cards.text: May be attached to a champion of any world. In combat, the attached champion may use any type of card playable in phase 4.

cards.name: Pretty Magical Ring
cards.text: The attached champion and his allies can fly, swim, or earthwalk as desired. This champion and his allies are immune to all cards that specifically target fliers, swimmers, or earthwalkers. (Def)

cards.name: Fighting Dirty!
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Opposing player draws and discards a card, noting its last digit. The opposing player must immediately discard that many cards from his hand. (Off/4)

cards.name: Dissolution
cards.text: One razed realm (this player's choice) is discarded. (Off/3/5)

cards.name: Black Hand Thieves' Guild
cards.text: May be attached to any realm. While this holding is in play, all players must discard down to five cards any time they have nine or more cards in their hand.

cards.name: Elminster's Intuition
cards.text: Name a card out loud. Immediately search an opponent's draw pile for that card. If you find it, send the card to the Abyss. If you don't find it, immediately send your foremost realm to the Abyss instead. (Harmful)

cards.name: Fool's Paradise
cards.text: This charming fool distracts all of one player's non-monster champions, preventing them from performing any actions until this player's next turn. (Harmful)

cards.name: Aliki
cards.text: Halfling. Aliki can cast wizard spells. During combat, this cunning rogue can steal one magical item from an opposing champion. The item returns to its owner at the end of battle.

cards.name: Lilac Hesabon
cards.text: Adventurer; elf; swimmer. Lilac's dog, Lightning, acts as a +3 ally to her or a fellow adventurer. Lightning can be discarded in combat to negate one offensive card.

cards.name: Enter Darkness Together
cards.text: Play this card to cancel the effects of any just-played event or spell. This event cannot be calmed, and it may only be negated by tearing up the card which this event was played on. If this happens, the original event or spell works normally. (Harmful)

cards.name: Recorder of Ye'Cind
cards.text: Usable by any champion. At any time, this player may look at any cards which are in play face down. Once per turn, this player may randomly pull half the cards from any player's hand and look at them.

cards.name: Telarie Willowind
cards.text: Can cast cleric spells. Telarie's unicorn steed acts as a +4 ally. If defending, she can teleport out of battle back to her pool with her attachments, though the realm is then razed.

cards.name: The Llama King
cards.text: During battle, the Llama King may summon an army of llamas to aid him. The llamas act as a +9 ally that can trample one opposing ally (discarding it).

cards.name: Necba the Wrathmaker
cards.text: Halfling (kender). Immune to offensive spells and harmful events. Opposing players must attack and raze a realm each turn or discard their highest level champion while Necba is in play.

cards.name: Shan, Karate Master
cards.text: Double the bonus of any unarmed combat card. This champion hates magic and cannot use magical items or artifacts. Gains 2 levels for each spell, magical item, or artifact used against him.

cards.name: Handmine
cards.text: Keep this event in your hand. A player who looks into your hand and finds this card must immediately discard his entire hand and the card that allowed him to look. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Builder
cards.text: Dwarf; earthwalker. When in a pool, this champion allows a razed realm to be rebuilt by discarding only one card, instead of the normal three.

cards.name: Slorath's Gloves
cards.text: At the start of this player's turn, he draws a card from an opponents hand and sends it to Limbo. All such cards selected remain in Limbo while the Gloves are in play, returning to the player's hand when the Gloves are discarded.

cards.name: Rary's Apprentice
cards.text: Immune to harmful events. While this champion is in play, Rary cannot be discarded for any reason. If Rary loses a battle, he returns to his pool with his attachments. Rary can use all items attached to his apprentice, gaining 2 levels for each so used.

cards.name: Poor Oriental Lord
cards.text: While this champion is in play, no cards marked "First Edition" can be played. All those already in play remain, but no new ones may be played.

cards.name: Highmaster Illithios
cards.text: Underdark. Immune to offensive spells, magical items, and artifacts. Draw a card whenever a psionic power card is played.

cards.name: Chaos Lord
cards.text: Can cast wizard and cleric spells. This champion is immune to harmful events and rule cards. Chaos Lord may be sent to the Abyss to rearrange all realms in all formations (this player's choice).

cards.name: Giant Troll
cards.text: Giant. This ally regenerates and remains in play for an entire attack on a realm; it is discarded only after the realm is razed or the attack discontinued.

cards.name: Elyk the Bard
cards.text: At the beginning of this player's turn, Elyk can choose to change into a wizard or hero. Elyk's legend lore ability confers immunity to the effects of any one artifact (chosen at the start of this player's turn) to his player.

cards.name: Dor Amberglow
cards.text: Adventurer. Dor can cast wizard spells and is immune to offensive psionics. He can act as an ally for any other adventurer, returning to his pool after the battle.

cards.name: Tarrasque
cards.text: Play on a realm. The victim may discard his pool to discard the tarrasque. If he discards nothing, the realm is razed and he plays the event on another player's realm continuing the cycle. (Discard if no realms remain.)

cards.name: Black Bess
cards.text: Each player must draw and discard a card, checking the last digit of its number. Discard all the player's champions in play whose unadjusted level is greater than this number.

cards.name: Caer Allison
cards.text: May be played as a temporary realm at any time. (Only one can be in play at any time.) At the end of the owner's next turn, this card must be discarded.

cards.name: Curse of Azure Bonds
cards.text: Control any one enemy champion until the end of your next turn, treating it as a champion from your own pool. Return it to the owning player's pool or discard pile, as appropriate.

cards.name: Cyrinishad
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no priest spells may be cast. Only Cyric is immune to this effect.

cards.name: Darkwalker War
cards.text: Draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of its number. Until the end of your current turn, all monsters and undead gain a number of bonus levels equal to that digit.

cards.name: Dead Magic Zone
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, no spells may be cast, and all artifacts and magic items are ignored.

cards.name: Horde
cards.text: Each player must immediately raze one of his own realms or discard two champions from his pool and/or hand.

cards.name: Lady Luck
cards.text: The player and one opponent each draw a card and compare card numbers. Discard the card with the lower last digit; play the other immediately or keep it in hand. Ties are both played (discard both if identical).

cards.name: Wild Magic Surge
cards.text: Play at the end of any other player's turn. The order of play immediately reverses (clockwise to counter-clockwise, and vice versa).

cards.name: The Coral Kingdom
cards.text: This realm can be attacked only by swimmers.

cards.name: Halruaa
cards.text: All wizards defending this realm gain 2 levels. Any champion defending this realm may cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Kozakura
cards.text: This realm can be attacked only by flyers or swimmers.

cards.name: Luiren
cards.text: All halfling champions and allies gain +3 when defending this realm.

cards.name: Maztica
cards.text: When this realm is first played, no heroes of level 6 or higher may attack or defend until the beginning of this player's next turn.

cards.name: Mulhorand
cards.text: Any champion defending this realm may cast wizard spells. Clerics defending the realm gain +2 levels.

cards.name: Raurin
cards.text: If this realm is razed, the attacking champion must be discarded.

cards.name: Shou Lung
cards.text: All artifacts used in defense of this realm gain +3 levels.

cards.name: Blackstaff Tower
cards.text: This holding counts as a +3 ally. No wizard spells may be played against champions defending the attached realm, and defending wizards gain +3 levels.

cards.name: Candlekeep
cards.text: Whenever an opponent plays an event, the owner of this holding may immediately examine that player's hand.

cards.name: High Horn
cards.text: The garrison of High Horn is a +5 ally.

cards.name: Mithril Hall
cards.text: Each time the attached realm is successfully defended, search the draw pile for the first magical item or artifact, and play it immediately into pool or hand, then reshuffle the draw pile.

cards.name: Moonwell
cards.text: The attached realm can cast cleric spells and is unaffected by harmful cleric spells and events.

cards.name: Pook's Palace
cards.text: When the attached realm is successfully defended, draw two cards as the spoils of victory.

cards.name: Yulash
cards.text: Monsters defending the attached realm gain 2 levels for each ally used to attack it.

cards.name: Tower of Ashaba
