cards.text: When the attached realm is attacked, draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of its number. For the duration of the round, all defending allies of level 4 or lower gain a number of levels equal to that digit.

cards.name: Aerial Servant
cards.text: Play as a +4 flying ally, or give champion and all allies flying ability for one turn. (Def/4)

cards.name: Creeping Doom
cards.text: Immediately razes one realm with no holding. (Off/3)

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: All cards currently in battle are discarded, and combat ends with no victor. Every player must raze one of his own realms or discard a holding in play. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Illusory Fortification
cards.text: Creates a holding that adds 7 levels to a defending champion. Lasts until the beginning of the player's next turn. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Quest
cards.text: No champions of unadjusted level 5 or higher may be played or enter battle until the beginning of this player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Succor
cards.text: Return a discarded ally to your hand on the same turn it was defeated. (Def/4/5)

cards.name: Reincarnate
cards.text: Discard any champion and replace it with any champion of the same level or lower from your draw pile. Reshuffle the draw pile. (Def/3/5)

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Return any champion or ally from your discard pile to your hand. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Shadow Engines
cards.text: Discard any holding of an opponent. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Symbol of Hopelessness
cards.text: Ends the current battle immediately. All allies and spells are discarded, and attacking champion may not attack again this battle. (Off/4)

cards.name: Word of Recall
cards.text: The current battle round ends with no winner or loser, though spells and allies are still discarded. A new attacker may continue the battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Zone of Truth
cards.text: All players must keep their hands face up on the table until the end of this player's next turn. (Off/3)

cards.name: Death Link
cards.text: If the casting champion is defeated, the opposing champion is also discarded. (Def/4)

cards.name: Find Familiar
cards.text: This spell creates an ally which remains with the caster until he is defeated. No event, magic item, spell, or ally's ability can cause it to change sides or be discarded. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Great Shout
cards.text: Draw and discard an opponent's card, noting the last digit of its number. Add that digit to the caster's level for this round of battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
cards.text: Play as a holding, permanently duplicating the effects of any one holding in play. The illusory holding remains even if the copied holding is discarded. (Def/3)

cards.name: Limited Wish
cards.text: Cancel the effects of one event card. This spell can be cast any time. (Off)

cards.name: Time Stop
cards.text: Take any one wizard spell from your draw pile and play it immediately (if legal). Then reshuffle the draw pile. (Def/3/4/5)

cards.name: Water Breathing
cards.text: All of this player's champions and allies become swimmers for this turn. They may attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Wish
cards.text: Discard any one card in play, regardless of its immunities, except a realm. This spell can be cast at any time, but the casting champion cannot be used again until it's owner's next turn. (Off)

cards.name: Deck of Many Things
cards.text: Each time the attached champion attacks or defends, draw a card. If it is a spell, ally, artifact, or magic item the champion can use, play it at once; otherwise discard it.

cards.name: Dragonslayer
cards.text: Cancel the powers of any dragon champions or allies opposing this champion in battle.

cards.name: Flametongue
cards.text: Attached hero may cause this sword to flame as a +6 magic item for one round of battle, but it must be discarded immediately afterward.

cards.name: Frostbrand
cards.text: Attached hero may create intense cold with this sword for one round of battle, causing it to act as a +7 magic item, but it must be discarded immediately afterward.

cards.name: Gauntlets of Swimming
cards.text: Attached champion becomes a swimmer and may attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position.

cards.name: Helm of Water Breathing
cards.text: Attached champion becomes a swimmer and may attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of it's position.

cards.name: Horn of Blasting
cards.text: The attached champion immediately discards the holding of any realm it attacks.

cards.name: Ring of Jumping
cards.text: The attached champion is not stopped by walls.

cards.name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
cards.text: The attached champion and his allies ignore walls of stone or iron.

cards.name: Vorpal Blade
cards.text: Opponent in combat must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of its number, if that digit is 3 or less, the opponent's champion is defeated.

cards.name: Wand of Wonder
cards.text: Draw and discard a card each time the wand is used in a battle, noting the last digit of the card's number. For that combat, the attached champion gains bonus levels equal to that digit.

cards.name: Dragon Throne
cards.text: All allies of this champion gain +2, and the player may look at one opponent's hand at the beginning of each of his turns.

cards.name: Guenhwyvar
cards.text: If the attached champion is defeated, Guenhwyvar may be attached to any other Forgotten Realms champion in the player's pool.

cards.name: Hammer of Tyr
cards.text: When this card is used in combat, discard all undead involved in the battle.

cards.name: The Ring of Winter
cards.text: While this is in play, all opponents draw one fewer card than normal on their turns (minimum of one card).

cards.name: Sword of Cymrych Hugh
cards.text: When this card is used in combat, discard all undead and giants involved in the battle.

cards.name: Bloodriders
cards.text: Undead.

cards.name: Dragonclaw
cards.text: Dragonclaw gains +4 levels if defending Kozakura or Shou Lung. May not ally a champion allied with Mad Monkey.

cards.name: Flaming Fist
cards.text: When the Flaming Fist is used in combat, the losing player must immediately discard one magical item or artifact from pool or hand, or else raze one of his own realms.

cards.name: Halfling, Inc.
cards.text: When this card is used in combat, immediately discard one of the opposing champion's magic items or artifacts. Halfling.

cards.name: Kuo Toa
cards.text: Swimmer. May attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position.

cards.name: Locathah
cards.text: Swimmer. May attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position.

cards.name: Mad Monkey
cards.text: Mad Monkey gains +4 levels if defending Kozakura or Shou Lung. May not ally a champion allied with Dragonclaw.

cards.name: Ninjas
cards.text: When used in combat, draw one card at random from the opponent's hand, playing it against the opponent if possible, discarding it otherwise.

cards.name: Olive Ruskettle
cards.text: When Olive is involved in a combat, no magical items or artifacts function anywhere in play. Halfling.

cards.name: Orcs of Dragonspear
cards.text: Gains +2 for each additional orc allied to the champion. Orc.

cards.name: Orcs of the Savage Frontier
cards.text: Gains +2 for each additional orc allied to the champion. Orc.

cards.name: Pseudodragon
cards.text: If played with a wizard champion, the pseudodragon becomes a familiar, remaining with the caster until he is defeated. No event, magic item, spell, or ally's ability can cause it to change sides or be discarded.

cards.name: Red Wizards
cards.text: Allows the allied champion to cast wizard spells.

cards.name: Sahuagin
cards.text: Swimmer. May attack any realm with a coastline, regardless of its position.

cards.name: Samurai
cards.text: Gains +4 if defending Shou Lung or Kozakura.

cards.name: Darkenbeast
cards.text: Flyer. When this card is first played, discard all familiars in play.

cards.name: Firbolg
cards.text: Eliminates first opposing ally of level 4 or less. Giant.

cards.name: Iron Golem
cards.text: Owner may discard the iron golem from his pool to discard one wall in play. When attacking or defending, the iron golem is immune to walls.

cards.name: Storm Giant
cards.text: When the storm giant is used in combat, no opposing champion or ally can fly.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: While in a pool, if not used in combat, each combat round the stone giant may destroy one enemy ally of level 4 or lower in play.

cards.name: Werewolf
cards.text: Any champion who defeats the werewolf must draw and discard a card, noting the last digit of its number. If that digit is 4 or less, the champion contracts lycanthropy and is discarded.

cards.name: Adon
cards.text: No spells, magic items or artifacts can be used against this champion. If Midnight is in play, Adon gains +5 levels.

cards.name: Erixitl
cards.text: This champion gains +4 levels if defending Maztica.

cards.name: Fzoul Chembryl
cards.text: Fzoul gains +4 levels if Cyric is in play.

cards.name: Young Robyn
cards.text: Robyn gains +5 levels if defending a Realm with an attached Moonwell.

cards.name: Ambassador Carrague
cards.text: Use Ambassador Carrague only in defensive combat. When he needs a card, play the top card from the draw pile, if legal, discarding it if not. Once three cards total have been discarded, draw no more for the combat round.

cards.name: Helm
cards.text: Casts cleric and wizard spells. If discarded from the pool, cancels one event, even if the event does not affect this player.

cards.name: Simbul of Aglarond
cards.text: Simbul gains +4 levels when battling Maligor the Red or Red Wizards.

cards.name: Vangerdahast
cards.text: When Vangerdahast is played in defense of a realm, the player may immediately look at the attacker's hand.

cards.name: Cyric
cards.text: Cyric can cast wizard and priest spells. All cards in his player's pool may be turned face down when Cyric is in play. Champions and their items must combat face up, however.

cards.name: Dragonbait
cards.text: Once during each defensive battle, if he does not participate, Dragonbait may save any one defeated champion or ally of level 4 or lower from being discarded.

cards.name: Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun
cards.text: Blackstaff gains +4 levels when defending Waterdeep.

cards.name: Ochimo
cards.text: Ochimo gains +4 levels when defending Kozakura. He must be defeated twice in a row before being discarded.

cards.name: Prince Tristan
cards.text: Prince Tristan gains +5 levels against giants, and when defending the Moonshaes.

cards.name: Princess Alusair
cards.text: Princess Alusair can use any Forgotten Realms champion (level only) from any pool as an ally when defending. If victorious, that champion returns to its pool after the combat round.

cards.name: Randal Morn
cards.text: All of this player's allies gain +1 level when Randal is in play.

cards.name: Time of Troubles
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. No champion of level 7 or greater (before magical items, artifacts, events, and other modifiers) may be involved in combat. All Forgotten Realms champions and allies gain +1 level.

cards.name: Tablets of Fate
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Only Forgotten Realms champions, realms, holdings, and artifacts retain any powers of immunity. No others may have immunity to anything while this card is in play.

cards.name: Thrice Hearty Cup of Balder the Red
cards.text: Cast on a hero, the champion automatically wins its next battle. (Def/3)

cards.name: Cold Cup of Calamity
cards.text: This player may examine one other player's hand and discard it down to 5 cards.

cards.name: Vessel of Vaporous Stones
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, the lowest total wins all battles. Allies (but not spells or other cards) are subtracted from the total in battle.

cards.name: Mug of the Earthbound
cards.text: Flying champions are grounded and unable to fly for the duration of this combat. Opposing flyer loses 2 levels. (Off/3/4)

cards.name: Hawksflight Grail
cards.text: Another champion from this player's pool can be brought into the combat (add their levels). If either is forcibly discarded, the other keeps all magic items and one artifact, and continues the combat.

cards.name: Vessel of Misty Passage
cards.text: This vessel allows the players to attack any realm via a secret passage. The passage lasts until the end of this player's turn.

cards.name: Teapot of the Golden Tempest
cards.text: Once during combat, the player can switch hands with his opponent. At the end of combat, switch the hands back. All draws and discards use the original owner's piles. (Off)

cards.name: Ebony Cup of Fate
cards.text: The player may examine his opponent's hand. If it contains an artifact, the player automatically loses the battle. If it contains no artifacts, he automatically wins the battle.

cards.name: Hero's Chalice
cards.text: Usable only by heroes, the attached champion gains 10 levels when defending, but only 5 when attacking.

cards.name: The Day That Will Live in Infamy
cards.text: The gods of revenge are in ascendance! Discard all wizards in battle or in pools.

cards.name: Unusually Good Fortune
cards.text: Played on another player's event card, this player draws 3 cards. If played upon 'Good Fortune,' this player draws 5 cards and the other player draws none.

cards.name: The Apple of His Eye
cards.text: Only one type of champion, chosen by this player, can attack or defend until the end of this player's next turn.

cards.name: The Golden Touch
cards.text: For this player's turn, all magical items in his pool or played in battle gain 2 levels. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Feather Flight
cards.text: If defeated, this champion and his allies fly back to their pool. His allies remain with him until their next battle. (Def/4)

cards.name: Golden Barter
cards.text: For each magical item discarded from his pool, the player can draw one card. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Dagger of Deception
cards.text: If an opponent wants to play a card in combat, this player draws it randomly. Noncombat cards are returned to the player's hand after being revealed. (Off)

cards.name: Wyrm of Earthwalking
cards.text: The attached champion and all allies have the earthwalking ability, allowing them to attack any realm. (Def)

cards.name: Bell of Might
cards.text: This item can duplicate another player's event card for this player. (This player's use is secondary.) The bell cannot be used again until this player's next turn. (Def)

cards.name: Muragh Brilstagg
cards.text: Undead. This magical skull subtracts 2 levels from all cards played against its champion. But it may not be played with any other allies.

cards.name: Phase Door
cards.text: Negates any wall spell.

cards.name: Wine of Eternity
cards.text: Puts one champion to sleep. At the beginning of his turn, the player may draw and discard a card. If the card's last digit matches or exceeds the champion's unadjusted level, he awakens.

cards.name: Spellblades
cards.text: Usable only be heroes and monsters. User is immune to the first two offensive spells cast in any combat.

cards.name: Netheril
cards.text: Wizards, magic items, artifacts, and wizard spells used in defense of this realm are doubled in level. Netheril can defend itself as a level 7 wizard.

cards.name: The Lure of Undermountain
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Every time a Forgotten Realms monster champion is discarded, its owner may force another player to choose one nonmonster champion, of any world, from that player's hand or pool to be discarded.

cards.name: Zhentarim Intrigue
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Whenever a player's Forgotten Realms realm is razed, he may draw a card and add it to his hand.

cards.name: Castle Arborgate
cards.text: This realm is immune to offensive spells, psionics, and harmful events. If discarded from any hand or deck by an opponent's action, put this realm into play and place all other Castle Arborgates in play in the Void regardless of any other cards special power.

cards.name: The Shadowlands
cards.text: When played or rebuilt, this realm steals the power of any other realm in an opponent's formation, which is now considered to have no special power until this realm is razed or discarded.

cards.name: Arena of Dori the Barbarian
cards.text: This realm is the home of combat. In phase 4, in place of attacking a realm, any player during their turn, may attack another champion in an opponents pool. The winner of this fight gets spoils. The loser is goes to the discard pile, regardless of special powers.

cards.name: Land of Legends
cards.text: When this realm is played, it may copy the world designation and special powers of any realm an opponent's formation, except Ancient Kalidnay, Menzoberranzan, or Avanil.

cards.name: Hollow World
cards.text: Underdark. This realm extends under all opponent's AD&D realms, allowing them to be attacked by this player's champions and allies, regardless of position or movement restrictions.

cards.name: The Oracle at Delphi
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 10 cleric that is immune to the powers of opposing champions. If this realm is razed, the attacker may search his draw pile and put any rule card into play. If successfully defended, the defender may do so instead.

cards.name: Bastion
cards.text: During this players phase 0, this player can send any other non-realm card in play to the Void by razing another realm in this players formation and discarding this realm to the Void.

cards.name: Thorbardin
cards.text: Thorbardin is immune to offensive spells and can only be defended by dwarves. Any dwarf defending this realm can be sent to the abyss to seal its mighty gates. The attacker returns to its pool and the battle ends with no spoils.

cards.name: Quasqueton
cards.text: This realm can only be attacked by champions of base level 5 or less. If the attacking champion is defeated, all attached magic items and artifacts stay with this realm (until it is razed or discarded) and can be used by its future defenders (regardless of world designations for artifacts).

cards.name: Village of Nulb
cards.text: While this realm is in play, the Temple of Elemental Evil cannot be played. If played when the Temple of Elemental Evil is already in play, that player must immediately discard 3 cards at random from his hand.

cards.name: Adventurer's Guild
cards.text: During this players phase 0, this player may return all adventurers from his discard pile to his hand by sending this holding to the Abyss. All of adventurers in play gain 1 level and are immune to thief skills.

cards.name: Castle Moovania
cards.text: This holding can be attached to any realm. Draw 2 extra cards during your draw phase, but your hand size is reduced by 4.

cards.name: Trojan Horse
cards.text: Attach this holding to any realm belonging to another player. The realm may be attacked by any player, regardless of position or restrictions, and each defending champion defends at a -1 from his adjusted level. The attacker chooses who will defend.

cards.name: Mij Reltub, the Spellfire Oracle
cards.text: This champion may be sent to the Void from pool or hand to stop any event or spell that razes or discards realms. The card stopped is also put into the Void.

cards.name: Tagor Migor
cards.text: In combat, this champion may use his chameleon power to make his allies (only) immune to the special power of opposing allies for the remainder of this combat round.

cards.name: The Enchantress
cards.text: Can cast wizard spells. Before combat, only when defending, she can enchant the opposing champion, causing the champion to lose its special powers for the duration of this combat round.

cards.name: Saldon the White
cards.text: This champion can double the level of any card in play once per combat round, even in a combat where he is not involved. Between 6AM and 6PM, he can double the level of any one additional card in a combat in which he is involved.

cards.name: Orcish Shaman
cards.text: Orc. Can cast wizard spells. This champion's Orc tribe counts as a permanent +5 ally for this champion.

cards.name: Aramil of Tusmit
cards.text: This champion is immune to psionic power cards. During combat, Aramil may use his superior mind control powers to steal a just played opposing ally.

cards.name: Dragon Mountain Kobold
cards.text: Limit per deck: Up to the Maximum number of champions per deck. Immune to Rule of the Cosmos. Adjusted level is equal to the number of Dragon Mountain Kobolds in play. If Infryana and Dragon Mountain are in play and belong to the same player, all Dragon Mountain Kobolds in play go to that players pool. If either leave play, then all Kobolds in play are discarded.

cards.name: Luccia
cards.text: Adventurer. Flyer. Can use thief skills. Luccia has a +7 flying griffin mount as her ally and makes Luccia a flyer. She is a great scout, thus when she is in the pool, all adventures may use their special powers (and those of attached cards) first when defending.

cards.name: Mij Draw, the Epitome of Purity and Might
cards.text: If this champion wins a round of combat while attacking, he may look through his draw pile and put into play any (obviously) female champion as a "groupie". If he successfully defends a realm, he gets a number of spoils equal to the number of "groupies" in his pool.

cards.name: Karistyne
cards.text: Adventurer. Can use cleric spells. If owned by a player with at least 3 other adventurers, none of this player's adventurers can be sent to the abyss for any reason by any player (even this one).

cards.name: Silversun
cards.text: Silversun was driven insane in her quest for a balance between good and evil. If she attacks and wins a round of combat, the realm is razed, but she is discarded.

cards.name: Jerome Kazinskaia
cards.text: Jerome does not need permission to cast any cleric spell. During this players turn, Jerome may do one of the following: During phase 3, he may retrieve from his discard pile any non-undead/werebeast ally. Or, during phase 5, he may retrieve any one defensive cleric spell from the discard pile.

cards.name: The Grim Reaper
cards.text: Undead. The number of champions and allies currently in all discard piles and abyss's determines this champion's level.

cards.name: Aria Kyra
cards.text: Halfling. Can use thief skills. Champions of base level 6 or higher cannot defend against this champion.

cards.name: Sarana
cards.text: Immune to offensive wizard spells. This champion can be sent to Limbo until the end of this player's next turn to prevent one non-event card from going to the Abyss.

cards.name: Kiri Allavesse
cards.text: Elf. Can cast wizard spells. If Kiri razes a realm, this player can choose to retrieve (and play) a non- realm card from his discard pile, instead of taking normal spoils.

cards.name: Vargas
cards.text: Dwarf. Earthwalker. Vargas is accompanied by an earthwalking earth elemental ally whose level is twice the number of unrazed realms in play. This ally is immune to the powers of flyers and all their attached cards.

cards.name: Etarkine
cards.text: Adventurer. Halfling. Etarkine is immune to offensive magic items. Before combat, you must play "rock, paper, scissors" with the opponent. The winner wins the round of battle and the loser is discarded. If the game is a draw, the battle continues normally.

cards.name: Gib Ergo
cards.text: Immune to events. No spell may be cast at this champion or at any pool he currently occupies. This player must attack each turn (at least once), or raze one of his own realms.

cards.name: Adamar Session
cards.text: Can use any cleric from any pool as an ally in battle. If victorious in combat, Adamar may retrieve one card from the owning player's discard pile or abyss. Both Adamar and the recovered card are then shuffled into the draw pile.

cards.name: The Devourer
cards.text: This champion must attack on the owning players' turn or be sent to the abyss. It is immune to all cards that prevent attacks from occurring and the powers of all realms and holdings. If the Devourer wins a round of combat, the owning player may send one champion in any players' pool to the abyss.

cards.name: Ba'Thrang
cards.text: If this champion attacks a realm that has the capability to defend itself, he can psionically force the realm champion to defend against him in battle. (off)

cards.name: Morgan Rynes
cards.text: May cast defensive Cleric spells. After a winning a round of combat, Morgan may choose to show mercy upon the defeated champion, letting the champion return to his pool with all attached cards. Morgan then may draw one card for each card the goes back to the opponents pool (not as spoils).

cards.name: Otiluke
cards.text: Gains 4 levels after being declared as an attacker or defender. All spells cast by Otiluke with a numerical bonus are doubled in level. If Otiluke draws a wizard spell as spoils, he may cast that spell and then draw the next card as spoils also.

cards.name: Nystul
cards.text: Once per turn, Nystul may cast a +7 Radiant Arch (4/off) into battle to aid another champion, discarding one ALREADY attached card of Nystul's choice. Nystul's ability at disguise allows him to ignore any cards that defeat or discard wizards.

cards.name: Jallazari Sallavarian
cards.text: During combat over a Greyhawk realm, she may use any Greyhawk champion as an ally. Jallazari goes to limbo if defeated defending a GH realm, returning at the end of the owning players next turn.

cards.name: Treemon Crosse
cards.text: Elf. Can use Hero Unarmed Combat cards and thief skills. Treemon, a master infiltrator, can always see any pool that is face down. Before battle as a defender only, Treemon can send the attacking champion back to its pool and choose a different champion to attack instead.

cards.name: Torgo, the Mad Scientist's Assistant
cards.text: During phase 3, while this champion is in play, any two allies can be combined (levels added together) into a single monster champion. This champion keeps the powers of the allies as its own. Any champions formed this way stay in play even if Torgo leaves play.

cards.name: Unavailing Sacrifice
cards.text: Play this event after a player has discarded or put a card into the abyss in order to perform or activate a special power. The power granted by the "discard" is wasted. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Gathering
cards.text: When played, this player may search his deck for up to 10 levels of non-avatar champions (4 maximum) and place them in his hand. (Helpful)

cards.name: Pangea Effect
cards.text: All dungeon cards in play move clockwise one player. Players my discard a wizard during their phase 3 to move them again in the same direction. This event remains in play until canceled. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dragons Turn the Tide
cards.text: If a dragon razes a realm though combat, that player's champion may immediately rebuild one of his own realms. This event lasts until the end of the event player's next turn. (Helpful)

cards.name: An Eye for an Eye!
cards.text: An opponent who just forced a discard of one (or more) of this players champions or realms, must now discard the same amount and same type as those discarded, chosen by this player. This card may not be duplicated, deflected, or canceled. (harmful)

cards.name: The Apocalypse
cards.text: Each player chooses one of each card type that they have in play, if any. All other cards in play are discarded regardless of any special powers that they may have (including Chernivik). Players then reshuffle their hands, draw piles and discard piles into a new draw pile and draw 5 new cards. Cannot be canceled, calmed, duplicated, or EDT'd. This event can only be played once per game. (Harmful)

cards.name: A Good Defense
cards.text: This event cannot be used by a player with the Azure Tower of Onad the Fallen in play. All abilities and cards owned by this player are considered defensive (or helpful). This event lasts until negated. (Helpful)

cards.name: Cheat!!!
cards.text: The player of this event can choose one of the following 3 effects: a) Draw 2 cards. (Helpful) b) Look at all hands and discard 1 card from each (even his own). (Harmful) c) All players may unraze one realm, then this player can unraze another of his choosing, but only if everyone unrazes a realm. (Helpful)

cards.name: Hall of King Snurre the Fire Giant
cards.text: All of this player's giants gain 4 levels. Allies of icon level +4 or less cannot be played against this player's giants.

cards.name: Level Playing Field
cards.text: This player is not effected by any cards that cause instant defeats or by any cards that require permission to use cards.

cards.name: The Guild of Adventurers
cards.text: If this player has an adventurer discarded outside of combat, he may replace it by searching for any adventurer in his deck and put it into his pool.

cards.name: Spite and Malice
cards.text: When played, all players name one other card. The named cards have no special power while this rule card is in play.

cards.name: Out of Phase
cards.text: Played at the beginning of this player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until another rule card is played. Each player may exchange up to 2 phases of his current turn (phases 1, 2, and/or 3 only) for an additional phase 4 for each phase given up. Each phase 4 ends when a spoils is drawn by the acting player, the attacking champion is defeated in combat, or card play causes the round of combat to end in a draw. Spoils are drawn normally during each phase 4.

cards.name: Tymora's Coin
cards.text: This player is immune to "A Sure Thing" rule card. When forced to draw and discard noting the last digit, this player may look at his top 3 cards of his draw pile and choose which one to use.

cards.name: Staff of Mishakal
cards.text: Usable only by clerics of any world. During phase 5, if this champion did not attack, the staff resurrects one champion from either the Abyss to the discard pile, or from the discard pile to the draw pile, which is then reshuffled.

cards.name: The Shield Tree
cards.text: May only be attached to any Dragonlance realm. During this players phase 0, you MUST discard a champion or ally from your pool or hand or the Shield Tree is discarded. The attached realm and any champion defending this realm is immune to the special powers of all offensive cards.

cards.name: Holy Symbol
cards.text: Usable only by any cleric. During combat, subtract the base level of this champion from the base level of any one undead in play. If the undead champion or ally drops below level 0 it is discarded. (off)

cards.name: Monacle of Bagthalos
cards.text: No pool is considered hidden for this player. Any choices at a "face down" pool are made face up to this player. Once during each opposing players turn, this champion can halve the base level (round down) of any champion during a combat in which this player is not involved. (Off)

cards.name: The Tomes of Spellfire
cards.text: Usable by champions of any world. When the attached champion is victorious in a round of battle, this player may shuffle and cut any players draw pile, then look at the top three cards and remove one to the abyss. (Off)

cards.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
cards.text: In a combat round, this enchanted wand allows the attached champion to activate his powers and attachments first. (def)

cards.name: Scarab of Death
cards.text: When the attached champion is defeated, this magic item attaches to the opposing champion. That champion's player draws and discards a card, noting the cards last digit. The opposing champion is discarded to the abyss after that many turns (or immediately if the player doesn't or cannot draw and discard a card), unless he can discard the scarab. This magic item returns to the original owners discard pile when discarded. (def)

cards.name: Nosrenda's Amulet
cards.text: While this magic item is in play, no card maybe duplicated, copied, or imitated. (def)

cards.name: Bandage
cards.text: This magic item may also be played onto a champion that has just lost a combat for any reason. The attached champion goes back to its pool with all attachments (including allies). Then this magic item is discarded. (def)

cards.name: Murlynd's Spoon
cards.text: This magic item cannot be discarded by an opponent, or by any card an opponent controls. (Def)

cards.name: Mystical Orb of the Black Eight
cards.text: Can be attached to any champion regardless of world restrictions. This artifact of random answers also gives an opposing champion a level bonus equal to the last digit of the last card played into battle, on either side. This power and the level bonus are defensive in nature.

cards.name: Ogre's Horned Helm
cards.text: This magic item may be discarded from the hand or pool to cancel a just played counter effect card. This power even works on Enter Darkness Together, but then it goes to the abyss. (def)

cards.name: Orb of Delight
cards.text: During phase 3 or 5 (but not both in the same turn), this player can return to his hand from the discard pile any two non-undead allies.

cards.name: Atonement
cards.text: Place this card and the caster into the abyss, then take any other card from your abyss and put it into play. (def)

cards.name: Reincarnate
cards.text: This spell returns any one non-avatar champion from your discard pile to your pool, but changes the icon of the returned champion to that other than the one shown on the card. The casting player chooses the new icon. The other abilities of the returned champion are unchanged.

cards.name: Stoneskin
cards.text: May be cast at any time to counter any just played unarmed combat card, and makes the champion immune to unarmed combat cards for the duration of that combat round.

cards.name: Gen
cards.text: Can only be attached to a wizard, to whom it becomes a familiar. Once attached, Gen MAY search this players draw pile for any spell that can be cast during phase 4. The spell must be shown to all players. After retrieving the spell, the Gen is then shuffled back into the draw pile.

cards.name: The King's Justice
cards.text: Lasts until dispelled. If a thief skill is used while this ability is in play, the thief using the skill is sent to limbo until this ability is dispelled.

cards.name: Gate
cards.text: The caster can use any champion (except an avatar) from another player's draw or discard pile as an ally for this round of combat. At the end of the round, this champion/ally is sent to Limbo until the end of the actual owner's next turn. (off/4)

cards.name: Repentance
cards.text: Can be cast at any time to negate a thief skill. If used on a just played thief skill, the thief attempting to use the skill is discarded. (def)

cards.name: Time Travel
cards.text: This player can take another turn after his current turn is finished, starting with his phase 3 (skipping phases, 0, 1, and 2). This card is placed in the Void after its successful use. If canceled, it goes to the discard pile. (def/5)

cards.name: Double Cross
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Play in response to another Offensive Thief skill to turn that skill back upon the original player.

cards.name: Slap!
cards.text: Usable by non-spell casting champions. This maneuver disrupts the concentration of any champion, canceling the effects of a just played spell, blood ability, psionic power, or thief skill.

cards.name: Permanency
cards.text: Cast this spell on a spell with a stated duration, which then becomes permanent. The original spell cannot be dispelled until this spell is dispelled. Permanency can always be dispelled, regardless of special powers. The caster of this spell cannot be used again until the end of the owning players next turn. (def)

cards.name: Contingency
cards.text: When this spell is cast, this champion can retrieve any spell that can be cast in phase 4 and place it underneath the retrieving champion. When he enters a round of combat, this spell is considered cast before combat begins. (def)

cards.name: Tankity-Tankity-Tank
cards.text: Usable by any champion of level base level 7 or higher. This card allows the using champion (if victorious in this round of combat) to steam-roll over the defeated champion to raze the attacked realm. (def)

cards.name: Imaginary Friend
cards.text: This spell creates an ally equal to the base level of the casting champion. This ally may not be stolen or discarded by any means. The ally stays with the champion until dispelled or until the champion is discarded. (Def 3/4)

cards.name: Dispel Illusion
cards.text: This spell may be cast at any time. This spell prevents a card from being played (return it to the players hand). The card is considered to have been "not played", and cannot be played again until that players next turn. (off)

cards.name: Curse
cards.text: This spell causes a magic item or artifact to be cursed. The cursed item no longer has any special powers and any level bonus granted by it is now subtracted from the champion's base level. Any champion reduced to 0 or below are discarded. (Off 3/4)

cards.name: I know what you are thinking!!!
cards.text: While this power is in play, all opponents must now play with their hands face up on the table. This power lasts until negated.

cards.name: White Dragon
cards.text: Dragon. Flyer. Can use dragon unarmed combat cards. This ally's breath weapon, a cone of cold, causes all magic items currently in the battle to break and be discarded.

cards.name: Soth's Steed
cards.text: Undead. Flyer. May breathe fire to discard one ally or magic item of +5 or less currently in combat. If played with Lord Soth, this ally doubles in level and cannot be discarded or forced to switch sides, returning to the pool with Lord Soth at the end of combat.

cards.name: Mimic
cards.text: During combat, this ally can copy any one magical item or artifact attached to the opposing champion.

cards.name: Mina's Knights
cards.text: May play hero unarmed combat cards. If played with a cleric, this ally cannot be forced to switch sides and are only discarded if the cleric is discarded also.

cards.name: Stool Pigeon
cards.text: When played in combat, an opposing thief champion is defeated and sent to the abyss.

cards.name: Gloomwing
cards.text: Flyer. Because of its shimmering markings, an opposing champion is confused and loses the use any special abilities and its icon ability during this round of combat.

cards.name: Knights of Neraka
cards.text: This army is equal in level to the attached champion's base level.

cards.name: Improved Initiative
cards.text: Play this card when both attacker and defender have been chosen. The player of this card activates all of their cards first. (def/4)

cards.name: Hostage
cards.text: Play on any champion in any opponent's pool before a defender is chosen. If the attacker doesn't halt the attack, the hostage is sent to the discard pile. (off/4)

cards.name: Mercenaries
cards.text: One card from this player's hand must be discarded to purchase the service of the mercenaries. When played, the player can choose any one type of support card that can be played by them.

cards.name: Entrapment
cards.text: Play at any time to cancel a just played thief skill and send its user to the discard pile. (def) Can be played during phase 3 or 5 to send one thief champion to Limbo. (Off)

cards.name: Behir
cards.text: Earthwalker. During combat, this ally can release a bolt of lightning that renders the opposing champions magical items powerless for this round of combat.

cards.name: Claws of the Wolf
cards.text: Stays with the champion until dispelled or the champion is defeated. This champion can discard one opposing ally of level 7 or less. (Off /3/4)

cards.name: A Piece of the Action
cards.text: Play only when another player is to draw a spoils of victory. That player must draw and discard his spoils, while this player draws a card showing it to all players. If it is a realm card, it is sent to the Abyss. Otherwise it may be played just like a spoils of victory.

cards.name: Duergar
cards.text: Dwarf. The next card played by the opponent that is not defensive, loses its special power and level bonus (discarding Leber). May also be discarded from hand to negate the effects of the Blamblower.

cards.name: Mountain Dwarf
cards.text: Earthwalker. Automatically defeats a monster if attached to a hero. Automatically defeats an undead if attached to a cleric.

cards.name: Ranger of the Highlands
cards.text: No more than one card of any type can be played against the attached champion.

cards.name: Olive Slime
cards.text: When played into combat, discard all the attached cards currently in battle on both sides, and only Olive Slime remains.

cards.name: Locust Plague
cards.text: Earthwalker. Play on an opposing realm during phase 3. Acts as an ally for any champion attacking the realm. Stays with razed realm, if not discarded through combat, which cannot be rebuilt while Locust Plague is attached to it.

cards.name: Bumbling Idiot
cards.text: Can be played into any combat on any champion. The champion and all of its attached cards (except this one) lose all abilities.

cards.name: Death Knight
cards.text: When played, discards an ally already in play. If attached to an attacking champion who is defeated in combat, Death Knight becomes a level 8 undead monster champion who returns to its controller's pool.

cards.name: Aurumvorax
cards.text: Earthwalker. For each card played into combat by the opponent, roll 2d4 and add that number to the level of this ally.

cards.name: Crypt Thing
cards.text: Can only be attached during phase 3 to a realm with a holding. Cannot be discarded during combat by another player. May be discarded at any time to send an opposing champion attacking the attached realm to Limbo.

cards.name: Shrieker
cards.text: Can only be attached during phase 3 to an Underdark realm. This fungus alerts defenders, allowing them to activate their powers first. "When attacking" and "Before combat" powers of champions owned by opponents do not work while this ally is in play.

cards.name: Blink Dog
cards.text: May be played into a combat where this player is not involved. When played into combat, roll 2d4 for the level of this ally. Can blink back to its owner's hand at any time, before combat ends.

cards.name: Reef Giant
cards.text: Gains 6 levels if in combat over a coastal realm. All non-swimming champions and allies in combat against the Reef Giant lose 2 levels.

cards.name: Desert Giant
cards.text: Gains 5 levels if in combat over a Dark Sun realm. All swimming champions and allies in combat against the Desert Giant lose 2 levels.

cards.name: Feinoue, Void Shaper
cards.text: If Feinoue wins a round of battle, he can either randomly draw one card from the opponents draw pile to send to the Void and then he goes to limbo for 1d10 turn; or he can search the opponents deck for one card and send it to the Void and he then goes to the Void also.

cards.name: Cooshie
cards.text: Gains 6 levels if allied with an elf. Can be attached during phase 3 to any elf champion, staying with the champion until defeated or discarded during combat.

cards.name: Phoenix
cards.text: Flyer. During phase 0, if this ally is in the discard pile, roll 2d6. If doubles are rolled, put this ally into the abyss, otherwise return this ally to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text: Flyer. When this ally is played, roll 2d6. If the roll is higher than the opposing champion's base level, that champion is turned to stone and sent to the abyss. If equal to the opponent's base level, this ally is turned to stone and sent to the abyss.

cards.name: Solrac
cards.text: Can be discarded from combat or hand to cancel a just played thief skill or blood ability.

cards.name: Defilers Crown
cards.text: Whenever any player casts an offensive spell, he must raze a realm in his own formation. If a realm cannot be razed, then the spell may not be cast.

cards.name: Gamblin'
cards.text: Choose 3 champions of a single opponent and shuffle them, leaving the attachments behind. Have that opponent name one of the champions, who must be selected by picking a card at random. If correctly picked, all three are returned, if not, the two non-selected champions are discarded. (Off 3)

cards.name: Doomgrinder
cards.text: When Doomgrinder is in play, any cards that make any player draw more (or less) cards than anyone else are discarded and none may be played either.

cards.name: Rigged Dice
cards.text: Playable at anytime before there is a die (or dice) roll to be made. The player of this skill chooses the results of the roll instead of an actual roll. (Off)

cards.name: Strahd's Medallion
cards.text: This artifact transforms the attached champion into a flying, undead vampire. If attached to Strahd, all of this players champions become flying, undead vampires.

cards.name: Jail Break
cards.text: May be played at any time to return all champions and allies that are controlled by another player, back to their original owners. Discard any cards that are attached to them. (Def)

cards.name: Egg of Emulation
cards.text: The Egg may be used at any time to negate any event (sending the egg to the discard pile). If the negated event was harmful, this player may smash the Egg (sending it to the abyss instead) to make a copy of the negated event.

cards.name: Under Handed Deal
cards.text: Playable when this player is forced to discard cards by an opponent. Instead, this player now draws the amount of cards that would have been discarded. (Def)

cards.name: Treasures of Netheril
cards.text: During this player's phase 0, this player must roll 1d4 and perform the following: 1) Search for one ally in their draw pile. Show it and place it into their hand. 2) As 1, but for a magic item or artifact. 3) Move to phase 2 skipping phase 1. 4) Shuffle any one card in any discard pile into its owners draw pile.

cards.name: Crown of Dragon Royalty
cards.text: Usable only by any dragon champion. The crown grants the wearer immunity to offensive spells, blood abilities, and thief skills. If used by a dragon avatar, the immunities extend to all dragon champions in the player's pool.

cards.name: Corruption
cards.text: Usable only by Awnshegh. Place a champion in another player's pool in yours with this card attached. The corrupted champion remains under this players control until either it or Corruption is discarded. (Off 3)

cards.name: Bloodstone of Fistandantilus
cards.text: Can only be attached to any wizard. If the wizard using this artifact wins a round of battle, he can take the special power of the opposing champion, if it went to the discard pile. The power is additional to his own.

cards.name: Absorb Spell
cards.text: May be played at any time. This card makes the user of this blood ability the target of an offensive spell. Both the user of this ability and the spell are sent to the abyss. (Def)

cards.name: Madame Griselda's Tarroka Deck
cards.text: Every time this artifact goes into battle, draw a card for a bonus (place it underneath). If the last digit is a 9, discard the attached champion. Otherwise, the total bonus of the deck is equal to 2 plus the sum of last digits of all cards under the deck. If the deck leaves play, all of the cards under it (including events) go to the discard pile.

cards.name: Law & Order
cards.text: Playable at any time to cancel a just played thief skill. The player of the thief skill must discard one card from hand, pool, or formation for each thief in his pool. (Def)

cards.name: The Forgotten Idol
cards.text: When entering combat, the attached champion may use the idol's influence to have one champion from any pool battle instead. Win or lose, the stolen champion and the Idol are discarded after combat.

cards.name: Desperate Consultation
cards.text: Roll 1d6 for the bonus of this card. If the die value is greater than the number of cards in your hand, draw that many cards. (Def/4)

cards.name: Ring of Displacement
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Whenever any player draws extra cards (beyond the 3 allowed for their draw phase and spoils), they must also discard an equal number from hand, pool, or formation.

cards.name: Sacred Flame
cards.text: The cleansing power of the fire allows this player to remove any card currently attached to any champion, regardless of special powers. (Off 3/5)

cards.name: Consequence
cards.text: All cards that say "copy", "copies", "imitates", "imitate", "mimic", "mimics", "duplicate" or "duplicates" are discarded. (Off 3/4)

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text: Take any non-avatar champion in ANY discard pile, and place it into your pool with this spell attached. The attached champion loses 2 levels. Discard this champion if this spell leaves play for any reason. (Off 3)

cards.name: Magic Font
cards.text: This spell stays in play until dispelled or negated. Pools cannot be hidden from this player. (Def 3)

cards.name: Amish Nick
cards.text: Can cast wizard spells. Immune to the powers of all cards from card sets made after Forgotten Realms. He cannot use them either.

cards.name: Withdraw
cards.text: If about to be defeated or discarded as the result of combat, the champion may cast this spell to return to his pool with attachments. (Def 4)

cards.name: Dispel Evil
cards.text: Discard any monster in play, regardless of special powers. (Off 3/4)

cards.name: Unholy Word
cards.text: Send any hero to the abyss, regardless of special powers. (Off 3/4)

cards.name: Animate Object
cards.text: Play with a magic item or artifact into your pool. The object is now a champion (hero) with a level equal to its icon bonus (no bonus is level 0). The champion keeps its special powers, but it is still considered a magic item or artifact. (Def 3)

cards.name: Turncoat!!!
cards.text: Choose a champion in play. The owner of that champion rolls a 2d4. They must choose and discard that many cards from hand, pool or formation to keep that champion. Otherwise, the owning player must place that champion into any other player's pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Insanely Good Fortune
cards.text: Play on another player's event card. If played on a helpful event, negate the event. If played on "Unusually Good Fortune", negate the event, both players then draw 6 cards, and the other player then randomly discards his hand down to 2 cards.

cards.name: Conspiracy!
cards.text: All players write down a champion that they think should be discarded. The results are revealed and the champion with the highest vote total is discarded (regardless of special powers). If the results are tied, all champions in the tie are discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Barracks of the City of Greyhawk
cards.text: During combat, this player's allies cannot be discarded or forced to switch sides. If victorious, one ally used in battle can be returned to the hand.

cards.name: Kamikaze!
cards.text: Usable only when attacking. The attacking champion charges without fear, discarding all champions involved in the combat to the discard pile, and razing the realm (with no spoils). (Harmful)

cards.name: Two Fisted Player
cards.text: This player draws one less card per turn, but his hand size is increase to 12 and is immune to all cards and abilities that would cause cards to be discarded from his hand.

cards.name: Kender Taunting
cards.text: Force two champions to attack you during their owners' next phase 4. If they cannot attack, both champions are discarded. If the first champion to attack is defeated or razes the realm, the second is not discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: Great Depression
cards.text: Each player must discard a 1d4 magic item(s) and/or artifact(s), or discard all non-thieves in their pool. If there is a regent in a pool, that pool requires a discard of 2d4 magic item(s) and/or artifact(s) instead. (Harmful)

cards.name: A Horrible Mistake
cards.text: Play whenever an opponent copies another card. Both cards are discarded to the abyss. If the opponent owns both cards, then that player must also draw and discard two cards from their draw pile to the abyss. (Harmful)

cards.name: Fedifensor
cards.text: Sword. When in battle against a thief, the thief is halved in current level and may not play thief skills. May be discarded from the pool to counter a just played thief skill. (Off)

cards.name: Ariakan
cards.text: All of this player's realms can defend themselves as level 5 champions. If the realm can already defend itself, the realm champion gets a +5 to its adjusted level.

cards.name: Cloak of Protection
cards.text: During phase 3, this player may elect the attached champion to be immune to the powers of one card type (cleric spell, blood ability, ally, etc.). Cannot be used by a champion with the word immune in his power. (Def)

cards.name: Club of Bashing
cards.text: Usable only by giants. May be discarded during battle to subtract the base level of the attached champion from the adjusted level of the opposing champion. If the new adjusted level is below zero, the opposing champion is discarded. (Off)

cards.name: Sling of Seeking
cards.text: When in pool, this champion can sling a rock that kills one giant (champion or ally) in any combat before its power activates.

cards.name: Necklace of Fangs
cards.text: Usable only by clerics. During Phase 4, may enslave any undead champion in play to attack and defend for this player. The champion returns to its owner's pool only if it survives the combat. (Off)

cards.name: Cupid's Arrows
cards.text: Can be discarded at any time from play to send two champions in combat on a romantic trip to limbo. The battle may continue with new champions. (Off)

cards.name: Kronos the Titan
cards.text: Giant. Earthwalker. Swimmer. Can use wizard spells, cleric spells, and psionic power cards. Whenever a monster attacks, it must ask Kronos permission to use its special powers.

cards.name: Chaos Wand
cards.text: Whenever an opponent in combat with the attached champion wants to play a card, the wand's owner picks it randomly from their hand, discarding any cards that are unusable. (Off)

cards.name: Aversion
cards.text: Can only be played by a player who attacked and was defeated. Play onto winning defender. While Aversion remains attached, the champion cannot enter combat with any of this player's champions. (Off 5)

cards.name: Mind Alteration
cards.text: This champion may switch the power of any 2 champions in play. This power lasts until it is negated, or if the champions face each other in battle. (Off 3)

cards.name: Absorb Disease
cards.text: Can be played at any time to redirect the effect of any spell, event or blood ability directed at any other champion of this player, whether in pool or in battle, to the champion using this power. (Def)

cards.name: Poisoned Oasis
cards.text: May be attached to any realm. May be played at any time to skip phases 0 through 5 (inclusive) of a turn following a Caravan.

cards.name: Body Control
cards.text: The using champion gains the special powers and abilities of the opposing champion until the end of this player's next turn. (Def 4)

cards.name: Awe
cards.text: Roll 2d6 when this power is used. If the roll is lower than the using champions base level, the opposing champion loses this round of combat and returns to its pool stripped of all attached cards, regardless of special powers. (Off 4)

cards.name: Ballista Attack
cards.text: Discard an opposing ally already in play, or any champion in any pool. (Off 4)

cards.name: Cannibalize
cards.text: All champions in your pool lose 2 levels until the end of the current turn. The using champion gains 2 levels for each champion in your pool until the end of the current turn. (Def 4)

cards.name: Gellidus, Dragon of Ice
cards.text: Flyer. Gellidus thrives on creation and may use any defensive card. Offensive cards played against Gellidus are doubled in level. If Gellidus and T'chaar are owned by the same player, both may use any offensive and defensive cards and the penalties for doubling cards used against them is negated.

cards.name: Louie the Pit Boss
cards.text: Cannot be the target of any card or power designated as harmful or offensive. May be sent to limbo at any time to have any die (or dice roll) be re-rolled.

cards.name: Gib Nedyah
cards.text: Cannot attack. Can use any unarmed combat card. While defending, may use any one unarmed combat card from any discard pile. Immune to all events (even helpful ones), thief skills, and blood abilities.

cards.name: Inverted Pyramid
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All formations are inverted when this rule card comes into play. The front row now has three realms, the middle row has two, and the back has one.

cards.name: Humility
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. This card is immune to events and the wish spell. All extra cards that are granted by any means (except spoils) are send to limbo and cannot be used while this rule card is in play. If this rule card leaves play, each player who lost one or more cards may roll 1d10 and retrieve all cards with a last digit matching the roll (return those cards to hand). All other cards are not retrieved and send to the discard pile.

cards.name: Hornung's Randomness
cards.text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All cards that require a "Draw and discard noting the last digit", now require that a die roll of 1d10 be used instead.

cards.name: Bansmareton
cards.text: Avatar. Discard a psionic champion to bring Bansmareton into play. Each opponent draws a card when Bansmareton enters play. Immune to psionic attack. Bansmareton psionically teleports all of this players champions and allies, allowing them to attack any realm regardless of position or movement restrictions.

cards.name: Kalator
cards.text: Can cast cleric spells. Immune to offensive thief skills. Any magical item attached to Kalator becomes a Forgotten Realms artifact, discarding from play any magical items with the same name (no more can be played).

cards.name: Wealthy Oriental Vassal
cards.text: Immune to harmful events. When in play, only cards marked as "First Edition" can be played. If the Poor Oriental Lord and this champion are in play at the same time, both go to limbo for 1d10 turns (each champion's owner rolls for their champion).

cards.name: Entropy Shield
cards.text: For every card attached to the opposing champion, the opponent must roll a d10. If the number rolled is even, the attached card is discarded. (Off 4)

cards.name: Dark Cloud
cards.text: This realm negates the powers of Tyr, Arkhold, and Mulmaster.

cards.name: Melf's Acid Arrow
cards.text: May be played into a combat where this player is not involved. Roll 2d6 for the level of this spell when it is cast. If the roll is less than the caster's base level, destroy one ally already in play. (Off 4)

cards.name: The Yatils
cards.text: Magical items cannot be used when attacking this realm. If Mordenkainen is anywhere in play, each defender of this realm gains a +9 ally able to cast wizard and cleric spells.

cards.name: Control Weather
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, your realms can only be attacked by earthwalkers, "teleporters", or through Underdark realms. (Def 5)

cards.name: Assembre
cards.text: This realm has a gate to Krynn hidden within its vineyards. Once per battle, you may search your deck for a Dragonlance champion and place it into your pool.

cards.name: Polymorph, Any Object
cards.text: Change any one attachment (anywhere in play) into an attachment with a +1d4 and no special abilities. Lasts until dispelled or negated. (Off 3/4)

cards.name: Elven Towers
cards.text: This realm can never be rebuilt. Due to its high resistance to magic, this player is immune to the effects to other player's dungeon cards.

cards.name: Leomund's Secure Shelter
cards.text: This player's pool cannot be the target of harmful events or offensive spells. Lasts until dispelled or negated. (Def 3)

cards.name: Knee to the Groin
cards.text: Usable by any champion. May not be used on dragons. The opposing champion must either retreat to his pool from battle (treat as a defeat) or continue at half of his base level (opponent's choice). (Off 4)

cards.name: Stomp!
cards.text: Usable only by giants. Kills all allies in play of icon level 5 or less. (Off 4)

cards.name: Heaven & Earth
cards.text: Usable also by any adventurer. Roll 1d6 for the bonus of this card. (Off 4) May also be played at any time in response to any card played by a champion of lower base level. That card is negated and this player draws a card.

cards.name: Tsuki Kotegaeshi
cards.text: Usable also by any adventurer. Play on an opposing champion whose player must draw (face up) the top two cards from their draw pile. If neither can be played into battle, discard the cards along with the opposing champion. (Off 4)

cards.name: Headbutt
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Roll 2d6 for the bonus of this card, and 1d4 for a bonus to the opposing champion if the user is not a monster. Spells and psionics cannot be used by either champion for the remainder of this round of combat. (Off 4)

cards.name: Roundhouse
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Roll 3d6 for the bonus of this card. This champion may not play any more cards that are designated as Defensive. (Off 4)

cards.name: Trip
cards.text: Usable by any champion. Sends one of the opposing champion's allies to the discard pile, regardless of immunities and before its powers activate. (Off 4)

cards.name: Stunning Fist
cards.text: If this champion is winning by more than 8 immediately after this card is played into battle, then the opposing champion is instantly defeated. (Off 4)

cards.name: Whirling Dervish
cards.text: The using champion ignores any instant defeat conditions and must be defeated by level alone. May be played as a counter to an instant defeat. (Def 4)

cards.name: Waterdeep
cards.text: Any champion can use wizard spells when defending Waterdeep.

cards.name: Menzoberranzan
cards.text: Can be played at any time. Immune to flyers.

cards.name: Zhentil Keep
cards.text: Zhentil Keep can defend itself as a level 5 cleric.

cards.name: Shadowdale
cards.text: Any champion can cast cleric and wizard spells when defending Shadowdale.

cards.name: Moonshae Isles
cards.text: The Moonshaes can defend themselves as a level 2 hero. All defending allies gain 3 levels.

cards.name: Thay
cards.text: Any champion can use wizard spells when defending Thay.

cards.name: Pirate Isles
cards.text: Flyers cannot attack this realm.

cards.name: Ravens Bluff
cards.text: Any champion can use wizard spells when defending Ravens Bluff.

cards.name: The Great Rift
cards.text: Flyers cannot attack this realm.

cards.name: Myth Drannor
cards.text: Any champion can use wizard spells when defending Myth Drannor. Increases player's maximum hand by one.

cards.name: Jungles of Chult
cards.text: Chult can defend itself as a level 5 monster.

cards.name: Sword Coast
cards.text: The defending player can return one ally to his hand after each round of battle.

cards.name: Anauroch
cards.text: All attackers lose one level.

cards.name: Impiltur
cards.text: All champions and allies who defend Impiltur gain 1 level.

cards.name: Icewind Dale
cards.text: The attacking champion must discard one magical item chosen by the defender.

cards.name: The High Moor
cards.text: Any defending monster gains 4 levels.

cards.name: Damara
cards.text: Double the level of a defending Forgotten Realms champion.

cards.name: Dragonspear Castle
cards.text: All allies of a defending monster gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Daggerdale
cards.text: Allies cannot be used when attacking this realm.

cards.name: Darkhold
cards.text: All defenders of Darkhold gain 2 levels if Zhentil Keep is in play anywhere.

cards.name: Haunted Hall of Eveningstar
cards.text: Draw one card and place it in your hand when this realm is played or rebuilt.

cards.name: Evermeet
cards.text: Any champion can use wiizard spells when defending Evermeet. Flyers cannot attack.

cards.name: Berdusk
cards.text: A wizard or cleric gains 3 levels when defending the attached realm.

cards.name: Tantras
cards.text: No spells can be cast when attacking or defending Tantras.

cards.name: Mulmaster
cards.text: Draw another card every time a spell card is played.

cards.name: Hillsfar
cards.text: Any champion gains 3 levels when defending the attached realm.

cards.name: Suzail
cards.text: Any champion can cast wizard spells when defending the attached realm. If attached to Cormyr, all defenders also gain 4 levels.

cards.name: Arabel
cards.text: The attached realm can defend itself as a level 4 monster.

cards.name: Fortifications
cards.text: Each defender of the attached realm gains 2 levels.

cards.name: Fortifications
cards.text: Each defender of the attached realm gains 3 levels.

cards.name: Selune
cards.text: Undead cannot attack the attached realm.

cards.name: Peasant Militia
cards.text: Each champion and ally attacking the attached realm loses 1 level.

cards.name: Alias the Sell-Sword
cards.text: Immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: King Azoun IV
cards.text: All allies of King Azoun IV gain 1 level.

cards.name: Maligor the Red
cards.text: Once per battle Maligor can shift one opposing ally to his own side.

cards.name: Elminster the Mage
cards.text: Immune to offensive spells.

cards.name: Drizzt Do' Urden
cards.text: When defending, Drizzt must be defeated twice in one battle before he is discarded.

cards.name: Midnight, Goddess of Magic
cards.text: If only one Midnight is in play, wizards cannot cast spells without her permission. She also destroys all magical items held by the opposing champion.

cards.name: Torg Mac Cei, the Ironlord
cards.text: Torg's level is doubled when defending or attacking the Great Rift.

cards.name: The Pereghost
cards.text: All the pereghost's allies gain 2 levels.

cards.name: Bruenor Battlehammer
cards.text: Bruenor gains 2 levels when fighting a monster.

cards.name: Marco Volo
cards.text: At the start of the player's turn, he can look at the top card of any draw pile and discard it if he wants.

cards.name: The Harpers
cards.text: The Harpers can cast wizard and cleric spells, but the player must choose one type (wizard or cleric) in each battle when this card is used.

cards.name: Adventurers!
cards.text: Can use cleric and wizard spells.

cards.name: Crime Lord
cards.text: The Crime Lord can also be played as an event to destroy one holding. The destroyed holding and the Crime Lord are discarded.

cards.name: Adventurers
cards.text: All allies of these adventurers gain 1 level.

cards.name: The Jotunslayers
cards.text: The Jotunslayers are level 8 if the opposing champion is a monster.

cards.name: Myrmidons
cards.text: When the myrmidons are discarded, the player shuffles all discards back into the draw deck.

cards.name: Pteranadon
cards.text: The Pteranadon gains 3 levels when defending Chult.

cards.name: Gorgosaurus
cards.text: The Gorgosaurus gains 3 levels when defending Chult.

cards.name: Greater Feyr
cards.text: The first enemy ally played against the feyr in each battle is discarded immediately.

cards.name: Cleric of Mask
cards.text: This card and attached magical items and artifact are kept face down, and revealed only in battle.

cards.name: Drow Matron

cards.text: The caster can ask any player for his largest undead ally card and use it in this round of battle. The ally is discarded afterward. (Off/4)

cards.name: Finger of Death
cards.text: Kills any one champion or ally of level 5 or less. (Off/4)

cards.name: Spell Turning
cards.text: Turns a just-cast spell back at its caster, as if the original target had cast it. (Def/3/4)

cards.name: Ancient Curse
cards.text: Choose one champion with an attached artifact or magical item to be killed immediately. Discard the champion and his possessions.

cards.name: Calm
cards.text: This magical calm undoes the harmful effect of an event, but only for the player of this card.

cards.name: The Vast Swamp
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 9 undead wizard. Nonflying attackers are at half their adjusted level (rounded down).

cards.name: The Bandit Kingdoms
cards.text: Thieves defending this realm gain 2 levels for every attached card.

cards.name: Mintarn
cards.text: Can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers. Whenever a thief in this player's pool is to be discarded outside of combat, it instead goes to Limbo, returning at the end of this player's next turn.

cards.name: Nelanther
cards.text: Can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers. Nelanther has a powerful pirate navy. All champions and allies attacking any realm by swimming must discard a magical item from their hand or pool or return to their pool immediately.

cards.name: Falkovnia
cards.text: Because of the poisonous nature of this realm, if Falkovnia is razed, all the champions who attacked it that turn must be discarded.

cards.name: Richemulot
cards.text: Can defend itself as a level 7 werebeast (monster) that can use thief skills.

cards.name: Cromlin
cards.text: While Cromlin is in play, this player may freely exchange magical items and artifacts between the champions in his pool and his hand in Phase 3.

cards.name: UnderCerilia
cards.text: Underdark. This realm extends under opponents' Birthright realms, allowing them to be attacked by this player's champions and allies, regardless of position or restrictions.

cards.name: The Vampire's Realm
cards.text: This realm is protected by a great swarm of bats that attack all nonearthwalking champions, reducing their adjusted levels by half (rounded down).

cards.name: Thieves' Guild
cards.text: Draw a card whenever a thief skill card is played.

cards.name: Haunted Graveyard
cards.text: Act as a +6 ghost ally (undead). This ghost is so terrifying that only undead allies and events may be played to attack the attached realm after the attacking champion has been sent forward. Items attached before battle function normally.

cards.name: Guild Shop
cards.text: This player's thieves can swim or earthwalk as needed. They ignore all wall spells.

cards.name: Forgotten Crypt
cards.text: Any champion attacking this realm is discarded at the end of combat, whether he wins or loses. Undead are immune to this holding.

cards.name: Assassin's Guild
cards.text: When the Guild is in play, each turn this player may discard a champion from his pool, forcing an opposing player to discard a champion from pool or hand to the Abyss.

cards.name: The Pristine Tower
cards.text: Champions attacking the attached realm are considered monsters for each round of combat.

cards.name: Giustenal Ruins
cards.text: This player's realms cannot be attacked by psionicists or champions able to use psionic power cards.

cards.name: Hellgate Keep
cards.text: The attached realm, this holding, and its defenders are immune to harmful events and offensive spells. If the Keep is discarded during battle but the realm isn't razed, the attacking champion may draw a card.

cards.name: Cavern of Ancient Knowledge
cards.text: May be attached to any Underdark realm. While the Cavern is in play, all offensive spells cast at this player are reflected back at the casting player. This holding can be attached at any time to reflect a just-cast spell.

cards.name: Paying Your Dues
cards.text: All players who have a thief in battle or in pools must discard one magical item from their hand. If they cannot, they must discard all thieves in their pool. (Harmful)

cards.name: Moonlight Madness
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all undead and werebeasts gain 5 levels and can attack any realm, regardless of position or restrictions. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Boss Wants a Cut
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, all realms, holdings, and artifacts that give another player extra cards are instead given to the event player. (drawn from this player's draw pile) This event cannot be copied or negated. (Harmful)

cards.name: Dawn of the Dead
cards.text: Until the end of this player's next turn, undead champions and allies discarded for any reason are immediately shuffled back into their draw pile. (Helpful)

cards.name: The Long Arm of the Law
cards.text: All thieves in play are immediately sent to Limbo until their players post bail by discarding a card to the Abyss to retrieve each thief. (Harmful)

cards.name: Wail of the Banshee
cards.text: All players must discard a champion from their pool; undead are immune to this event. If a player has no champions in his pool, he must discard two cards from his hand. (Harmful)

cards.name: Complete Surprise
cards.text: Played during combat, this player's champion is doubled in level and no cards other than events can be played by the opposing player. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Black Death
cards.text: All players must draw and discard a card, noting its last digit. That many base levels or more of champions must be discarded from each pool. Players with an undead champion in their pool are immune to this event. (Harmful)

cards.name: Three Card Monte
cards.text: All players draw three cards face up. Realms go to the Abyss. The icon level of all other cards are tallied for each player. The player with the highest number gets to keep his cards; all others are discarded. (Harmful)

cards.name: The Guildmaster
cards.text: Thieves cannot use thief skills without the Guildmaster's permission. He is immune to unarmed combat cards.

cards.name: Artemis Entreri
cards.text: Artemis can use unarmed combat cards usable by heroes, and he gains 5 levels if the opposing champion plays no allies.

cards.name: Daryth of Calimshan
cards.text: Daryth wears a pair of magical gloves that give a +2 bonus to any thief skills used by him.

cards.name: Storm Silverhand
cards.text: Storm can be sent to Limbo at any time, allowing her player to look at an opponent's hand. She returns to the pool at the end of her player's next turn.

cards.name: Jacqueline Renier
cards.text: Werebeast. Opposing champion is automatically defeated unless he can cast spells, or has or can play a magical item or artifact.

cards.name: Ratik Ubel
cards.text: Undead. Immune to offensive spells and harmful events. Ratik can ignore any one magical item played against him.

cards.name: Julio, Master Thief of Haslic
cards.text: If victorious in battle, Julio can return one nonspell card from the discard pile to his player's hand.

cards.name: Turin Deathstalker
cards.text: Undead. Turin carries a dagger of venom that instantly discards allies of +4 or less. He is immune to unarmed combat cards and the special powers of all Forgotten Realms champions.

cards.name: Simpkin "The Weasel" Furzear
cards.text: Halfling. Any magical items attached to champions who oppose Simpkin become Simpkin's for that round of battle. Afterwards they are discarded.

cards.name: Phostrek
cards.text: Halfling; can use psionic power cards. Phostrek is a savage warrior - against nonmonster champions his base level rises to 8.

cards.name: Jamlin
cards.text: Elf. Jamlin must be beaten by 10 or more points in combat to be discarded; if not, he returns to his pool with attached cards.

cards.name: Donval
cards.text: Dwarf; earthwalker. Donval can have any number of attached artifacts from any world. However, he may not use magical items.

cards.name: El-Hadid
cards.text: El-Hadid can use blood abilities. In combat his opponent must choose up to 4 cards he plans to use that round and place them face up in front of him. Only cards from this "minihand" may be used in the battle.

cards.name: Kelda Auslawsen
cards.text: Kelda gains 5 levels against heroes and/or 3 levels if defending a Birthright realm.

cards.name: Moriad
cards.text: Halfling. Moriad is immune to the special powers of undead champions.

cards.name: Uldo Dracobane
cards.text: Elf (drow); earthwalker. If not involved in battle at the end of this player's turn. Uldo may send all cards attached to a dragon champion to the bottom of that player's draw pile. He must attack his next turn or be discarded.

cards.name: Orcus
cards.text: Avatar. Undead. Two undead champions must be discarded to bring Orcus into play. This player's undead gain 5 to their base levels; they may attack at half adjusted level to discard a realm instead of razing it. Orcus's base level is equal to the sum of the base levels of the undead discarded to bring him into play. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Mask
cards.text: Avatar. A thief must be discarded to bring Mask into play. This player's thieves gain 3 to their base levels. Mask may be sent to the Abyss at any time to force all magical items, artifacts, spells, and allies in one player's discard pile to be sent to the Abyss. Limit one avatar per pool.

cards.name: Dancing Sword
cards.text: May also be used as a level 7 hero for one round of combat. If so used, only allies may be played with it. If victorious, it returns to this player's hand or pool. The dancing sword can be involved in two rounds of battle, once as a magical item, once as a champion. (Def)

cards.name: Rod of Zombie Mastery
cards.text: A champion defeated by the rod wielder is not discarded. Instead it is used as an undead ally in this champion's next battle and is discarded afterward. (Off)

cards.name: Whip of Disarming
cards.text: All magical items and artifacts attached to the opposing champions are instantly discarded; no more may be added. (Off)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Dexterity
cards.text: The attached champion can use thief skills. If attached to a thief, anytime there are three or more thief skills are in his discard pile, the player may shuffle his discards back into his draw pile. (Def)

cards.name: Wand of Bone
cards.text: Usable only by undead. The attached champion gains 1 level for every undead champion in play. His undead allies cannot be discarded or forced to switch sides for any reason. (Def)

cards.name: Book of the Dead
cards.text: All undead (and any attached cards) in this player's pool are immune to harmful events and the Wish spell.

cards.name: Heart of Darkness
cards.text: If attached to an undead champion, the bonus becomes +10. This champion can cast wizard spells, and undead champions and allies cannot be used to defend against him.

cards.name: Trumpet of Doom
cards.text: Each turn, draw and discard a card, noting its last digit. Corresponding to the digit, discard all of the following in play; 1-magical items; 2-artifacts; 3-razed realms; 4-holdings; 5-rule cards; 6-flyers, swimmers, earthwalkers; 7-elves, dwarves, halflings; 8-dragons, awnshegh; 9-undead, werebeasts; 0-events.

cards.name: Herald of Mei Lung
